story:
Poetry speaks. Poetry sustains. Poetry transforms.  At Saturnalia Books, our mission is to publish poetry of high merit by new and established writers. We want to push boundaries, challenge language, and feature marginalized perspectives. And we can't do it alone.

Donations to this campaign go to a few exciting projects...

1. Our incredible Spring 2020 titles:
ALL THE GAY SAINTS (Kayleb Rae Candrilli, winner of the 2018 Saturnalia Books Poetry Prize + The Whiting Award)
TAKING THE HOMELESS CENSUS (Alexis Ivy, winner of the 2018 Saturnalia Books Editors Prize)
MY MY (Kristi Maxwell)

2. Our incredible Fall 2020 titles:
PEOPLE YOU MAY KNOW (Michael Robins)
DANGER DAYS (Catherine Pierce)

3. Not one but TWO annual prizes: 
THE SATURNALIA BOOKS POETRY PRIZE (Our 2020 judge is Diane Seuss!)
THE SATURNALIA BOOKS EDITORS PRIZE 

From our 2019 poetry prize submissions, we are thrilled to publish the following titles:
MOTHER BODY (Diamond Forde, winner of the 2019 Saturnalia Books Poetry Prize)
A SLOW GREEN SLEEP (Jonathan Weinert, winner of the 2019 Saturnalia Books Editors Prize)
WHITE LUNG (Kimberly O’Connor, finalist and selected for upcoming publication)

We want to keep publishing poetry in a world that sorely needs it. Will you partner with us?

story:
Que?

O bolseiro de Inditex  arrincará risos sen deixar por elo de concienciar sobre temas de índole social.

O decano de Económicas da Universidade da Coruña morre nun brutal accidente. Guillerme Andrade, bolseiro de Inditex, acode ao comisario Pardo para denunciar a multinacional galega como posible causante da morte de decano. Lucas Pardo decide investigar o caso de maneira reservada. A medida que avanza na investigación, os sospeitosos multiplícanse.

O bolseiro de Inditex amplía as fronteiras da novela policiaca e penetra nas relacións tantas veces treboentas que se crean entre as grandes empresas e a sociedade. O relato, escrito en clave de parodia, presenta conflitos entre nova e vella política, entre Policía Nacional e Garda Civil, entre bolseiros e altos executivos, e entre o cidadán do común e o criminal. A historia vaise nutrindo de sucesos imprevistos que no conseguirán alterar, sen embargo, o equilibrio imperante na comunidade.  

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentamos a Marcelino Fernández Mallo.

Naceu en ano de galernas e franquismo e comezou a traballar antes de cumprir os vinte anos; non conseguiu especializarse en nada e fracasou na súa auténtica vocación, a de influencer. Empeñado en explorar o aquel da diferencia, redactou novelas de distintos estilos, temática e idioma. Amosa o seu orgullo por ter escrito Pallarega e tampouco se arrepinte de A trenza ou Klásicos, en galego, nin de El Danubio no pasa por Buenos Aires ou El émulo de Reginald Perrin, en castelán. Unha certa poetisa cualificouno de «autor desexable» e un crítico valorou Cabilia, o seu único libro de relatos, como «unha bomba atómica»; por fortuna, non causou destrozo ningún.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«O comisario Pardo cambia de coche e leva un axente con el.
          ―Vou identificar os cadáveres ―indícalle a Ríos, e sepáranse por fin. O oficial conduce respectando os sinais, non sente o bafo de urxencia que emana do seu acompañante―. Entre no Polígono e siga as indicacións que dirixen a Inditex.
          Chama entón a Guillerme Andrade.
          ―Espérote en dez minutos á saída das vosas instalacións ―Vese obrigado a mostrarse imperativo―. Na beira da estrada, si.
          Guillerme non sabe como escusarse, tampouco entende as présas. Por sorte, Augusto continúa enfermo así que simplemente se incorpora, avanza cara á porta principal e abandona o recinto sen dar explicacións. Algo se lle ocorrerá no camiño de regreso.
          ―Que sucede, comisario? ―pregúntalle embargado pola ansiedade.
          ―Quero que veñas recoñecer un par de cadáveres.
          Malia o susto que desnaturaliza as faccións do bolseiro e a insistencia das súas preguntas, o comisario resístese a compartir calquera outra información polo momento»

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de O bolseiro de Inditex, que sairía despois á venda.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
This is a great place to purchase your copy/copies of We Can Do This! Thank you for your part in revolutionizing how we work together!

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Something is trying to be born. We can feel it. The old ways of the industrial growth society are crumbling, and the new ways of a life-sustaining civilization are emerging like grass through cracks in the concrete.

Everything we need is already here. 

This book – and this campaign – is about unleashing our immense potential by harnessing the power of “group work” through tried-and-true frameworks for working together better.

What is “group work”? Hold in your mind, if you will, the soul-nourishing quality of a barnraising, the A-ha’s accessed only through deep conversation, or the exhilarating joy of a team in creative flow.

The transformative magic of being in relationship, of collaborating and actively working together to achieve big goals is not only not new, but it’s also the answer to how we move forward, as a society and a species.

Our deepest ailment is our disconnectedness, from self, each other and Life. The challenges we face are too complex for our old “lone wolf” and heroic leader strategies.

This is where my book comes in. We Can Do This! 10 Tools to Unleash Our Collective Genius provides a roadmap for how we can leverage the power of the group to intervene in our stuck systems.

Together, let’s kickstart a movement to transform how we live, work and dream together by getting this book into more hands!

How does the book work?

We Can Do This! works at multiple levels to foster transformation. The book: 

  1. Empowers you and others with the perspectives and distilled wisdom of 10 key frameworks used by professional facilitators and consultants. Applicable at all scales — from self to system — these frameworks are relevant to people from all walks of life, including leaders, change agents, entrepreneurs, bureaucrats, managers, consultants, coaches, frontline workers, teachers, parents… 
  2. Gives groups and teams shared language and ways of navigating through the frustrations and challenges of working with other humans. 
  3. Supports our personal growth and development, and especially bringing us into greater alignment with what is most alive in us, and 
  4. Brings it all together into a tidy "package" that is highly shareable so we can leverage our networks to get these tools into the hands of many many more people — and grow a movement to revolutionize how we work together.

All these levels are important and mutually reinforcing.

What are we crowdfunding? 

Five years ago I wrote a book to share the 10 frameworks that I’ve found most helpful for bringing groups and human systems into greater alignment and health. 

That book is now used in university classrooms, innovation labs and activist hubs. It works! (See below for testimonials.)

Yet people have told me the book needs: 

  • a new title and cover (because people DO judge a book by its cover!) 
  • illustrations to make the ideas more sticky, and
  • explanations for how the frameworks apply at the personal level. 

With your help I will make these changes — creating a revised edition of the book with a new title: We Can Do This! 10 Tools to Unleash Our Collective Genius.

We're kickstarting a movement!

In addition to funding the revisions to the book, this campaign is about:

  • Getting these tools and frameworks out there!
  • Making them accessible and affordable to everyone
  • Kickstarting a movement to revolutionize how we work together and tackle our greatest problems!

So, in addition to seeking funding to help make the book more accessible to more people, I need your help to spread the word.

Please share this campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues. Please also share it through your networks and newsletters, your different circles and communities, and your social media — thinking locally, and also globally.

If you are part of a network working for positive change, please reach out to me. Digital copies of the book will be available free for such networks!

We face immense problems in our institutions, businesses, and organizations — and think of the larger global challenges that demand we work together. Using these tools and techniques can turn the tides… They can help us harness our collective genius and find our way through to a world that works for people and planet.  

We Can Do This!

What will our dollars cover? 

I need your backing to cover the costs of producing a new version of the book (i.e. not the writing!). Project costs include:

  • Cover design 
  • Editing 
  • Copy editing 
  • Page layout
  • Illustrations
  • Uploading the digital files to the printer

What happens when we hit our crowdfunding goal? 

Once the book revisions are funded, then we can start to add video to our toolbox to help get these frameworks into the hands of more people for even greater impact. 

More about the book

We Can Do This! introduces a complementary set of 10 frameworks, including: 

  • Appreciative Inquiry
  • Trust Theory
  • Chaordic Design 
  • Generative Dialogue 
  • Adaptive Cycle 
  • Enterprise Facilitation 
  • Theory U 
  • Process Oriented Psychology 
  • Integral Theory 
  • Conscious Co-Creation

Each framework is summarized from the perspective of what is most useful in the field: the framework in a nutshell, its origin, a story of the framework in action, how it applies at the personal level (new!), finer points, possible pitfalls and finally key questions as a short cut to drawing out the insights of that framework. Icons support the reader to see connections between the different frameworks. 

You can see a sample chapter here.

The tools offer complementary perspectives and pointers, each focused on different aspects of how humans are together. Just as carpenters need hammers, screwdrivers, measuring tape, drills, sandpaper and so on, no one tool can do it all, but all together they support effective action. 

A toolkit to mobilize Barefoot Facilitators

Ever since I was a kid, I’ve been inspired by the idea of Barefoot Doctors. In China in the mid-60s, there was little access to medical care in rural areas, and not enough resources to supply fully trained doctors. Instead, 30,000 villagers were trained in basic Western and Chinese medicine — enough to treat common ailments, and to share information about hygiene, family planning, and prevention of epidemics. Almost overnight, this important innovation revolutionized health outcomes in rural China.

By analogy, we do not have resources or capacity to supply professional facilitators to all the meetings and group endeavours supporting the great shifts underway. There are, however, thousands of people in all walks of life working to facilitate deep and lasting change in the human systems of which they are a part. 

This campaign is about giving tools to "Barefoot Facilitators", so people like you — embedded in meetings, teams, networks, companies and bureaucracies (along with families and communities) — have the confidence to intervene, and the capacity to do so effectively! 

The book in action 

The first edition of the book, Make Light Work in Groups: 10 Tools to Transform Meetings, Companies and Communities,(2012), has been tried and tested:

  • Core Text for the MA in Global Leadership at Royal Roads University, Canada and SFU's Certificate in Social Innovation. 
  • Required text for "Creativity and Leadership in Groups” at Kwantlen Polytechnic University
  • Pivotal resource used to shift teams at BC's Provincial Health Services Authority from PowerPoints to participatory training sessions. 
  • Key resource for posAbilities' Building Caring Communities social innovation initiative for deepening the team’s ability to reflect on and articulate its practice. 
  • Recommended as required reading for 'every college and university" by Ashoka Fellow Al Etmanski

Testimonials

Margaret Wheatley, author of many books, including Leadership and the New Science and most recently, Who Do We Choose To Be? 

“I've been very grateful for the many group processes developed in the past  decades that create new capacities and new relationships among people working together. Kate has brought the best of these together, in clear and direct language, making these processes easily accessible. Yet we must also notice how, in these past decades, we have become more separated, impatient and self-protective. Working well together is a much less frequent--even rare--experience as people withdraw in fear in response to profound uncertainty. This is where Kate's book becomes both a challenge and a gift. Can we commit to working in these ways so that people again become engaged with their work and manifest their collective creativity? If we do, people will remember the joy of what it feels like to work well together and produce work they believe in. And this is the ultimate gift.”

*****

Nina Simons, Co-Founder, Bioneers

“This book is a rare gem, as it’s easily accessible, deeply useful and offers clear guidance to make changes that seem simple, but that will have profound effects, if practiced. Kate helps us to surface and make pragmatic what we intuitively know about groups and change processes. I urge you to see for yourself. It will strengthen your ability to navigate everything from relationships to complex systems, and to create the better outcomes we so need at this time.”

*****

Health Nexus 

“Open any page of this book and you will find practical ideas and strategies for working with groups — as a facilitator, participant or manager. We will definitely use and share these tools!”

*****

Alissa Hauser, Co-Founder, The Engage Network 

“Understanding group management theories as Kate lays out so simply and accessibly, is a huge benefit to anyone who relies on a group to get something done – whether it is a corporate team, a care circle that forms to take care of a sick friend, or a group of citizens who want to make their community stronger. I particularly love Kate’s personalized, narrative voice that makes it seem like she wrote the book just for me. The book is information-packed, yet an easy read at the same time. I will definitely integrate many of the models and theories Kate explains so eloquently into the groups I work with.”

*****

Susan Zielinski, Managing Director, SMART (Sustainable Mobility and Accessibility Research & Transformation) University of Michigan 

“My work has to do with transforming transportation into something that helps us live more equitably and more sustainably on the planet. This gets a lot more complicated as the world urbanizes, demographics shift, climate change makes its presence known, the economy restructures, and a responsive flurry of new technologies and services and systems arrive on the scene faster than we can figure out how they all fit together and what might be their effects. Suddenly transportation is as much about working together, connecting the dots, collaborating on multi-faceted solutions across disciplines and sectors as it is about engineering and infrastructure. I think Kate’s book should be required reading at the very least for all transportation professionals if not for anyone who’s responsible for making our cities and communities better.”

 

About Kate & the team

Kate Sutherland

Kate Sutherland is founding faculty for Simon Fraser University’s Certificate in Social Innovation, and faculty and executive coach with THNK School of Creative Leadership. She is a seasoned consultant in community and organizational change, and has been immersed in the ten frameworks for decades. She is passionate about the potential of “inner work” to support breakthroughs and non-linear change, and defines it as being based in intention, perception, intuition and consciousness. You can see more about her here.

Project Team

Kate has a proven track record for writing and producing books, having written and produced two books so far. She has assembled many of the same team members she has worked with twice before (shown with asterix **) and added others of high caliber.

  • Kate Sutherland: Writing and production coordination 
  • M80 Design LLC / Wes Youssi: Cover design 
  • Joanne Kembel**: Editing 
  • Barbara Joughin** (AAA Wordsmith): structural and copy editing 
  • Tamara MacKenzie**: Book Design
  • TBD: Page Layout 
  • TBD: Illustrations
  • Hilary Henegar: Communications and Digital Strategy Consultant

And other advisors in the background, especially Sarah Dickinson,THNK School of Creative Leadership, Kaz Brecher, Curious Catalyst, Elizabeth Sheehan, Climate Smart and Vanessa LeBourdais, Dreamrider Productions.

Production Schedule 

New title: January-February 2017

Writing new copy and revisions: March, and June-July  

Indiegogo campaign: March-June 

New cover design: April-August 

Illustrations: June-July 

Editing: July-August 

Copy editing: August 

Page layout: August 

Digital version distribution: August 

Print production: August-September 

Distribution: October (Aiming for September!)

TestimonialsMargaret Wheatley, author of many books, including Leadership and the New Science and most recently, Who Do We Choose To Be? “I've been very grateful for the many group processes developed in the past  decades that create new capacities and new relationships among people working together. Kate has brought the best of these together, in clear and direct language, making these processes easily accessible. Yet we must also notice how, in these past decades, we have become more separated, impatient and self-protective. Working well together is a much less frequent--even rare--experience as people withdraw in fear in response to profound uncertainty. This is where Kate's book becomes both a challenge and a gift. Can we commit to working in these ways so that people again become engaged with their work and manifest their collective creativity? If we do, people will remember the joy of what it feels like to work well together and produce work they believe in. And this is the ultimate gift.”*****Nina Simons, Co-Founder, Bioneers“This book is a rare gem, as it’s easily accessible, deeply useful and offers clear guidance to make changes that seem simple, but that will have profound effects, if practiced. Kate helps us to surface and make pragmatic what we intuitively know about groups and change processes. I urge you to see for yourself. It will strengthen your ability to navigate everything from relationships to complex systems, and to create the better outcomes we so need at this time.”*****Health Nexus “Open any page of this book and you will find practical ideas and strategies for working with groups — as a facilitator, participant or manager. We will definitely use and share these tools!”*****Alissa Hauser, Co-Founder, The Engage Network “Understanding group management theories as Kate lays out so simply and accessibly, is a huge benefit to anyone who relies on a group to get something done – whether it is a corporate team, a care circle that forms to take care of a sick friend, or a group of citizens who want to make their community stronger. I particularly love Kate’s personalized, narrative voice that makes it seem like she wrote the book just for me. The book is information-packed, yet an easy read at the same time. I will definitely integrate many of the models and theories Kate explains so eloquently into the groups I work with.”*****Susan Zielinski, Managing Director, SMART (Sustainable Mobility and Accessibility Research & Transformation) University of Michigan “My work has to do with transforming transportation into something that helps us live more equitably and more sustainably on the planet. This gets a lot more complicated as the world urbanizes, demographics shift, climate change makes its presence known, the economy restructures, and a responsive flurry of new technologies and services and systems arrive on the scene faster than we can figure out how they all fit together and what might be their effects. Suddenly transportation is as much about working together, connecting the dots, collaborating on multi-faceted solutions across disciplines and sectors as it is about engineering and infrastructure. I think Kate’s book should be required reading at the very least for all transportation professionals if not for anyone who’s responsible for making our cities and communities better.” About Kate & the teamKate SutherlandKate Sutherland is founding faculty for Simon Fraser University’s Certificate in Social Innovation, and faculty and executive coach with THNK School of Creative Leadership. She is a seasoned consultant in community and organizational change, and has been immersed in the ten frameworks for decades. She is passionate about the potential of “inner work” to support breakthroughs and non-linear change, and defines it as being based in intention, perception, intuition and consciousness. You can see more about her here.Project TeamKate has a proven track record for writing and producing books, having written and produced two books so far. She has assembled many of the same team members she has worked with twice before (shown with asterix **) and added others of high caliber.

story:
I'm writing 'Angry Jogger', a book about my transformation from a foul-mouthed 280lb couch potato, to a foul-mouthed 200lb 6x marathon runner with a jogging dependency.

It will cover everything from my boozy rock-bottom at 280lbs, to running my first marathon in 2011, right up until present day and my 100k London 2 Brighton Challenge.

It hasn't been plain sailing. I've messed up so many times in between. For example:

  • I got lost for 6 miles in my first ever ultramarathon and had to stop to crap & pray for my life in a hedge. Twice. I finished last. 
  • I ran the Las Vegas Marathon after having 2 Margaritas on the morning of the race. I nearly died on the finish line.
  • My Camelbak hydration backpack leaked in an elevator shortly before my 2nd ever half marathon, causing an elderly couple to think I'd wet my pants as Lucozade Sport dripped down my leg.
  • It took me 15 attempts to finally run a sub 2 hour half marathon. A wise man would've given up by then.

But then again, I'm far from wise.

It's all part of the journey and it's what will make this book great if you pledge today!

Who are you to be writing a running book?

I'm not Mo Farah. I run like a girl, eat too much junk food and cry in hedges when it all goes wrong. 

But I'm getting better and I love what I do. And that's all that matters. 

The aim of the book will be to show and explain how I've improved as a runner by comparing my training regimes in detail. 

This will be of use to completely new runners and middle-to-back of the pack enthusiasts who simply want to improve from a 5-hour-marathon to a 4:30 race. Or to those of you who finally want to run that elusive sub 2 hour half marathon!

I'll also talk about how I managed to lose enough weight to enable me to run in the first place. You can read more about my weight loss story in this Huffington Post article.

I've made every mistake newbie marathoners can make and strangely survived to tell the tale. Now it's up to you to let me tell it by pledging today!

My Background

  • I'm Matt Waterworth the author of the Angry Jogger running blog, a website dedicated to inspiring new runners into the sport. 

  • I started running 3 years ago as a way to cope with my late father's cancer diagnosis and I haven't stopped since. My book will emphasise that if I can run a marathon, then anyone can and will show you how I did it.

  • I've completed 6 marathons, 17 half marathons and an ultra marathon since I started running in January 2011. 

  • My biggest challenge lies ahead in May 2014 where I'll run the 62 miles from London to Brighton for Northern Ireland Hospice. My training and progress as an ultra-marathon runner will form a huge part of the book. 

  • I've ran races in many cities in the UK, Europe and further afield including Las Vegas, Paris and Dublin. The book will combine my love of running with my love of travel. I won't just be talking about running. Themes of drunkenness, joy, isolation, self-discovery and despair will feature heavily. 

  • My story and my writings have been featured in the Huffington Post, Men's Running UK, Ultra Runner Podcast and the Belfast Telegraph.

  • Angryjogger.com has gained a cult following from runners throughout the UK, America, Canada and India. It's received 500,000 unique visits in the 2 years since January 2012. It's now one of the most popular running blogs in the United Kingdom.

What I Need & What You Get

Every pledge that's made will get a copy of the Angry Jogger book due for release in November 2014.

Here's a quick breakdown of what exactly I'll need to proceed with the book. 

Any pledge at all from you will help make this a reality!

  • I will need £1,500 in basic living costs to cover of writing the book full-time until May. I plan to cover everything from the time I started running until the 100k London to Brighton Challenge. 
  • Any additional funds raised beyond the £1,500 will allow me to continue to write about my races and experiences up until October 2014 at the latest.
  • More pledges = more time to spend on the book = an even better book at the end!

I'm determined to make this book as great as it can be. You can ensure that the world gets to see it by pledging on any of the perks now!

Other Ways You Can Help

It'd be amazing if you could donate to my London 2 Brighton Challenge 100km Justgiving page in aid of Northern Ireland Hospice.

The reasons why I support them are plentiful and listed in this article I wrote for them.

You can also like the Angry Jogger page on Facebook or follow me on Twitter where I'll be providing regular updates to the progress of the campaign and the book!

story:
About Ashes and Ice:

I have dreamed of being a novelist for YEARS. Ashes and Ice is based off of a character sketch I wrote when I was 12. After being introduced to the AMAZING Indie community, I published Ashes and Ice in February 2013. I was floored when within 24 hours of release, Ashes and Ice was on Three Top 100 Bestsellers Lists. Ashes and Ice was also voted #1 for Best YA Book Cover of 2013. I was so grateful to all the bloggers and readers who helped to make Ashes and Ice so successful. 

Such an awesome year!

********** Dark YA Fantasy **********

Summary:

She is desperate to remember.
He is aching to forget.
Together, they are not broken.
But together, one may not survive.

​Jade wakes up with no memory of her past and blood on her hands. 

Plagued by wicked thoughts, she searches for answers. Instead, she finds a boy who doesn't offer her answers, but hope. But sometimes, when nightmares turn into reality and death follows you everywhere, hope is not enough. 

﻿LUST. LOVE. LOSS. Sometimes, all that is left are Ashes and Ice.

*****************************************

Reviews:

"Ashes and Ice is a dark YA fantasy that keeps you guessing. It grips you and doesn't let you go." -- Tiffany Carmouche, Author
"Dark and Wicked." -- The Book Diaries
"Dreamy and Poetic." -- L.L. Hunter, Author
"A stunning debut." -- Owlnestly Reviews
"This story will rock you to your core." -- The Shadow Realm
"Intoxicating and electric." --Tsk, Tsk, What to Read? Blog

A Teaser:

Many more Ashes and Ice teasers on my Facebook Author Page!

What I Need & What You Get:

So, why do I need your help?

Well, after a lot of thought and consideration I decided I wanted to release an extended edition of Ashes and Ice to my readers. I have been in contact with two incredible actors who are willing to be narration for the Ashes and Ice audiobook AND I am antsy to release the sequel to Ashes and Ice! All this awesomeness takes moolah. If I waited till I had this amount of money to invest in this series it may take me well into 2014 or even 2015 to pull the cash together and I would LOVE to get this series done and published way before then. THAT is where you come in!

Where is the money going?

  • $700 for editing and marketing costs for the re-release of the extended edition of Ashes and Ice
  • $2000 for producing, releasing, and marketing the Ashes and Ice Audiobook
  • $4000 for editing, formatting, cover design, and marketing for Book 2
  • $1300 for a print run for 250 Books
  • STRETCH GOAL! (Total of 12k) $4000 for editing, formatting, cover design, and marketing for Book 3

Every single dollar gets me (and this series) a step closer to this $8k (or 12k stretch) goal. I know how phenomenal the Indie Book community is and have faith that we can get this project off the ground. I also know that you gorgeous donators deserve PRIZES! What kind of prizes are we talking about??

Here's a snapshot of the hotness coming your way:

  • Ebooks, signed paperbacks, and signed hardbacks!
  • Bookmarks, posters, postcards, bookplates!
  • Beta-reads, critiques!
  • Deleted scenes, teasers, sneak peaks, POV scenes! 
  • Sexy fishnet stockings, boots, and apparel!
  • Shout outs/chats/autographs from Character-Look-A-Like Models!

    • AND MORE! Oh, and prepare for an awesome party during the campaign AND another HUUUUGE party for the Release! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

    • Share the campaign via Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, ANYWHERE and enter to win prizes.
    • Have you read Ashes and Ice? Did you love it? If so, if you could consider doing a video review and submitting the link to me via my contact page on www.rochellemayacallen.com OR Facebook page!
    • Become a member of my street team and help get the campaign and Ashes and Ice as much publicity as possible!

    My Promise:

    If I can get my STRETCH GOAL of $12k fully funded, I will publish the whole Trilogy by April 2014!

    Yeah, that freaks me out a little bit, but if you believe in me enough to get me to my goal then I will work my ass off to get you this story AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. 

    Wow, here we go!

    I am so freakin' excited that I am practically doing cartwheels in my living room. I HEART all of you and I am sending you all a gigantic cyber hug!


    Now just a CUTE photo from a reader to put a smile on your face :)

    Happy reading and *ehem* donating.

story:
Help Pete Dulin Publish His Second Book!


About Your KC Ale Trail Guide

I'm a writer, editor, photographer and author based in Kansas City. In 2012, Kansas City Star Books published Last Bite: 100 Simple Recipes from Kansas City’s Best Chefs and Cooks. Now I'm ready to write and publish a book about craft breweries in greater Kansas City and the surrounding area. No other contemporary book like this exists.

Video credit: Thanks to BR Creative for the video production. https://www.facebook.com/brcreativekc
http://www.brcreativekc.com/

Logo design by Eric Schotland Design.

The Trail Ahead

I need your support to self-publish KC Ale Trail. The book explores how our craft brewing scene has grown from the debut of Boulevard Brewing Company and Free State Brewing Company 25 years ago to the launch of a new wave of local breweries.

KC Ale Trail takes you on an in-depth tour of breweries in Kansas City, Springfield, Lawrence, Manhattan and Topeka. You’ll learn about the styles of delicious beers they produce. You’ll gain insight from brewery founders, brewers and other people like John Couture of Bier Station advancing our craft beer culture and community. You can refer to the handy trail guide for an index of the best taprooms, a glossary of beer terms, beer and food pairings, a trail map of craft breweries and more.

Above: Martin City Brewing Company brewer Nick Vaughn

The perfect bound, soft-cover book of craft beer goodness, full of color photography and imagery, will feature my adventures on the KC Ale Trail to tap into untold stories. I'll also create an e-book version suitable for Kindle, Nook, and iPad. Whether you’re a beer geek or craft beer newcomer, KC Ale Trail will be a useful resource and terrific gift for beer lovers.

Have you worked up a thirst to own this book? Grab a pint, take a sip and read on to learn how your support can help publish KC Ale Trail.

For the Love of Beer - Funding

Your donation toward $18,000 will cover printing, distribution, research, editing, book design and photography for the book and production of the e-book. I'm using a Missouri-based printer and KC-based designer and photographer to keep dollars flowing in the local economy.

Depending on your funding level, you will receive incentives such as a copy of the book, e-book, custom KC Ale Trail print glass and more. The print and e-book is due in October 2014. Some perks will be distributed earlier.

I've also enlisted support from local breweries to offer cool rewards including

• Custom apparel, glassware and other swag from local breweries and Bier Station
• Tasting Room tours at Big Rip, Cinder Block, and Boulevard Brewing
• Spend time with local brewers at Rock and Run and Martin City Brewing to learn   how they make their craft beer

Stretch Goal #1 - $20,000 - Additional money raised will go to a book release party with plenty of craft beer on hand. Maybe some live music too!

Stretch Goal #2 - $25,000 - Additional money raised will fund a book-and-beer tour in select cities and breweries in Missouri and Kansas to spread the word about greater KC's craft beer scene. I might even convince one of our local breweries to produce a limited edition craft beer - the Trail Blazer. Can you raise a glass to that?

This one-of-a-kind book will be released in fall 2014, barring acts of God or another Prohibition era. Cheers!

The Trail Starts Here

Please donate now! Your support is essential to publish KC Ale Trail. Each donation demonstrates demand for a book that documents and celebrates our growing craft beer scene, one that will gain regional and national recognition over time.

I love drinking craft beer and writing great stories about people and businesses in my community. With KC Ale Trail, I promise that the funds raised won’t go entirely to “research.” Your support will enable me to produce a well-researched, beautiful book that you'll be proud to own and give to others as a gift.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still help:

  • Support your local businesses and creative community.
  • Please spread the word about this campaign with family and friends.
  • Use Indiegogo share tools to increase awareness of the KC Ale Trail campaign.
  • Connect with KC Ale Trail and stay updated through
  • kcaletrail.com

  • https://www.facebook.com/kcaletrail

  • https://twitter.com/kcaletrail

story:
Help the SNP & Richard Arkless win in Dumfries & Galloway by donating to the official campaign fund.

For the first time the SNP has had a real chance of winning the seat of Dumfries & Galloway. The race is neck and neck and we need your help to make sure we have the resources to win and unseat Russell Brown. We have an army of activists, now we need your help to give them the tools to win.

We cannot do it without your donation so please click through and contribute.

Richard Arkless is the person for the job. A lawyer, businessman and father, Richard is rooted in D&G and completely committed to the interests of Scotland and the people of Dumfries & Galloway. Its time to elect a real D&G champion who knows & understands how the people in this region feel. 

Richard will always put Scotland & the people of Dumfries & Galloway first, always.

What We Need

  • We are looking to raise £5000 for essential campaign activities.
  • These funds are for leaflets, newspapers, shops, badges, posters and many other campaign materials. Remember any one leaflet must be printed 40, 000 times. 
  • We need to ensure our presence is visible and the materials need to be paid for,
  • All funds raised will go towards the official campaign, even if we don't reach our target of £5000. 
  • If we raise more than our target we will use the excess for the campaign and it will mean we can have even more of a presence across the Region..

The size of D&G means we need more resources than other areas. We cannot win without your help. If we don't have more funds we cannot win, so contribute now.

If you are fed up with Labour & Russell Brown, please donate to the Official Campaign fund of Richard Arkless SNP - and let's get an MP who will always stand up for Scotland and his people; the people of Dumfries & Galloway.

story:
Greetings: my name is Zak Block. In May 2011, I founded (the) Squawk Back, (thesquawkback.com) a free, semi-weekly e-zine of transgressive literature, for which I am now the editor-in-chief, principal designer and an occassional illustrator. In two years of existence we've published the work of 200+ established and emergent, fringe-dwelling, dazed, confused, unscrubbed, slightly unbalanced, cuddly, lovable literary voices, but all thoroughly and unusually brilliant. In that time, 'SB' has grown into a community, as well as a periodical: its unique cross-platform ethos and approach facilitating the free exchange of ideas, discussions, criticisms, and feedback; in addition to being a home for great works of emergent literature, we are also something of a school: for writers, for written works, for ideas; a visionary space wherein readers, editors and contributors alike may brainstorm ideas, develop, experiment with, hone and refine their respective crafts. While undoubtedly we love the work we publish, and the voices to which we lend a platform; and, while we're sure that the hours upon hours of grunt-work we perform each week are, in a sense, their own reward; yet, despite all of that, we are living in a state of relative poverty, and require some manner of assistance from our beloved and be-loving readers and readers-to-be.  Furthermore, we don't particularly want to monetize as we feel it would detract from the aesthetic uniformity and not-suckiness of the site.
 
PRAISE FOR THE SQUAWK BACK  "Presenting some of the most uncontrived writing to be found today..." —In Parentheses "Contributing something very unique and special to contemporary literature... revolutionary..."  —Structo  "...a gem." —L.J. Spillane "It has true bite... it's a defiant cry to hold on, a bold squawk from the fringes of literature... heartening." —Sabotage "Accruing strangeness..."  —The Volta "Great fiction and illustrations."  —The Ofi Press "An incredible blog."  —Burning Muse "A very intriguing publication of unique and sometimes downright captivating short fiction."  —Hawleyville "Interesting... thought-provoking." —Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting
 
Squawk Back Talks Back: Zak Block is interviewed by Alexandra Forero  —In Parentheses Six Questions for Zak Block, by Jim Harrington —Six Questions For... Destroying False Gods: Zak Block is interviewed by Patrick Nathan —Xenith Publish the Unpolished, Polish the Unpublished: A Profile of Squawk Back  —The Lit Pub

story:
Just a Little About the Start of This Campaign

Hello, and thank you for stopping by my campaign! I hope that after you read this information you will share my enthusiasm about the potential of this campaign!

My name is Tiffany Bennett, and I am currently a student at West Virginia University studying Child Development and Family Studies. I will graduate this May, and then I will go to grad school to get my Masters in Preschool Special Needs. In my free time I enjoy writing children’s books. Currently, I am working on the publication for my first book, Fred Fishy, M.D. Fred Fishy, M.D. is a doctor that is a fish. In this first book, it describes what his job is all about, and how he has helped the community. From then on, the books will be focused around a sea creature that has a disability. Fred Fishy, M.D. will be a secondary character that helps the sea creature overcome his/her disability.

Help Provide Support to the Children

With the publication of this series of books, children that have a disability will be able to have a book that relates to them. This book series will provide support to children with disabilities, and it will give them a book that they can relate to. This book series will not just be for disabled children, however, it will be beneficial to children without a disability, as well. It will introduce them to the differences that each person has, and it will help to teach them acceptance of these disabilities.

What Your Support Will Provide

All of the funding will go towards the publication of this book series. The publishing package that I have chosen costs $3,999 for the first book. With my goal of raising $4,800, I will be able to pay for the publication package, pay the fees to Indiegogo and purchase copies that I will pass out at children’s hospitals and signing events.

If I am not able to reach this goal, I will drop down the publication package to a package that does not include hardcover copies or promotional materials (bookmarks, fliers, and postcards).

If I receive more contributions than my goal amount, those funds will go towards the publication fees of the following books in this series. 

These children’s books will rhyme, and each the story will be about 10 pages long. This length is shown to be great for children in preschool, and kindergarten. Books for this age group are very popular, and sell great. Also, books for children with special needs and disabilities are also in high demand.

I hope you all are as excited about this campaign as I am! If you are able to give a donation to this cause, every donation will help! If you are not able to give money as a donation, there are still ways you can help this cause! Share it with your friends, and they can share it with their friends! I truly appreciate any type of help you are able to give!

Thank you all so much for your interest in this campaign! I hope that you see the potential that I do in this campaign, and please don’t forget to use the Indiegogo tools to share this campaign with your friends!

Thanks again,

Tiffany Bennett

story:
This eBook will help you "boil down" the corporate-speak and walk you through creating a strategic plan that is relevant to your one-person creative business, whether you sell on Etsy or any other online marketplace, set up a booth at craft fairs and other events, wholesale your products to gift shops, or any combination thereof.  While this is geared toward handmade goods artists, I believe the concepts will work for any kind of creative solopreneur, including fine artists, writers, and other freelancers.

What Is Strategic Planning and Why Do You Need It?

One of the best definitions I found of the strategic planning process describes it as making the big decisions that guide the destiny of your business.  It's a process of figuring out the whys of your business, the core values and reasons it exists.  You paint the big picture of your business dreams and then work backwards to create a plan to make it come true.

So why does a solo artist need a strategic plan?  First of all, if you want your business to be a business, you have to treat it as a business.  And if you want your business to grow, you have to set goals and take actions to achieve them.  Strategic planning helps you direct those goals and make business decisions faster.  For example, when you're deciding if you should make a new product, start selling through a new venue, advertise on a certain website, etc. you can look at the decision through the frame of your strategic plan.  If it fits with your whys, you probably want to go for it.  But if it doesn't, you should probably steer clear.

Strategic planning is also a great reminder of why you decided to make a business out of your art.  It's easy to feel like throwing in the towel when you're short on inspiration and not making sales, but with a strategic plan you'll be able to look past your present issues and see how your future vision is still on track (or just needs a bit of tweaking).

Why Should You Listen To Me?

The idea for the eBook came while I was working on my Capstone project for my Bachelor's degree in E-Commerce and Internet Marketing.  My degree was designed through individualized studies, and throughout my education I focused on how I could translate the "big business" concepts I was learning to apply to my own very small business designing jewelry and accessories and selling them online and at events.  My project involved creating a strategic plan for my business, and I was continually frustrated by the lack of relevant information available for very small businesses.  I spent three months digging into corporate strategic planning and figuring out how to reframe it into something that made sense for my business.

My final paper (for which I received an A+ grade) had the following sections:

  • Strategic Planning (an overview and why very small businesses should do it)
  • Competencies and Capabilities (what you need to be, do, and have)
  • Defining Success 
  • Case Studies of Micro-Businesses
  • Developing the Strategic Plan
While I won't bore you with the over-analysis of every article I read, I will be using this framework and all the research I've done (and continue to do) as I write this book.  In addition, I have started a group on Facebook with a variety of my friends who are small business owners, writers, artists, and freelancers.  Their feedback and suggestions so far have already shown me that the scope of this book may need to be expanded to include other types of planning, which I consider "next step" plans once you've determined your strategic plan.  These include Operational Planning, Financial Planning, Marketing/Sales Planning, Product Development Planning, Contingency/Continuity Planning, Sustainability/Social Responsibility Planning, Growth Planning, and Human Resource/Succession Planning.  Put these all together, and you will have the Ultimate Business Plan.
If you would like an invite to the group, please let me know. :)

    What's In It For You?

    This campaign is for pre-orders of the eBook I am working on.  By offering it through IndieGoGo before I've completed it, I'm giving you a chance to get it at a steep discount, as well as have a say in what gets included in the final draft.  You'll have an opportunity to ask me questions about strategic planning and make suggestions that are relevant to your business.

    Everyone who makes a contribution will receive a personal email from me.  Besides thanking you, I will also ask you to respond to that email with any of your questions and suggestions.  You can even make suggestions on what my next book should be about!

    The first 100 people to pre-order the eBook will get it for only $5.  Everyone after that will get it for $10, which is still more than half off the planned regular price of $25.  

    In addition, I have designed other perks to help YOU with YOUR business.

    • For $25, you will receive weekly emailed updates from me as I work on the book and use it to create my own strategic plan.  Follow along with what I'm doing and apply the concepts to your own business.  Of course, you'll also get a copy of the completed eBook.
    • For $50, your "business card" will be included in the back of the book.  You will have a business card sized space to advertise your business and contact info.  You will also receive the weekly emailed updates and the completed eBook.
    • For $100, you will be featured on my blog, either as a "Share Your Story" article that you write, or one that I write after interviewing you (via email).  The business card ad, email updates, and completed eBook are also included in this perk.
    • For $250, you will get to have a brainstorming session with me via Skype or chat.  We will talk about your business, your dreams, and get you started on creating your own strategic plan.  You will also be featured on my blog (I can interview you during the brainstorming session, or give you ideas for writing your own article), and you will receive the business card ad, email updates, and completed eBook.
    • For $500, I will walk you through creating your own strategic plan.  This will be done mostly via email, with the occasional Skype or chat as necessary.  The blog feature, business card ad, email updates, and completed eBook are also included.
    • For $1000, we will "meet" once a week for a year online (via Skype or chat) to work on your own strategic plan and put it into motion.  The blog feature, business card ad, email updates, and completed eBook will also be included.
    • For $5000, I will come to you and work with you on your strategic plan in person for up to one week.  This price should cover airfare and hotel accommodations for me.  I will also continue to meet with you online for a year.  And you will receive the blog feature, business card ad, email updates, and completed eBook.

      Risks & Challenges

      The past year has been very challenging for me, with both my husband and myself having health issues.  I had to shut down my Etsy shop because I wasn't able to get orders out in a timely fashion.  Thankfully, we are doing better, and while we are by no means "cured," we have become more accustomed to our "new normal."  

      Writing is something I think I can do even when I'm not feeling well enough to do anything else.  It doesn't require me to put on pants (pants are evil) and go to the post office, at least!  And by offering the weekly emailed updates, I am holding myself accountable to continually making progress.  I am also going to take a page out of NaNoWriMo and commit to working on the book every day in November and using the update feature here to report my daily word count.

      I have set my goal very low, as I am planning to write this book regardless.  Once I reach the first $500, I will be adding another type of planning for each additional $500 raised.

      • $1000 = Operational Planning
      • $1500 = Marketing/Sales Planning
      • $2000 = Financial Planning
      • $2500 = Product Development Planning
      • $3000 = Contingency/Continuity Planning
      • $3500 = Sustainability/Social Responsibility Planning
      • $4000 = Growth Planning
      • $4500 = Human Resources/Succession Planning
      • $5000 = Putting Together Your Ultimate Business Plan
      Each of these will be a separate book, and normally sold individually for $25 each, but you can get them ALL for as little as $5 by supporting this campaign and preordering!

      I have several other "stretch" goals in mind, including audio and print versions of the book, companion workbooks and/or journals, additional reports on related topics, a private forum where you can discuss your plans and businesses with other contributors, and a few other ideas I'll keep a surprise for now.  :)

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help spread the word about this campaign, and use the Indiegogo share tools.  "Like" anything you see on Facebook about this campaign so that more people will see it, and retweet on Twitter.  Feel free to use your own social media networks, forums, and blogs to help promote this eBook.  

      Join the Facebook group!  Just let me know you want in (I'll need your email to send an invite), and I'll get you added.

story: Since 2005, I've been writing some of the most unpredictable and engaging essays available for free on the Internet, at www.jehsmith.com. I've been doing this for the love of it, and have expected nothing in return. Recently, two things have happened. The first is that I've noticed many other people finding ways to transform their creative capital into capital stricto sensu, and I've begun to wonder why I should not join the bandwagon. The second thing to happen is that I've recently decided to move to Paris. This is an enormously expensive undertaking, and it has made me think about money, and how to get it, like never before. I don't like this about myself, but that's just how it goes. Under the circumstances, I simply no longer have the leisure, as I once did, to write for free, and I've determined to transform my website into a lucrative endeavor, not to get rich, but simply to enable me to live without undue worry. The total additional expense that my move to France brings with it is around $20,000. If you are willing to help me out with this, I promise to continue writing great stuff for you at jehsmith.com, without ads and without paywalls. It's as simple as that.

I've been doing this for the love of it, and have expected nothing in return. Recently, two things have happened. The first is that I've noticed many other people finding ways to transform their creative capital into capital stricto sensu, and I've begun to wonder why I should not join the bandwagon. The second thing to happen is that I've recently decided to move to Paris. This is an enormously expensive undertaking, and it has made me think about money, and how to get it, like never before. I don't like this about myself, but that's just how it goes. story:
Après plusieurs années de douleur et affaiblie par la maladie de Crohn, je peux enfin apprécier la vie grâce à trois interventions chirurgicales majeures. Pour fêter l’occasion un an plus tard, je ferai un triathlon dimanche prochain le 24 août 2014. Un vrai triathlon de distance olympique, c’est-à-dire : 1,5 km de nage, 40km de vélo suivi de 10 km de course à pied. 

Il y a eu des moments difficiles où le geste le plus anodin – manger – m’a fait souffrir le martyr. Mais la maladie ne doit pas dicter votre vie, il faut prendre le dessus. Pour l’occasion,  je ramasse des fonds que je remettrai à Crohn et Colite Canada (un reçu d’impôt vous sera remis). Donnez généreusement et accompagnez-moi dans cette lutte contre cette maladie qui touche plus de 200 000 personnes au Canada.

Je n’aurais jamais cru que je pourrais un jour jouir pleinement de la vie, mais aujourd’hui en pleine santé, je mords dans la vie!

story:
200 Dates

One Man, 200 dates, 365 days

The dos, don’ts, and embarrassing stories from a year of serial dating

Just about everyone has had a disaster date and hearing about one is like driving by a car wreck; you simply can’t help but take a look. The awkward pauses and general discomfort of a first date strikes a universal chord that resonates with just about everyone. Who hasn’t been on a date and had his mind racing with questions like, when is this date going to end or how can I get out of here? I thought that was all behind me, but after ending a four year relationship I was reintroduced to the dating world. My first dates didn’t quite go the way I envisioned, but they are the inspiration for the 200 dates challenge. 

After failing miserably, I wanted to see if I could become a better dater. That is when I came up with the 200 date challenge. I decided to go on 200 dates in a year and challenge myself to completely understand every aspect of dating. It was the craziest year of my life and after going on 200 dates, I have compiled all the tips and hilarious stories from these dates. The book covers every aspect of dating  through fantastic real life dating adventures. These stories are sure to make you laugh and are perfect for everyone, man or woman, singled or married. I am sure you will enjoy reading about how crazy people are when it comes to dating.

I am so excited to be able to share with you 200 Dates, but I need your help to get the book into production. Your help will enable the project to move forward to so we can ensure the book is  professionally published.

Please support the project and pass on the link to friends.

Thank you for all your support!!


I have a sample date below

The Talker

I met up with this girl for drinks at a sushi bar in Scottsdale. It was our first date and the woman was completely mesmerizing, not by her beauty, but by her verbal skills. She talked nonstop for over an hour. Seriously! No breaks or distinct pauses, just a constant stream of noise. I didn’t say a word other than ordering a drink and grunting a few times. This was pure torture and yet, I was strangely amazed that someone could carry on for such a long period of time.

I wanted to say something, but I couldn’t find a pause to break in to the conversation. After an hour of hearing about the new Mercedes she wants to buy and her daddy’s company where she works and doesn’t get any respect, I finally made eye contacted with the waitress and called her over with a look of desperation. The waitress walked over and said, “I hate to interrupt what looks like an intense conversation, but I wanted to know if you wanted anything else before I leave.” I said, “We are set, can I just grab the check.” The waitress and I looked at each other and smirked. This didn’t go unnoticed by my date, who angrily said, “I can’t believe you are flirting right in the middle of our date.” She was clearly upset and told me, “I have no time for people who play games.” I had a completely reactionary response, so without thinking I blurted out, “Well, you’d have more time if you stopped talking so much.” That did it, a switch flipped in her head and I could see the rage in her eyes. Her face wrinkled like a prune and I knew it was going to get ugly. She grabbed the glass of water and gave what had to be the worst attempt in the history of throwing a drink in someone’s face. Not only did every drop of water miss me, but the glass also slipped out of her hand and was launched into the side of a fish tank. I stared at her in complete disbelief as she ran out of the bar muttering to herself. I couldn’t help but think, “She’s still talking, unbelievable!”

story:
"Many people die at twenty five and aren’t buried until they are seventy five.”  -Benjamin Franklin

ON PASSIONATE LIVING

We have chosen to launch this fundraiser to ensure Books & Shovels, a cross country traveling bookstore and publisher, can securely launch. If you watch the video, and read what we've written for this page, you'll see how much thought and attention to detail has gone into this operation. Given the chance, we believe Books & Shovels will change peoples lives.  The fight against cultural decadence is necessary.  We are going to encourage others to scream "I AM EXCITED TO BE ALIVE!  I AM NOT AFRAID TO MAKE SACRIFICES TO ACCOMPLISH MY DREAMS!" .

Claim your perk to the right of this page to pledge money to help start up Books & Shovels's journey.

WHAT IS BOOKS & SHOVELS?

Books & Shovels is a nonprofit traveling bookstore and publisher.  We distribute street books, chapbooks, paintings, graffiti, cds, records, zines, anything that exhibits passion and creativity.  We are Passion Activists that believe living is more valuable than just making a living.  

We mesh grass roots promotions, such as street performing, street art, and D.I.Y. open mics, with opportunities of the 21st century; blogging, internet poetry, and ezines.

Backing this project will help broaden the artistic community, promote passionate living, and encourage dreaming.  This will make a difference in the lives of all people, not just artists.  

WHO THE DEVIL ARE YOU?

I'm Jeremiah Walton, founder of Nostrovia! Poetry, and a member  of NYC based publishing house, UndergroundBooks.  

I graduated High School the spring of 2013, and hit the road hitchhiking the following fall.  I ran a small "bookstore" out of my frame pack on street corners and at open mics.  I hoped to give art a good kick in the balls.

The world kicked back though, and it kicked back hard.  To reach the goal of broadening the poetic community, and to encourage others to sacrifice for what they Love, to dream, I realized the bar needed to be raised.  Books & Shovels needed to be launched.  


THIS EXTENDS BEYOND ART

As we interact with others, perform, and distribute, people will see us ragged, dirty (maybe a bit crusty), but they will see us smiling, living, Loving.  

This is to show Passionate Living over Making A Living.  

Encourage others to be willing to cut themselves open for what they love is Books & Shovels's main objective.  You have one, short span of time to live your life.  Live it with fire in your belly.  You can smash concrete with your tongue!  

Alone, we are whispers trying to be heard.  Together, we are a scream.  The Virus is silence.

We will be loud.

"Donate to Books & Shovels at IndieGoGo right now. These fools are gonna distribute the fuck out of some words and word related paraphernalia. Let’s set minds on fire, not books."  -The Gap-Toothed Madness


Obtaining the necessary funds (the ugly part of art)

I am busting my body working 40-60 hours a week, selling my possessions, and doing jobs for the weird Craigslist folks.  Anything I can to add flesh to Books & Shovels I am doing.  

We are preparing to hit the road at the 2014 NYC Poetry Festival (July 26th to 27th), and do not have enough time to sacrifice our eating habits and pockets for this mission.  

We're setting up the speakers, but need your voice to help amplify the collective scream.  Your pledges will be the necessary vocal cords we cannot strum on our own.   

Every pledge we receive is entitled to one of the wonderful rewards we've set up for you to show our appreciation of your assistance. 


What is the money going towards?

All pledged / raised funds will help cover:

  • Emergency car repair 
  • Wire racks 
  • Book printing
  • Distribution 
  • Banners 
  • Venue / tour space 
  • Hosting open mics
  • Vendor tables at festivals 
  • Decals 
  • Distributing your books / cds / art

We have the bones. We have the art, the joy, the love, the fear, and now it's time to split lightening in two.

Given the chance, we will split lightening in two. 


How will you be distributing?

When Books & Shovels is in operation, we will be busking (i.e. street performing) in front of a station-wagon-turned-bookstore overflowing with books and art.  Everything will be presented on a fold-out table and on collapsible bookshelves.  

We will have this set up on your local street corners, outside open mics and slams, at festivals, and anywhere we can bleed openly.  

O, and rogue open mics are a thing.  Nostrovia! Poetry and UndergroundBooks hosted D.I.Y. open mics at the 2013 NYC Poetry Festival, and the same concept will be applied to wherever shop opens.  We'll slightly touch upon acting as a mobile venue through this process.  


What will you be distributing?

  • Chapbooks
  • Street Books
  • Novels 
  • Cook Books
  • Comics
  • Zines
  • Broadsides
  • Paintings & Drawings
  • CDs / Records
  • Stickers & Graffiti 
  • & any physical example of passionate living

If you would like to have your art distributed through Books & Shovels, please contact us through the Books & Shovels website.


YOUR REWARDS

Along with the good karma that comes with all our rewards, we'll give you accreditation for your assistance on the Books & Shovels website.  

Some rewards are IndieGoGo exclusive, and will never be available again (the kiss is always available). 

Some of the rewards include working with you on a poem, private ciphers, Books & Shovels coming to your town, ghost written love poems, book reviews, and other fun jazz.  

Look to the right hand side bar to see your rewards for supporting us.


WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU OVER SHOOT?

Pending on pledgers and how much we over shoot our fundraising goal, we can afford to give back to the community, and purchase publications from wonderful indie presses such as 48th Street Press, Lazy Fascist, Black Balloon Publishing, Tiny Hardcore Press, Horror Sleaze Trash, and Blood Pudding Press. 

With excess pledges, we will financially give back to the artistic community.


WHEN WILL YOU BEGIN TRAVELING?

Nostrovia! Poetry and UndergroundBooks are featured performance sets and vendors at the 2014 NYC Poetry Festival at Governor's Island.  After the festival finished on July 29th, we hit the road.

WHERE ARE YOU GOING?

All of the cities below, and every where in between.  We are not making a concrete schedule or plan regarding locations (except for those who pledge 500+ dollars, with whom we'll be meeting up and getting involved in their area).  We aren't planning concretely due to the nature of the road: it beats the hell out of you and doesn't care where you're headed.

  • Manchester, N.H.
  • Boston, M.A.
  • Worcester, M.A.
  • Hartford, C.T.
  • New York City, N.Y.
  • Erie, P.A.
  • Philadelphia, P.A.
  • Allentown, P.A.
  • Baltimore, M.D.
  • Jacksonville, F.L.
  • Fort Myers, F.L.
  • New Orleans, L.A.
  • Houston, T.X.
  • Las Angeles, C.A.
  • San Francisco, C.A.


PokéPoet Cards

Need a new Facebook Profile image for your author page, or want to spice up your Author Bios?  Use PokéPoet cards.  

We'll turn poets (though all any form of artist can participate) into literary battle cards.  $25 donations receive this perk.  

  

THANK YOU NOTES

We'd rip our hearts out for these folks. 

  • Beach Sloth
  • Ezra Letra
  • Zarina Zabrisky
  • Simon Rogghe
  • New York City Poetry Festival
  • Felino A. Soriano 
  • That Lit Site
  • Clockwise Cat 
  • VerbalEyez
  • Small Press Pittsburgh
  • The Gap Toothed Madness
  • The Camel Saloon
  • 48th Street Press
  • Horror, Sleaze, Trash
  • & everyone who has taken their voice and helped amplify Books & Shovels
  • & YOU 
    for reading this, and encouraging us to chase our dreams.

story:
Somos el primer periódico independiente de la clase obrera ¿Nos ayudas a financiarnos?

Tenemos un proyecto, tenemos un equipo y vamos a desarrollarlo gracias a tus aportaciones. En este mundo donde todos los medios de comunicación se mueven por intereses políticos, grandes multinacionales y banca, hemos nacido nosotros para darle un portazo a esa información y así poder ofrecerte una alternativa comunicativa limpia, sensata y honesta.

¿Sabes por qué es tan importante que nos financies?

Nosotros no somos bien vistos por el poder en general, servimos y escribimos para el ciudadano humilde. Sentimos que es nuestra obligación y que por lo tanto debemos de informar lo que otros medios callan.

Desde luego los poderes económicos no nos van a ayudar, si tú no nos ayudas, estás dándole la facilidad a ellos para que nos callen.

Colabora para denunciar lo injusto

La magnitud de este proyecto es ya internacionalista, contando con colaboradores en Europa y Latinoamérica. Desde nuestra posición de periodistas estamos dispuestos a jugarnos la boca para denunciar la explotación, la indiferencia, la decadencia y la pobreza. ¡Si nos ayudas vamos a conseguir entre todos desenmascarar a quienes provocan la injusticia!

¿Qué necesitamos con esta campaña?

Nuestra necesidad actual es modernizar nuestra cámara fotográfica del periódico. En este sentido, debemos de invertir en que nuestros periodistas puedan desarrollar su trabajo con un material digno.

Además también queremos adquirir una grabadora digital y un micrófono.

Detalles específicos:

  • Cámara réflex - Canon EOS 100D: 647$

  • Objetivo 18-55STM: 181$

  • Objetivo 55-250STM: 323$ 

  • Objetivo EF-S 60 2.8 USM Macro: 685$

  • Micrófono profesional: 82$

  • Grabadora digital: 32$

    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

    Si tú no puedes colaborar con nosotros solamente te pedimos una cosa, difunde todo lo posible esta campaña, intentemos hacer posible entre todos este proyecto periodístico.


    English

    We are the first independent newspaper in the working class. Can we have support for funding us?

    We have a project, we have a team and we will develop thanks to your contributions. In this world where all media political move by banking interests and majors, we were born to give it a slam that information in order to offer a clean, sensible and honest communication alternative.

story:
Salamun aleikum wa ramatullah wa barakatuhu 

Jeunesse Musulmane Espoir de Demain a le plaisir de vous faire part de son projet pour le Ramadan 1435 Hégire. 

L'OPERATION "OFFRIR UNE MOSQUEE A LA COMMUNAUTE DE MEBO" 

Mèbo est un village situé à environ 20km de la ville de Bouaké sur l’axe Bouaké-Brobo. La communauté musulmane de ce village est une communauté de convertis. C’est autour des années 1960 que l’islam a vu le jour dans ce village par l’entremise des dioulas (commerçants ambulants dans les villages). Aujourd’hui l’Imam Mohamed Lamine Ouattara se déplace tant bien que mal sur une moto que l’on dirait « dépassée » pour donner des cours aux femmes et enfants de ce village.
Après toutes ces années, cette communauté ne dispose pas d’une mosquée digne de ce nom. Nous avons vu cette mosquée lors d’un don de matériels scolaires aux enfants de la madrassa dudit village. Quand il pleut impossible d’accomplir une prière à l’interieur de cette mosquée.

Nous sollicitons pour un meilleur suivi et pour donner un engouement certain à l’activité les frères et sœurs, pour cette ‘OPERATION OFFRIR UNE MOSQUEE A LA COMMUNAUTE DE MEBO’. il nous manque 3 553 936 Millions de FCFA / 5 417,58 EUROS sur un total qui avoisinait les 9 834 876 F CFA / 14 992 EUROS. 
C'est Ramadan espérant que nous puissions réunir cette somme afin de pourvoir la communauté de Mèbo en une nouvelle mosquée digne de notre Oumma. Nous vous invitons à faire montre de la générosité qu’Allah soubhana wa ta’ala nous a donné. C'est notre devoir d'aider nos frères et soeurs en Allah. Surtout que chacun de nous sera interrogé sur ses actes. 
Pour la propagation de l'Islam notre belle religion que sommes nous prêt à faire???

Qu'Allah nous facilite la mise en oeuvre de ce projet Allahumma amine et vous récompense.

Merci.

PS: nous incluons les frais de commission de site (408€) dans notre demande. Merci.

story:
Short Summary

I've been writing for close to eight years now. So far, I've made about forty bucks. Not too stellar, but not too... yeah, it stinks worse than a Taco Bell bathroom. But it's not all terrible. I've been wait-listed at two different MFA programs and accepted into one which I could not attend for various reasons.
I've completed two novels, both still unpublished. Hooray for me! Though I finally got feedback on one of them. After rudely rejecting the offer of swapping my old bike for representation (not a Strawberry Shortcake fan, I guess),  the agent suggested I study the art of screenwriting. A suggestion I'm taking to heart with this campaign. 
I want to spend a year studying in UCLA's Online Screenwriting program.  In the program, I will study the basics of story building and write two feature length screenplays. What is most important though is that I will have instructors who can guide me and show me what in my writing works and what needs improvement, both vital if I am going to make it as a writer. 

What You Get

So, you help me, but what do you get? Good question. And lucky for you, I've got a "good" answer. Remember that unpublished novel I mentioned earlier? And that story that got me into an MFA program? Yep. Sweet Marie, I'll be offering those up to you, so you can one day say, "I knew that guy and read his stuff before he published that mid-level two and a half star reviewed book on Amazon." Or you could end up seeing me and start shaking your fist in the air, saying, "That son of a &!+@# owes me money." Who knows what the cards hold?

I also have other things to offer, which you can see to your right. Hint: one might be a warm embrace. (Vertical warm embraces only, please. )

Impacted

Okay, It's about to get ril. Ahem, real. Sorry about that. When I started writing eight years ago, I had no idea what was about to happen. I hadn't yet taken a job as an auditor at an undisclosed location where I got yelled at for wearing pants with birds on them. I hadn't yet had my fist child, though she was on her way. (She's in the picture at the top of the page.) But I remember wanting to write her a book. So, I did. It probably wasn't a very good book. It must not have been because I don't even remember what it was. But it felt good. So I tried something bigger, the project that would become my first novel. 

Before long I was going to bed at eight and waking up at four to write before heading to that job I'd accepted, the one where having two tones of brown on one's shoes would also get you into trouble. Nowadays, I get up at five and write for two hours before the kids wake up. (Right now, it's 2 A.M.) Then I write during lunch. And I write every second that my family affords me. And when I'm not physically at the computer writing, I'm most likely thinking about my stories and ways to make them better. It sounds crazy to write it, but I can't stop. It is an addiction, and I need you to help me get my fix. 

I don't like asking for help, but I have to. Because I want to get better. 

I'd like nothing more than to have one, just one, of my children hold their head up high and some day say, "My daddy is a writer," not, "My daddy cries at his computer."

    Risks

    If I don't reach my goal with this crowdsourcing effort, you can look for my future crowdsourcing project entitled, "Body for Sale." I will find a way to do this.  

    The real risks involve things like meteors. Or if I am called to save the Earth from a master alien race, then I may not have time to complete the course.  

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please share this on your The Facebook page and Twitter it to your cult-like followers.
