story:
NOTE: Please click the following link for the US-friendly version of the campaign!


Short Summary

Hi there!

I'm Jody Medland and I am a professional writer who is equally as passionate about books as I am about film.

Pen Works Media was formed in 2011 with the intention of finding original stories and bringing them to modern readers. Ten e-books and over 3,000 downloads later, we have established a great readership community and are now gearing up for the launch of our first paperback book, The Moors.

This project is hugely important to myself as a writer and the company as a whole because it will help us deliver content to more readers and subsequently build our fanbase for all future releases. 

Mission statement
To seek, educate and nurture talent in both literature and screenwriting, creating and publishing original works that will challenge and alter people’s perceptions of the world.

The mission starts now and by contributing to the project, you can help make it happen.


What We Need & What You Get

For the past 9-months myself, digital content manager Michael Pengelly, graphic designer Paul Newsome and proofreader/photographer Prima Patel have been working hard to get The Moors ready for the marketplace. 

We are very nearly ready, but there is still a great deal of effort needed in regards to designs (for posters, special edition book covers, etc) and marketing (arranging radio spots, magazine column inches, online interviews, etc).

We are currently £3,000 short of what's needed to give the book the best possible chance of commercial success. In the instance we don't quite reach our goal, we have many plan B scenarious set up, so your money won't be wasted. However, it will mean less slots on the radio to smaller audiences and more sporadic news coverage when the book is actually released.

We have spent time looking at what people like to receive in return for financial contributions. It seems that people enjoy tangible rewards that they get to hold and, more importantly, are able to use. Therefore, we have taken care to create things that:

  • Connect you to the project
  • Provide you with collector's items
  • Make you a part of our community
  • Associate you with a growing company
We have created things such as a pack of Top Trumps based on the book's characters, special edition posters and book covers that very few people in the world will own.

What's more, for every supporter that purchases The Moors, 5% of the sale will be donated to Barnardo's, who have partnered with us for the launch, so not only can you contribute to a cool project and get some great souvenirs, but you can help unfortunate children towards a brighter future in the process. 

Remember, it's not just The Moors that will benefit from your contributions but all books created by Pen Works Media in the future.

Note: It has been known for some backers to prefer the entirety of their contribution to be used for the cause. If you would rather we use all of your money for the campaign as opposed to dedicating a percentage of it towards your gifts, simply let me know via e-mail once you have pledged.


About The Moors

Book Blurb

                     The call was disturbing, but as far as investigatory              
            journalist Amanda Connors was concerned, it had to be fate.

            Inadvertently, it was the years of abuse during her childhood
           that led her into journalism and to now receive an anonymous
         tip-off claiming negligence within a children’s care home offered
                            the chance to finally put the past behind her. 

       It was the winter of 1972 when she journeyed from London to Devon
                to pursue the lead, though she would only learn one thing.

                                    Some secrets are better left buried.


Why You Should Trust Us

I am an award-winning writer who has worked successfully across the advertising, corporate, education, film, gaming and literary industries. I possess a great deal of vision that supports my writing ability.

Likewise, Pen Works Media started with a project titled The Emerging Light Series, which saw us teach creative writing and promote the value of original storytelling throughout the UK. Within the company's first year, we published 17 first-time authors, creating 100 short stories and selling over 3,000 books using only social media for our marketing.

The intent is there for all to see, and if you love original books, you can really help take the company and many future writers, to the next level.


Challenges

There are more books being released on an annual basis than ever before and entering a new product can be a rather daunting process. However, the challenge remains the same - making people aware of the great product we have produced among the mass of options available.

Marketing The Moors is every bit as important as actually writing it and by contributing to our IndieGogo campaign, you are providing us with three solutions:

  • Providing us with collateral to market our book
  • Increasing project visibility by allowing people see your pledge
  • Contributing to word-of-mouth marketing (provided you enjoy it!)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially but you like what you see, there are still a number of things you can do to help:

  • Share this campaign on your social media channels
  • Request a free copy of The Moors (applicable to online book reviewers)
  • Visit penworksmedia.co.uk and add your views to any relevant articles
  • Subscribe to the Pen Works Media newsletter

The important thing is that our reading community grows. The company web site acts as a portal where readers can communicate directly with our authors, so as long as our readership is expanding, we're happy!


If We Reach Our Target

In the event we do reach our target, please keep your donations coming all the way up until the deadline. The more people involved in this journey, the better it is for everybody involved. Unless restrictions are stated, we can provide the listed rewards to any number of people and your money will simply be used to broaden our advertising campaign. You can stay posted on our marketing campaign via Facebook!

Any support is hugely appreciated, so thank you so much for your time.

JODY MEDLAND
Pen Works Media

story:
¿Qué?

La otra gente habla acerca de la inevitabilidad de las cosas, de la causalidad que no casualidad de todo evento, y en definitiva de aquellos que no pueden escapar a un destino fatal.

Necesito un árbol. Así termina esta novela coral, ágil, crítica, descarnada a  veces, en la línea de la más moderna narrativa y dotada de una demoledora profundidad para analizar la psicología de los personajes. No exenta de magia y poesía, nos coge por sorpresa en todas las piruetas de la vida de unos seres destinados a vivir unidos, y tocados por una profunda desolación.

Con una prosa ágil y viva se nos dibuja un fresco que refleja muchas de las fallas sociales de nuestro tiempo y que seguro impactará al lector desde la primera página.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Rocío Busquets Mataix.

Nace en valencia en 1977. Se interesa muy pronto por el mundo de la literatura y la pintura , habiendo escrito poesía en valenciano y en castellano; realizando también varios cursos de idiomas y estudios musicales. Se diploma en Magisterio en las especialidades de  Música y Educación Infantil en la Universidad de Valencia, y finaliza un  Máster en psicoterapia Gestalt por la universidad de Murcia

La novela breve El arpista, (2010), fue uno de los diez finalistas del IX Premio Hontanar de Narrativa Breve, 2010, y finalista de los Premios de la Crítica valenciana, 2011; siendo incluida en la antología Arquitectura de la palabra, del Institut Alfons el Magnànim.

Pertenece a la asociación literaria CLAVE.

Ha realizado diversas portadas para diferentes libros de poesía y narrativa como son Humanos, De la invisibilidad,  Poemas que mojó la lluvia y La remor del vent.

Rocío Busquets Mataix es, sin duda, toda una artista que te sorprenderá... 

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La otra gente que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Rocío Busquets Mataix vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?La otra gente habla acerca de la inevitabilidad de las cosas, de la causalidad que no casualidad de todo evento, y en definitiva de aquellos que no pueden escapar a un destino fatal.

Necesito un árbol. Así termina esta novela coral, ágil, crítica,
descarnada a  veces, en la línea de la
más moderna narrativa y dotada de una demoledora profundidad para analizar la
psicología de los personajes. No exenta de magia y poesía, nos coge por
sorpresa en todas las piruetas de la vida de unos seres destinados a vivir unidos, y tocados por una profunda desolación. 
Con una
prosa ágil y viva se nos dibuja un fresco que refleja muchas de las fallas
sociales de nuestro tiempo y que seguro impactará al lector desde la primera página.

¿Quiénes?Tandaia es
 una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a 
autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Rocío Busquets Mataix.

de la literatura y la pintura , habiendo escrito poesía en valenciano y en

de Valencia, y finaliza un  Máster en psicoterapia
Gestalt por la universidad de Murcia
La novela breve El
arpista, (2010), fue uno de los diez finalistas del IX Premio Hontanar de

2011; siendo incluida en la antología Arquitectura de la palabra, del Institut
Alfons el Magnànim.

poesía y narrativa como son Humanos, De

vent.

story:
Hi Family and Friends,



Thanks so much for visiting my fundraising page! 

I was recently asked the question "when did you start writing?" and surprised that person when I told her that at the age of 9. At 9 years old, I wrote a poem (in Spanish, as I was living in the Dominican Republic then) titled, "Mi Querida Princesa." Since then I have written countless poems, short stories, and even some songs (trust me, you don't want to hear those). My dream is to take my writing to the next level and for that I need guidance, inspiration, and motivation and I can't think of a better way than by attending the NYC Latina Writers Group's First Annual Sankofa Sisterhood Writers Retreat ~Releasing the Selfless Woman: Becoming the Selfish Writer! 
( https://www.facebook.com/events/643567249099688/ )

Why this retreat? The retreat is catered for Latina feminists--what else could I want? It lasts three days, starting Friday May 22nd at nighttime and ending early on Monday May 25th (Memorial Day).

The retreat costs $370, plus roundtrip transportation to the Catskills Mountain. Unfortunately, I do not have the amount necessary to fund this retreat, so I need your help! 

I have poetry on soundcloud: 

https://soundcloud.com/radicallatina

I have a blog with political, inspirational, and personal stories (with hundreds of followers):

http://radicallatina.com/

And I have a website where it all comes together here:

http://amandaalcantara.com/

Oh! And don't forget all of the editorials, opinion pieces, and journalism work that I have done.

If my writing in person has touched you, my journalism and opinion based pieces have moved you, or if you simply want to see me continue growing as a writer, consider making a small donation <3

I leave you all with this video of me reading a poem, and a quote: 

https://www.youtube.com/embed/SXyOoEovNyM

"Why am I compelled to write? Because the writing saves me from this complacency I fear. Because I have no choice. Because I must keep the spirit of my revolt and myself alive. Because the world I create in the writing compensates for what the real world does not give me. By writing I put order in the world, give it a handle so I can grasp it. I write because life does not appease my appetites and hunger. I write to record what others erase when I speak, to rewrite the stories others have miswritten about me, about you. To become more intimate with myself and you. To discover myself, to preserve myself, to make myself, to achieve self-autonomy. To dispell the myths that I am a mad prophet or a poor suffering soul. To convince myself that I am worthy and that what I have to say is not a pile of shit. To show that I can and that 1 will write, never mind their admonitions to the contrary. And I will write about the unmentionables, never mind the outraged gasp of the censor and the audience. Finally I wrrite because I’m scared of writing but I’m more scared of not writing." Excerpt from "An Open Letter to Women Writers of Color by Gloria Anzaldúa"

Hugs and Much Appreciation,

Amanda A.

story:
Short Summary

The humble toasted sandwich. Simple. Versatile. Universal. Amazing!

There's one thing that Robbie and Adam from Red FM's Big Breakfast have found  in the last two years...everyone loves a toastie! From childhood favourites to adulthood creations, the people of WA have embraced The Big Breakfast toasted sandwich movement and now it's time to repay the faith. We're taking this thing to the next level!

That's right - we're making a book!! 

Robbie and Adam's Toasted Sandwich Tuesday Recipe Book is ambitious, it's exciting and maybe even a little bit crazy... but the people have spoken and we must respond!

An easy task this will not be - countless ideas and recipes have come across our desk in the last two years - all worthy to appear in this jaffle bible. Sadly, we cant include everything, so we must choose the absolute cream of the crop, the jewels in the crown, the clutch players in the final 5 seconds. The most delicious, tasty, amazing recipes is what we're after and we need you to help us achieve this mountainous task.

What We Need & What You Get

The Big Breakfast boffins have crunched the numbers and the results are in. To recreate all recipes, photograph each toasty treasure, produce the book and provide the perks we need the princely sum of $7800.

To achieve this royal figure we have come up with some perks for our loyal #TST disciples. Help us achieve this sum and you will be regally rewarded with gifts that range from your name chronicled in this historic book - to full blown naming rights on-air.

This is the opportunity to have YOUR favorite recipe gracing the pages!

When all is said and done, Robbie and Adam believe they owe it to toasted sandwich lovers everywhere to make this happen. Lets be honest - if you love #TST then deep down you already know that you owe it to YOURSELF to be involved!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can afford to help in monetary terms - we totally understand. But hey, you can help in other ways! Please by all means share our journey. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blogging - please just share, share, share the TST movement!

story:
Hello! My name is Kofi Opam,

and I'm a 24-year old writer. I was born and raised in New York City (Queens, to be exact #LETSGOMETS), and I have been writing since I was a Lisa Frank diary-loving little kid. I am a cat dad, a lover of bad TV, and the child of Haitian and Ghanaian immigrants.

(My parents and grandmother)

My writing has been published in The Gallatin Review, The Atlas Review, and with the Undiscovered Countries arts festival, and I've won several awards for my work, including the Herbert Rubin Prize for excellence in prose.

I am raising money to help cover the tuition, lodging, and travel costs to attend the 17th annual Voices of Our Nations Arts Workshop at the University of Miami. The VONA Workshop is the country's only multi-genre writing workshop for writers of color, and I just found out that I was selected to participate! 

Going to VONA means the world to me. As a transgender black man, particularly one who is a first-generation immigrant, voices like mine have never really felt supported in conversations about writing - in previous classes we read a lot of Fitzgerald and Hemingway and not a lot of Morrison or Baldwin. This will be my first writing workshop, and my hope is that VONA, as a safe space for writers of color, will give me the opportunity to focus on my writing in an encouraging environment with people of similar experiences! 

(Pictured: photos from VONA workshops, in all of their glory.)

I first heard of the workshop through the work of Dominican author Junot Díaz, one of VONA's original founders. I'm borderline compulsive when it comes to reading everything that Díaz has ever touched - from his short story collections to The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao - because his characters and his writing voice taught me more about myself and my own history than I ever learned in mainstream English classes. The way he writes about Hispañiola, its people and its mythologies and its pain, all ring true for me. 

On top of that, the fact that Díaz received a Pulitzer Prize for a book about a Dominican ghetto-nerd raised a mirror to my own dreams, kind of like: you can do this too, cabrón. 

And now I have the chance to study at the writing workshop that he founded!


(Pictured: the Greatest book of all time. Read it. Now.)

Fundraising Costs & Supporter Perks

Breakdown of Costs (the workshop is June 19 - June 25, and all workshop fees are due by June 1st, which is coming up real quick!):

  • Tuition: $400
  • Room & Board at the University of Miami: $550
  • Roundtrip flight from NYC to Miami: $200
  • All of the money I raise will go towards my tuition and travel fund, and any additional funds will go to Indiegogo fees ($50-$150) and the income I will lose from taking off from work to attend. 
No amount is too small! As a transgender person of color, I struggle to make and to save money. I spend all of my extra income – anything I have left from my paychecks after food, rent, and student loans – on the mounting costs of my medical transition. 

These costs include: weekly hormone replacement therapy; the costs to legally change my name and gender marker with many federal/state agencies (i.e. the DMV, social security, the United States embassy, etc); two recent surgeries and several upcoming procedures (many of which are not covered by my health insurance and have cost me thousands of dollars in medical debt); etc etc. This leaves little room for savings and a lot of room for debt! 


(Pictured:  ya boy Kofi, cheesing hard after his many-thousand dollar top surgery!~*)
I'm also offering fun perks to campaign supporters! (See the column on the top right for all details.) I want you all to be a part of my journey, so these range from shoutouts on social media, to a home-cooked meal with me where we can share our stories and enjoy good food, to illustrated copies of my short stories! (I write about everything from submarine-building teenagers to Haitian voudou to zombies and gender dysphoria.)

(Pictured: sneak peek of my story "Frères", illustrations by Shakhed Hadaya!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help! I love and appreciate every person in my communities, and I understand that a lot of us are some combination of broke and queer and colored. (That's what happens when you attempt to surround yourself with bright and beautiful voices who are actively challenging the status quo with their art, I guess?) That's why I so appreciate your sharing my fundraiser page with your friends, families, and wider networks!

Please feel free to use my fund hashtags! 

  • #WriteKofiWrite 
  • #BrokeQueersWrite 
  • #WritingWhileKofi 

(Me and my cat George, thanking you all for your support and generosity!)

story:
Story of My Book

Dream Smaller includes genuine stories from real women on their own journeys to having a life they are passionate about living. After 50+ interviews with women from a diverse range of backgrounds, I have connected the dots and outlined the key components to “Having It All” in the context of your own life.

My name is Drew Dudley and I am the author of Dream Smaller: A Reaction Against the Idea That Women Can’t “Have It All”. I wrote this book because I was told to #DreamSmaller in relation to my personal and professional goals when they weren’t all that lofty. It became my mission to find women out there in the big bad world who have designed their lives in an intentional way to incorporate what was most important to them. They “Have It All” in the context of their own life!

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that no dream is too big to tackle if you have the right structure in place to accomplish it. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for goal setting and personal/professional development in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you turn the life you’ve dreamed of into a reality!

In this book, you'll learn about community building and finding inspiration.

  • You’ll hear from Shannon Vetto, a former-executive who felt lost at a transition point in her career and ended up pivoting to an entirely new industry. Find out how she employed her “Personal Board of Directors” in this uncertain period to get the advice and coaching she needed to take a leap of faith!
  • The Story of Jenn Leitch. After 10 years as a nurse, her manager pushed her to take on more responsibility. In order to accomplish her new career goals, Jenn went back to school not once but twice all while raising two children. Find out how she was able to logistically make it all happen!
  • You’ll learn about how Chelsey White took the leap of faith to turn her passion for baking into her paycheck becoming a cake influencer on Instagram!

You will love this book if you are an introspective individual with big dreams. Dream Smaller: A Reaction Against the Idea That Women Can’t “Have It All” is a non-fiction book that speaks to women in any season of their lives who are looking at using values-based decision making to design the life they dream of living for the first time.

 

About the Author

No one can accuse Drew Dudley of being one dimensional. By day, she is a Sales Enablement Specialist at Highspot, a SaaS company dedicated to aligning sales and marketing teams. By night, she practices her love of cooking, writes short fiction, and hunts for the best craft beer in Seattle.

Drew started writing this book because she envisioned a big life for herself. With no compass to point her in the right direction, she went in search of the women who “Have It All'”. What Drew found was no cookie-cutter answer. The concept of “Having It All” means different things to different people at different stages in their lives.

When she is not wearing her superwoman cape, Drew spends far too much time and energy in the pursuit of the perfect brunch and traveling the world. 9 times out of 10 she will make friends with the person seated next to her on the airplane and find out their entire life story. Travel with her at your own risk.

For more information, you can connect with Drew at dreamsmaller2019@gmail.com and @drewcdudley on Instagram/Twitter.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #DreamSmaller and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

If you want to stay up to date, join the Dream Smaller Group on Facebook, and follow on Twitter and instagram! 

FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/dreamsmaller/

IG: https://www.instagram.com/drewcdudley/

TWITTER: https://twitter.com/drewcdudley

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Drew Dudley

The concept of “Having It All” means different things to different people at different stages in their lives.When she is not wearing her superwoman cape, Drew spends far too much time and energy in the pursuit of the perfect brunch and traveling the world. 9 times out of 10 she will make friends with the person seated next to her on the airplane and find out their entire life story. Travel with her at your own risk.For more information, you can connect with Drew at dreamsmaller2019@gmail.com and @drewcdudley on Instagram/Twitter. Other Ways You Can HelpPlease Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #DreamSmaller and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.If you want to stay up to date, join the Dream Smaller Group on Facebook, and follow on Twitter and instagram! FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/dreamsmaller/IG: https://www.instagram.com/drewcdudley/TWITTER: https://twitter.com/drewcdudleyPlease share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Drew Dudley

story:
Please help support the Flor De Nopal Literary Festival as we complete our third year of offering quality diverse literary programming! Since 2011, we've featured more than 40 poets and writers from across the U.S. and offered over 21 free writing workshops.

My name is ire'ne lara silva. My brother and I are the co-coordinators for the Flor De Nopal Literary Festival. Our dream has been to open up a space for the creation of new literary/writing/creative communities. In the past few years, we have seen these communities take root and grow. For the future, we imagine strengthening and expanding what we have already begun.

The Flor de Nopal Literary Festival’s mission is to promote the literary work of emerging and established Mexican-American/Latin@ poets and writers, to create and nourish ties between Mexican-American/Latin@ writers and writers of other
races and ethnicities, and to offer writing workshops not only of interest to other
writers but to diverse communities.

Unfortunately, this year, many of our funding sources suffered budgetary cuts and we have not been able to raise the funds we need to complete our 2013 programming. 

Currently, we need to raise a total of  $2000 for Flor De Nopal and for Red Salmon Arts' SOY (Save Our Youth) Program...Red Salmon Arts was founded by the late poet raul r. salinas and is the non-profit umbrella for Flor De Nopal.

$1100 to fund honoraria for the writers which will be featured on December 6, 2013. Many of these writers have already been involved with Flor De Nopal by offering free writing workshops to the community.

$200 to cover costs of gifts + shipping/handling for donors.

$700 to fund Red Salmon Arts as it re-launches its efforts with the SOY (Save Our Youth) Program.

Any funds raised over the target amount will benefit Red Salmon Arts/SOY Program. If we do not reach our target amount, honoraria, gifts, and RSA/SOY's funding will be proportionately reduced. (For example, if we raise only $1000, $550 will go to honoraria, $100 to gifts, and $350 to RSA/SOY).

All donations are tax-deductible contributions. All donations made during this campaign are tax-deductible for 2013. Please be aware that if you choose to accept a gift, the monetary value of your tax-deduction will be reduced by the dollar value of the gift. (For example, if you donate $100 and accept a signed book, then your tax-deductible contribution is $85.) Gifts for contributors include signed copies of books by Daniel Chacon, Laurie Ann Guerrero, and ire'ne lara silva.

                                                               ***

Red Salmon Arts/Save Our Youth (SOY)

Red Salmon Arts sponsors literary projects like Save Our Youth (SOY), one of the first in Austin to work with youth correctional facilities. By emphasizing cultural knowledge and pride, SOY seeks to empower "hard to reach" young people and redirects their negative activities into positive and reactive outlets through participation in workshops focusing on culture, arts, and literacy. SOY workshop facilitators conduct extensive creative writing clinics in national/local schools and
juvenile justice facilities. These workshops help participants build self-esteem
and develop verbal/written communication and conflict resolution.

                                                                   ***

You can also help by publicizing this campaign and our Featured Reading on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media...(use the Indiegogo share tools!)

Consider donating to Red Salmon Arts/Flor De Nopal Literary Festival in 2014! Plans are already underway for a fourth year of quality diverse programming!

 

!Mil gracias!

ire'ne

story:
The Impact

Nowadays, you read about a "crazy person" shooting someone and then themselves on the news all too often.  There's usually a manifesto, but who gets to read it?  This book is about a Bipolar Woman's healing, and provides a look into the mind of what some may label as a "crazy person."  It is a perspective lacking in our society, and one which will greatly contribute to understanding. 

As to the story, come giggle and be shocked as you discover great truths about humankind in the time loop, while watching a pot-smoking Telepath find herself in the Snowden exposed Honey Trap in the USA, and on her way to spiritual redemption!!  In addition, it details persecution during out times in the USA, and forgiveness.

http://www.nbcnews.com/feature/edward-snowden-interview/exclusive-snowden-docs-show-british-spies-used-sex-dirty-tricks-n23091

This collection of journal entries, stories and observations is weaved together with a tasteful combination of prose, music, poetry and social commentary.  In fact, one chapter is dedicated to poetry alone. 

You'll be delighted, dazzled and tickled pink by some of the off-the-wall ideas, observations and truths shared by this Bipolar Woman Narrator ranging from sex to Eugenics.

AND IF YOU THOUGHT YOUR SINS WERE BAD,  WAIT ‘TILL YOU READ THIS BOOK…

Most people don’t realize just how forgiving God is; there is very little you can do that hasn’t been already done by someone else in time and that hasn’t already been forgiven.  This book will entertain you not only with an impossibly naïve, irrational and immature perspective which you will watch develop right under your eyes as the Lord transforms the subject, or “molds the vase,” into a maturity level fit for the revelation of some Biblical mysteries that you'll find to be amazing! 

Audrey Wright is a New York City native who has lived in several locations on the East Coast and who has also travelled outside of the USA: she has acquired a worldly perspective which you might find refreshing.  At age 15 she became an Albert G. Oliver Scholar and was placed at a Quaker Boarding School.  She was a Dyckman Scholar while at Columbia University where she earned a Bachelor’s Degree in Comparative Literature.  Audrey was diagnosed Bipolar Manic in 1997 but that didn’t stop her from progressing in her career.  However, due in part to Cancer, she retired in 2009. 

The Heal is based on Audrey’s story of survival and healing from 2009 to 2014.

The first 300 pages of The Heal are already written, and in fact, Audrey received a publishing contract offer just 2 days after submitting her manuscript to a Publisher, who threw in in a free commercial!  However, Audrey needs funds to register copyright, legal fees, purchase a new PC and software, develop and purchase marketing materials, domain registrations reimbursement, removal of ads from websites, and other start-up expenses.

EVERY DOLLAR YOU GIVE WILL HELP! 

But if you don't have $$ right now, please help by spreading the word about this book soon to be available through Tate Publishing - post it on FB and/or tell your Pastor!  And if you can afford it, buy one for yourself and another for a friend!


SAMPLE POEM:     The Untouchables

041414

First, let me declare it is not my intent to belittle or to steal glory from the author who first penned the bestseller by the same name.  No, I simply want to remind you of it, and tell you about a new class of untouchables, right here at home.

They’re untouchable because

They are hidden from view

To more than just a few

They affect and sometimes protect

The “world” we live in, me and you

But being unseen and untouchable

As a spirit sometimes is

They wield influence in your lives

Yes and sometimes even in your wives

It is with expert care

That they remain unseen

For the tasks that they perform

Are sometimes truly sins.

Sometimes I say, for there are some

Who have reconciled with Heaven’s Throne

Infused with Spirit some have become

And demons in them now overcome.

That’s not to say we don’t still suffer

From being sometimes maligned by some

That’s not to say the end intent

Is always all that great

It serves to say to you instead

That even those who they behead

Serve a purpose here on Earth

With our suffering we edify

And the Justice can’t deny

Sometimes we have been maligned

“Yes, we suffer without cause,”

Some of you might dare to say

They block our mail

And some blackmail

Into silence or entrapment

While yet others they do slay

Was it not the Lord who warned us

All those many years ago

And with love He did command us

For his son Jesus to wait?

Beautiful is He in splendor

Beautiful just one of His names

Yes the comforter is with us

And He is here, I speak of Jesus

Though you may not see or hear Him

Straight to Heaven you should plead

To have Him manifest Himself for Thee

Then with power you’ll be blessed

Your prayer rising to the nest

Gathered with favor from the rest

Always pray you pass the tests

Tests I say for there are many

It never seizes to amaze me

The great power in His mercy

And how he edifies anew

Pass/Fail you’ll get a lesson

Made just for me and you.

It is with patience

He does sculpt and make anew

The horror hears within us

Especially those filled with indignity

For the injustices suffered daily

Yes, by you – the perpetrator, and me.

Yes I speak of the perpetrators

Those untouchables to you and me

Those who hide behind the cameras

Those who in shifts watch you and me

It is a byproduct our performance

We simply for Jesus must live

Know our lives are a testimony

And in their spying some are made clean

Perchance with white robes he will dress them

Yes even those who no persecute us

Yes I speak of you and me

Perchance they’ll be afforded

Mercy too and they’ll escape

The judgment of the second death

Only God knows why this happens

But who are we to question Him

Just remember that to Him

We must all be a family

And so rejoice when you drink tears

Know He’s with you and He’s making

Through your suffering intercession

Not just for us but also for

Those who still remain unseen.




© Copyright 2014 Audrey Andujar AKA Audrey Wright, Florida, USA.  All Rights Reserved.

story:
Short Summary

For 18 years, I have been writing various versions of this story. It came to me in a dream on the afternoon of June 13th, 1996. I ran downstairs to write is as a short story before I forgot it. It then became a screenplay called 'Blood' that finished in the top 10% of the Expo 4 contest out of 2,500 entrants (see here; http://messageboard.donedealpro.com/boards/showthread.php?t=14249)

Now I am about to launch The Vorbing on an unsuspecting public as a novel. I will withhold the title until publication, you'll see why. Self-publishing is a fantastic way to get your work out there with no barriers.

What I Need & What You Get

I need approximately €1000 to get my book cover designed, have my manuscript formatted into all the various formats for eBook and print, get all the ISBN numbers necessary and get a print run done (I'm sure there will be more costs down the line). Regardless of whether I reach the full amount I am seeking, I will utilise every cent raised to get my book out there.

N.B. You are not purchasing any rights to my book, all of which remain 100% with me at all times as will any subsequent royalties from sales of the novel. It is merely a goodwill gesture on your behalf to help me get my book out there.

    The Impact

    This is where you come in, dear readers. You can get in on the ground floor and be part of what I hope will become a fantasy franchise and YOU can help fund it. For as little as €2 (US$ 2.60) donation, you can put this project in motion. Donate more and your name will printed in the book. If this book takes off, your name is there as one of the first passengers on this voyage of discovery!

      Risks & Challenges

      I am currently doing a course in Social Media for Business to help me sell these books online and I am determined to succeed as an author with your help.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are unable to contribute, thank you for reading but please pass on news of my campaign to someone who could help. Thank you so much, everyone. People really are amazing and I know you won't let me down. Thanks for reading, Stewart.

It then became a screenplay called 'Blood' that finished in the top 10% of the Expo 4 contest out of 2,500 entrants (see here; http://messageboard.donedealpro.com/boards/showthread.php?t=14249)
Now I am about to launch The Vorbing on an unsuspecting public as a novel. I will withhold the title until publication, you'll see why. Self-publishing is a fantastic way to get your work out there with no barriers.   What I Need & What You Get I need approximately €1000 to get my book cover designed, have my manuscript formatted into all the various formats for eBook and print, get all the ISBN numbers necessary and get a print run done (I'm sure there will be more costs down the line). Regardless of whether I reach the full amount I am seeking, I will utilise every cent raised to get my book out there.
N.B. You are not purchasing any rights to my book, all of which remain 100% with me at all times as will any subsequent royalties from sales of the novel. It is merely a goodwill gesture on your behalf to help me get my book out there.

  The Impact This is where you come in, dear readers. You can get in on the ground floor and be part of what I hope will become a fantasy franchise and YOU can help fund it. For as little as €2 (US$ 2.60) donation, you can put this project in motion. Donate more and your name will printed in the book. If this book takes off, your name is there as one of the first passengers on this voyage of discovery!

  Risks & Challenges I am currently doing a course in Social Media for Business to help me sell these books online and I am determined to succeed as an author with your help.

  Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, thank you for reading but please pass on news of my campaign to someone who could help. Thank you so much, everyone. People really are amazing and I know you won't let me down. Thanks for reading, Stewart.

story:
Who We Are

The Black Authors & Readers Rock Weekend had it's beginning in 2008, when the The Reading Divas Book Club, celebrated their tenth anniversary; I founded the club in 1998. The feedback about the event was very positive. Both readers and writers were looking for places and events to fill the gap that was being created by the closing of many of our brick and mortal stores. Once I realized  there was an audience for this event, I asked the club members to work with me to make it an annual event - and we have!

The support for the event by the literary community has been phenomenal. Keynote speakers have included award winning authors Mary Monroe, Deberry & Grant, Daniel Black, Bernice McFadden, Pamela Samuels-Young (2014 NAACP Image Award Winner), ReShonda Tate-Billingsley, and Victoria Christopher-Murray. The Author Expo and Panels have been supported by many other established authors, such as Pulitzer Prize Winner Leonard Pitts, Jr., Renee Flagler, Karen Quinones Miller, Trice Hickman and dozens of emerging authors.  The 2014 keynote speaker is NY Times Best Selling Author Kimberla Lawson Roby. More information about the event can be found at www.realdivasread.com.

What We Need

In 2012, we expanded the event from a one-day brunch to a two-day conference that included panel discussions. Blogger AE Hellar of Hellar Reviews wrote, "On Saturday October 19th I had the pleasure to attend the Black Authors & Readers Rock Weekend…Unlike much larger book conferences this event provides an intimate opportunity for leisurely networking while learning about books and the publishing industry with book lovers, readers, authors, editors and publishers".

It is important that we raise monies because:

  • Most authors don't have an unlimited budget to attend literary events;
  • Most readers are more likely to support an event when the tickets are reasonably priced so they can also buy books during the event.
  • The Divas started a book club for young ladies - 8 to 12 years old - in 2013. We purchase the books they read and would like to have them attend the event so they can meet and see authors in action.

The size of the audience and the Author Expo have more than doubled since the first event, and we need help not to just to sustain that growth but also to be able to continue to attract award winning authors. All monies raised will be used to:

  • Pay for meeting rooms, advertising and audio-visual equipment and printing
  • Pay for accommodations for featured authors
  • Pay for the meals for the "Young Divas" during the conference
  • The Impact

I hope I have conveyed both my passion for this event and for "reading". I'm sure you, like me, don't want reading to become a lost art. Though Oprah and Terry McMillan opened many doors and minds to books, there are still a lot of people who don't open even one book a year.  It is through conferences and other events that we are able to demonstrate to the literary community and the public that "The Black Community Reads & Rocks". I sincerely hope you will support this, our seventh event!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute or not, PLEASE help by spreading the word.  

  • Get the word out about this campaign to your friends, share on your FB page, with your book club, etc. Every donation counts!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Please support Queen's Ferry Press in marketing funding for Heather Fowler's fourth collection, Elegantly Naked In My Sexy Mental Illness.




Queen’s Ferry Press is a small press publisher that has, within just a few years, established itself as a prime venue within the literary market for authors to place their frequently overlooked short story collections.

The press endeavors to provide a home for the best fiction collections, whether they belong to O’ Henry Prize winners or NEA Grant recipients—or first-time, nascent authors.

As an independent press operating under serious financial constraints, however, the all-important advertising budget is not on par with that of larger publishers, though we believe the quality and presentation of our titles is easily comparable.

Queen’s Ferry is publishing Heather Fowler’s fourth collection of stories and we believe she is especially qualified to benefit from a larger marketing budget that can reach outlets the small, independent press simply cannot.

Heather Fowler’s fourth collection of fiction speaks the language of need. Desperate, obsessive, even demented need—both emotional and erotic—is voiced by characters ill or ill-advised. From cyber to stalker, illicit, explicit, tender and tedious, the relationships in Elegantly Naked In My Sexy Mental Illness translate love and lust into disorder. How we hear our own need and the way it sounds to others proves in these enthralling stories an imperfect but utterly captivating conversation, a destructive yet dynamic discourse between well-being and disease, images and words.

by Heather Fowler
Art and Appendices by Pablo Vision

PRAISE for Elegantly Naked In My Sexy Mental Illness :

“The stories in Heather Fowler’s Elegantly Naked In My Sexy Mental Illness span time and space, sanity and insanity, our dreams and our nightmares. From Renaissance Italy to the French Revolution to the modern dangers of Facebook stalkers, Fowler’s characters explore all of the pleasures and pains of love, that “monster…forged from both hope and desire.” Fowler takes risks; each story is a spellbinding journey. I can’t think of a short story collection I’m more excited to recommend this year.”
—Shaindel Beers, author of A Brief History of Time and The Children’s War and Other Poems



“Heather Fowler writes stories that need to be written. Unabashedly ripping open the emotional turmoil that continues to plague the lives of men and women, Fowler crafts fantastical tales that reveal the underbelly of our pains and desperation. She’s the heir of Angela Carter, caressing words like lovers, making the unreal real.”
—Paula Bomer, author of Nine Months


“The characters in Heather Fowler’s fiction are strange and magnificent, sad and strong, trapped and independent, adjusted and not. In other words, they are real. The sheer variety of stories in Elegantly Naked In My Sexy Mental Illness is striking and the pure athletic grace with which each is told is testament to Fowler’s willingness to stretch and experiment. This is an author with a voluminous bag of tools. She is daring and audacious in all the right ways. There is a delight to her surprises, her wonderments. Savor her titles, which, emblematic of her range, are pithy, mordant, cerebral, playful and ingenious: ‘Giant Balloon Animal Tragedies,’ ‘Good Country. People’ (with its conscious echoes of Flannery O’Connor, an author to whom Fowler can be favorably compared), ‘Speak to Me with Tenderness, Howard Sun.’ Heather Fowler is adept at decoding the human predicament. One yarn begins, ‘Listen, I am telling you a story.’ So you lean closer and, when you do, you can feel the author’s warm breath on your cheek.”
—Corey Mesler, author of Diddy-Wah-Diddy: A Beale Street Suite


Art and Appendices by Pablo Vision

Poster options by Pablo Vision

Hand-Licker

Losing Married Women

Howard Sun

Taking Celine

Blood, Hunger, Child       

Ever

Con Yola

Mother's Angels

Good Country. People.

Ledge

Giant Balloon Animal Tragedies

His Other Women

Summer Rose

The Gray Fairy

The Scene

Tiger Man



Queen’s Ferry Press was founded in August 2011 with the aim of offering writing that conveys via its structuring and interpretation. As an independent press specializing in collections of literary fiction, Queen’s Ferry is influenced by a Scottish coastal estuary through which crossings have occurred for over a thousand years, and the two bridges that currently span its waters and link towns. As such, Queen’s Ferry Press concerns itself with the construction of narrative vehicles. We are intrigued by the practice and function of fabrication, whether resulting in leading-edge compositions akin to feats of modern engineering or more traditional groupings suggestive of time-honored assemblage. At Queen’s Ferry Press, bricolage as a means of physical crafting and emotional connection is celebrated.

story: Calgary's Prairie Fire Poetry Slam Team has survived four team changes and a flood in the last three months.  In response, we cried a little.   Then we wrote more, shared more and practiced even harder.  Now Erin Dingle, Christa Mayer, Sebastien Wen, Travis West and Emilie Magnan need your help to compete in this years' National Poetry Slam Team Championship at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word from November 3 to 10 in Montreal.  Your contributions will help pay for flights and a few beds so we can share our poetry with the rest of Canada.  Calgary's Team was a Finalist in last year's competitions.  Please help us go all the way this year!

Hola muchas gracias por leer este artículos Soy FREDDY ALJENIS PIMENTEL PAREDES, vivo en República Dominicana y  me han aprobados a una beca para estudiar teología social en Costa Rica. La beca solo me apoyará con el hospedaje y la alimentación durante todo el mes del taller. Ahora tengo que comprar mi pasaje aéreo, por lo cual necesito 500 personas que donen 1 dolar (PSD$43) y con eso me ayudaras para logra esta gran meta!

Adjunto encontraras mi carta de aceptación al programa (para que le sirva de prueba) y mi perfil de Facebook por si deseas contactarme y hacerme mas preguntas! 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/messages/argeny.pimentel 

Gracias! Paso a Paso lo lograremos!

El 29 de marzo de 2014 el Nuevo Día publicó:

Mientras en las altas esferas del Gobierno se discute la reforma energética y los altos costos de la energía eléctrica, para una familia del municipio de Florida la controversia se ha convertido en una lucha entre la vida y la muerte.

Mercado Román padece de distrofia muscular de Duchenne, la cual avanza rápidamente, provocando atrofia, contracturas musculares, trastornos respiratorios, entre otros síntomas.

Ve el video y lee la noticia completa aquí.

story:
ME

Hi everyone, my name's Caighlan Smith. Ever since I started school people have been mispronouncing my name, with good reason. I've gotten Kaglin, Caitlin, Collin-- once someone even called me Charlie. Mostly teachers, usually substitutes, would reach my name on the attendance list and pause for a very long time, at which point I'd tentatively raise my hand and tell them how to say my name. Throughout school, I was painfully shy, but this call-to-attention that came from my pig-Latin name, I got used to it. My mom always told me my name was taken from "girl" in one language, "warrior" in another. Which I liked, considering I am a girl, and what fantasy reader to-be fantasy novelist doesn't want her name to mean warrior? Still, I was shallowly upset at the fact searching my own name online resulted in nothing, except a little squiggly red line underneath it and an auto correct. Did you mean Caitlin Smith? It still does that, but now when I search myself I get results that actually correspond with the correct spelling of my name; results about my books. It's kind of worth it in that way, to have this ridiculous name for so long, so now when I search it the first hit I get is what I'm most proud of in my life, my novel.


The Novel

I say "The Novel" when inwardly I still think "My Novel." I can't help it. Even when so many people own a part of it now-- my publisher, editor, all the people who helped make it happen-- it's still my baby, still a piece of me that instinctively turns me possessive. It's weird. I feel like it's mine and I never want anyone to take it from me, but at the same time I want to give it away. I want people to love it and my upcoming novels as much as I do; so much that they become as instinctively possessive as me. Because as much as I write for myself, I write for other people. I want to give my readers what writers give me; a new reality, a new piece of myself, a new love. I want to share my writing and whatever it may give with everyone.

That Wasn't Really About The Novel, Was It?

At least, not the facts about the novel itself, the really juicy stuff. I didn't even tell you the title. It's called Hallow Hour and, to be honest, when it first came out I was embarrassed when people asked me the title. I was a jumbled mess of shyness, pride, and social awkwardness whenever my book was brought up. I wasn't used to talking about my stories, let alone stories that could now be acquired at the local Chapters, read or skimmed, and brutally criticized. The whole thing terrified me. Then I started going into schools and reading to different grade levels from my book, with question periods after the reading. That knocked the embarrassment and shyness right out of me. These students, they actually liked my book. I couldn't believe it! I'd stop reading, right after a monster had attacked, or when a mysterious new character arrived, and they'd want me to continue! Of course I wouldn't, because I'm a writer, and don't we have this nasty tendency towards cliff-hangers? (Don't worry, I never left off at too painful a spot. I'm not that mean.) Point is, after all of this-- of actually seeing, in person, the excited, glowing reactions I have to a book on someone else about my book-- well, let's just say I don't mind telling people the title of my novel anymore. Hallow Hour. Or the sequel. New Year. That one's going to be released mid-May, right before The Emerging Writers' Festival, and oh boy can you bet I'm excited!


Festival Excitement

 If I'm ready to burst into happy beams of rainbows and sparkles at the thought of my next novel coming out, then a glorious iridescent unicorn will probably hop out of my stomach at the idea of attending this Festival immediately after New Year's release. As mentioned, it's called The Emerging Writers' Festival, held in Melbourne, Australia. Australia. As a youngster, I traveled around with my mom a bit, due to her job, but never have I gotten close to Australia. You know the Travel List, the one everyone has of places they want to see, at least once? For me, Australia is way, way up on that list. As in top three. Of course, I can't tell you which slot it takes, because that would be an early reveal, cutting the suspense. (I just can't turn off this writer business, see? It doesn't help that I'm also an English Major.) So the fact this Festival I've been invited to attend as a guest author is in Australia is one, huge thing, but the fact I'm being invited to attend as a guest author? I'm pretty sure this is one of those opportunities of a life-time that I've employed in past stories. (Or, you know, that I've heard of people getting in actual real life.) So to sum it all up-- hopefully eloquently, considering my chosen profession-- I, Caighlan Smith, 19 year old English Major at Memorial University of Newfoundland, who will soon have two novels out in a YA Fantasy, Post-apocalyptic, Adventure series, has started this campaign in hopes of going on her own fantasy adventure (I'll leave the post-apocalyptic for now, thanks.) I want to do this, more than anything. I want to share my novels with people all over the world, to bring them joy, excitement, entertainment, happiness-- whatever my novels, the novels, their novels, can bring.

So that's me, the campaign, the novel; or, at least, some of each. If it so behooves you, check out my website: http://www.caighlansmith.com/ (this is the first hit when I search my name!!!!) and if you want to know more about The Emerging Writers' Festival in general, check out other authors attending and such, just give it a search! I can guarantee no sassy search engine's going to correct you on this one!

So the fact this Festival I've been invited to attend as a guest author is in Australia is one, huge thing, but the fact I'm being invited to attend as a guest author? I'm pretty sure this is one of those opportunities of a life-time that I've employed in past stories. (Or, you know, that I've heard of people getting in actual real life.) So to sum it all up-- hopefully eloquently, considering my chosen profession-- I, Caighlan Smith, 19 year old English Major at Memorial University of Newfoundland, who will soon have two novels out in a YA Fantasy, Post-apocalyptic, Adventure series, has started this campaign in hopes of going on her own fantasy adventure (I'll leave the post-apocalyptic for now, thanks.) I want to do this, more than anything. I want to share my novels with people all over the world, to bring them joy, excitement, entertainment, happiness-- whatever my novels, the novels, their novels, can bring.
So that's me, the campaign, the novel; or, at least, some of each. If it so behooves you, check out my website: http://www.caighlansmith.com/ (this is the first hit when I search my name!!!!) and if you want to know more about The Emerging Writers' Festival in general, check out other authors attending and such, just give it a search! I can guarantee no sassy search engine's going to correct you on this one!

story:
For those of you who don't know me, my name is Christopher Ruocchio, and ever since the Second Grade I have wanted to be a novelist. At the end of this September, I finished the first draft of my science fiction novel--tentatively titled "As the Tempest Falls"--and have been in the process of doing the second draft. I spent October taking notes on my first draft, and this last month, for NaNoWriMo, I rewrote the first quarter of my novel, itself a cohesive story with beginning, middle and end.

Today I became aware of an opportunity. The fantasy and science fiction writer Saladin Ahmed, whose work I respect immensely, has offered to give thorough critiques of people's ~50,000 word pieces for 600 dollars. (More about his deal here: http://saladinahmed.tumblr.com/post/10142807048...)

Needless to say, this would be invaluable to me. It is my hope and intention to have the second draft finished by the end of March 2015, and with Mr. Ahmed's advice on the first of four acts, I would be given the direction I need to move my novel forward and make it all it can be.

The problem, of course, is that I do not have 600 dollars. I wait tables for a living, and work six nights a week ON TOP of taking a full course load at North Carolina State, leaving little money aside for the pursuit of other things. Your help, should you deign to provide it, would the world to me.

story:
As many of you know, I recently signed a contract with "Resource Publications", an imprint of Wipf & Stock Publishers. With this comes expenses, as I will be responsible for copy-editing and type-setting fees. That is where you hopefully come in.

Recently, I quit my well-paying job in order to pursue writing as full-time as possible. I also took a part time job to help with bills, but I know that I am no longer going to make the money I once did (most writers would completely understand this!). I feel as if God has called me to write and to spread the message of peace to as many people as I can, regardless if I make a single penny or not.

Over the past year, I have faced a lot of trials and tribulations, pain and suffering, and a loss of friends and loved-ones. The theology I hold to does not sit well with most, but as many of you know, that hasn't stopped me from teaching it. I pray that with your help, this book can be my biggest contribution yet.

I know I am asking a lot. Even $1 is a lot because it asks you to support a cause that most are not in agreement with. However, I believe it is vital to get this word out there because for too long, people have justified violence because they believe God is violent. My long-winded answer to that is this book. I hope you can partner with me in spreading this message.

Thank you. God bless. May the peace of God reign forever.

story:
Executive Summary

This campaign exists to fund a published version of the Karma Sense Eating Plan, a sincere yet light-hearted movement that improves your health, increases your happiness and enhances your appreciation for others. The Karma Sense Eating Plan originated as a series of blog posts at karma-sense.com.

About the Karma Sense Eating Plan

Your weight? Your LDL/HDL?  Your A1C? Your health is about more than achieving some numeric value. Reaching a number won't give you long-term happiness. Besides, how do we make sense of the swirl of conflicting data on what to do for better health? The Karma Sense Eating Plan provides a realistic approach for achieving optimal health and happiness. It cuts through the scientific mumbo jumbo without taking itself too seriously. If you want to

  • Be healthier,
  • Be happier, and
  • Make the world a better place,
the Karma Sense Eating Plan is for you. It's an audacious goal, one that requires Karma Sense.
What it is

  • A suite of behaviors you can adopt in part or in whole;
  • An inclusive and tolerant lifestyle that makes no assumptions about your values, goals, lifestyle or schedule;
  • An opportunity to explore concepts of health and happiness in whatever depth you seek;
  • An evidenced-based approach to reach your goals.
What it isn't

  • A prescriptive plan that you can either pass or fail;
  • A list of restrictions that challenges your needs;
  • A boring or dogmatic review of nutrition and health facts;
  • A diet.

About the Author

My name is Dave Hellman but some people call me Davey H. I'm a regular guy with a degree in Computer Science and Psychology and therefore not your typical self-help author. I’ve taken thousands of hours of coursework on nutrition, cooking and the food business; more than most physicians. I voraciously read magazines, books and have an inbox flooded with data on the subject. And when I’m not working my 6 AM to 6 PM job in high technology, I practice as a certified Exercise Nutrition Coach and an Integrative Health Coach. I trained at Duke University Integrative Medicine and Precision Nutrition, two of the leading and most prestigious institutions in their respective fields. I guide professional athletes and business people towards success.


About this Campaign

I introduced the Karma Sense Eating Plan in the blog for my nutrition and health coaching practice, Live Long Lead Long. I knew I was onto something but did not expect such fantastic reader response. As the series progressed, the requests for a book version increased. However, I continued with the blog version so I wouldn’t leave the existing readers hanging.

I am the first to admit, the world does not need another healthy lifestyle/diet book. Fortunately, the Karma Sense Eating Plan is not just another healthy lifestyle/diet book. Because rather than force fitting some overbearing set of rules into your way of life, it reverse engineers a healthy lifestyle based on what you want most out of life as well as from your tastes, values, and inevitable constraints.

Currently, 80% of the content for this book is published on the web. But since then, I've expanded to include additional planning tools, recipes, food lists, and case studies. See the statistics below to get an idea of where the book currently stands.
Book Stats
  • 6x9 inch (A5) pages: 310
  • Footnotes: 124
  • Figures: 54
  • Tables: 21
  • Ridiculous Pop Culture References: Countless

About Your Support

I'm asking for your support to assist in funding the publishing of this book. I've carried all expenses to date and will continue to fund this project as needed. Here are some additional tasks I'd like to complete.
  • Developmental Editing
  • Copyediting
  • Artwork including cover art, improvement of some of the figures and overall design
  • Formatting for print and e-publishing
  • Administrative costs (e.g. getting an ISBN)
  • Promotion costs
I have estimates for many of these tasks but no firm quotes. The goal is based on this estimate. I'll fully fund this project regardless of whether this campaign reaches its goal or if the expenses end up being greater than the total contribution. And if expenses are lower, I have a plan for that too.
Since this is a book about making you healthier, happier, and saving the world, I will donate all profits that result from the sale of this book to charities that fight poverty and hunger. Your funding gets this project that much closer to profitability.

About the Perks

There are three types of perks associated with this campaign:
  1. Be one of the first people to receive the Karma Sense Eating Plan either as an eBook or in its printed form.
  2. Receive any one of the four Karma Sense personalized health coaching packages.
  3. Become a member of the Karma Sense Advisory Board and help determine the charities that receive the profits from the sale of the Karma Sense Eating Plan book.
See the perks section of this campaign for specifics.

About the Risks

I'm carrying the risk of this project. The book already exceeds the quality of the typical self-published book. You can judge for yourself by reading the posts on my blog starting with the Karma Sense Index page. I've made significant improvements since then.
But even without outside funding, I'll invest in the editing and design work necessary to bring the quality up to a higher standard. I'm convinced that if even a small number of people adopt some or all of the elements of the Karma Sense Eating Plan, the world will be better off. That's incentive to make this book as desirable to others as possible.
Please don't let that stop you from contributing, though. Every cent I receive means more money for the charities that benefit from this initiative.

About Other Opportunities to Help

Besides your monetary contribution you can help in the following ways:
  • Read the Karma Sense Eating Plan in its current blog form and adopt the relevant elements for you. If you prefer, contact me and I'll send it to you in PDF format.
  • Provide me input on any aspects of this project regardless of whether it is this campaign, the content of the book, or anything else you think I should know.
  • Spread the word to your friends, relatives, colleagues, or random people you happen to encounter. Use email, social media, or whatever else works.
  • Share this campaign via the Indiegogo sharing tools.
Thank you in advance for anything you can do.

story:
"My Wish" is the life story of Bhante Sujatha, a man who was born to bring happiness to the world. Raised in poverty in the jungles of Sri Lanka,  this man uses loving kindness, mindfulness and a refreshingly humble attitude to realize his life's mission.  In the process, he becomes the Chief Sanganayaka ( the chief monk) of North America.


You'll enjoy this narrative biography about a man who was born with a desire to help people.  Travel the world with Bhante as he follows his dream and brings his happy ways to our shores. After ten years of hard work, relentless generosity, and crazy optimism,  he opens a beautiful meditation center in a small Midwestern town.   This temple, a bastion of inclusion and loving kindness, is a miraculous testament to the power of relentless focus on a noble dream.

What We Need & What You Get

I've been working hard for months behind the scenes, assembling a team, writing, editing, formatting, learning more about the amazing life of Bhante Sujatha and the history of the temple in Woodstock.  The book is almost ready to release.  This is the final push and we need your help to get it done.  

You'll receive a wonderful book and an opportunity to support a noble project. 

The Impact

Bhante Sujatha believes, like the Dalai Lama, that our world can change  through the simple practice of meditation and mindfulness.  He is a true servant-leader, who teaches Americans how to heal their wounded minds, resist the sway of consumerism, deepen their spiritual life, and achieve lasting happiness.   

In this profound and simple tale, people are reminded of the magic in their childhood, entertained by a great tale, and inspired by the idea that one person with an impossible dream can make a profound difference in this world.

THis is a book that enhances any spiritual or mindfulness practice.  It is a story about the power of love and the miraculous results of loving kindness and humble leadership.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still help:

  • Become a fan of My Wish on Facebook
  • Share this indiegogo campaign
  • Practice loving kindness and meditation
