story:
~Original Video~

www.TrueLightOfDarkness.com


The Story

Established in the conceptual framework of my first book Decomposing The Shadow, I offer you, with as much honesty as I can muster, The True Light Of Darkness.

This book presents three of my most notable experiences of facing the darkness of my psyche through psilocybin. Each story takes place at different points of development within my own practice, and they progress with increasing darkness and complexity. This book explores how these experiences manifested in my personal consciousness, how I navigated and integrated them, as well as the explanations of the psychological, social, and spiritual mechanisms they expose.

As Decomposing The Shadow is a book presented to engage the intellect, a book established on an accessibly scholarly approach to the psychology of psilocybin-educed spiritual experiences, its demographic is limited to a certain subset of people. Within the pages of this book, I offer a storytelling narrative to engage the heart and hopefully offer my process of effectively navigating deeply challenging emotional experiences with psychedelics to an even broader audience. 

I need your help to bring this book to the masses. 


"This is about more than just getting a book funded, it's about deepening the culture around psilocybin so it can spread and inspire others. It's about letting others know they are not alone in the darkness they have faced and the benefits they have earned. This book is a fruiting body of something much larger than the author, and this campaign is the spore liberation. "  Excerpt from the press release, read it here.


More About The Actual Content Of The Book



About Me


My name is James W. Jesso. Four years ago I began a journey that would change my life forever by committing to taking a significant doses of (magic) Psilocybin Mushrooms once every month, and go out into the night alone to meditate and reflect on my life. Through this process I hoped to address some invasive and destructive mental illness patterns, particularly depression and borderline psychosis,  which had emerged from a year of destructive drug use. Over the thirteen months in which I remained committed to this practice, I changed my life entirely for the better. Since then, I have done everything I could to unlock these same potentials to as many people as possible.



Where is your contribution going?


The various expenses in writing a book can mount quickly. Several great people have offered their time and skills to assist with the project, and this campaign will help me to pay them for their investments. At the same time, you will be supporting the progression of this book into your hands the world beyond. 

By preordering the book, you are a direct contributing factor to its existence.

We Need At Least $3500 To Just Get This Project Out There

WE HAVE ACHIEVED THIS GOAL AND SURPASSED $3500!!!! Now, onto the next milestone.

Book:

  • Editing (from structural to proof) ~ $650
  • Cover Design ~ $400
  • Ebook Conversion ~ $200-$300
  • Printing (8.5x5.5in, 160pg, Soft Touch Matte Cover) ~ $700-$1200+

Book-Success Ecology

  • Promotion (flyers, postcards, posters & buisness cards) ~ $200 +
  • Website Design ~ $500-$700
  • Perks (Art Prints & Eco-Solvent Vinyl Stickers) ~ $300+ 
  • Indiegogo Costs (video, promotional flyers, fees) ~ $400 +

BUT For This Campaign To Be FULLY SUCCESSFUL, We Need just over $5000 

Now that this campaign has exceeded the basic funding amount, we will continue to grow towards further expanding the reach of this project:

  • @ $4000 ~ I will produce an animated short for the book. (SUCCESS)
  • @ $4500 ~ I will invest deeper into the online presence with SEO and website upgrades as well as various other promotion.  (SUCCESS)
  • @ $4700 ~ I will produce a limited edition set of T-shirts through a local independent company (DNA Screen Printing) with the cover image of the book (Designed by Shannon Reignhodlt) to be sold at a special discount to Indiegogo supporters.  (SUCCESS)
  • @ $5200 ~ I will be able to buy plane tickets to fly to the West Coast Canada and facilitate presentations in several cities, including Calgary, Vancouver and Nelson. All of which will be recorded and shared for free online.  (SUCCESS)
  • @$5500 ~ I will throw a Free Launch Party in Kitchener, ON with dancing and great music. (SUCCESS)
@ > $5500 Surplus will go towards supporting my continued journey. This means the various costs of things web-hosting, office supplies, computer repairs (ouch), other administrative needs, and into nourishing me to further produce inspiring content and experiences for you and others (including new book projects I have in the works for the years to come, my four related websites, various articles and essays, on-location videos and my podcast, ATTMind Radio). 
I am completely funded by supporters like you. For me to keep going, all the support possible is needed.


Official SoundTrack Sampler


This is a brand new perk! The full album will be released at the same time as the book in July.


!?Fine Art Prints?!

"It is through this 'community' that great possibilities can come to fruit." This is why I reached out to five inspiring and talented artists to read TLOD and capture their impression in an original work, specifically for this campaign. They have offered their time and skills to producing work inspired by TLOD to not only help with the campaign, but to help diversify the community intersecting around this project. Please take a movement to honour their efforts (pictures below).

These will be Limited Edition, Signed and Numbered, Archival Prints, and will only ever be 30 of each of them (EVER!).  25 each for the campaign  + five extra for each piece (two for the Artist, two for the author, and one to be held for donation to other projects funding psychedelic-research).

They will be printed through the a high end Giclee process on watercolour paper. "The term  "Giclee print" connotes an elevation in printmaking technology. Images are generated from high resolution digital scans and printed with archival quality inks onto various substrates including canvas, fine art, and photo-base paper. The Giclee printing process provides better colour accuracy than other means of reproduction. Archival quality ensures that the prints are light-fast and non water soluble." [source]

Take a look directly below, or at the Gallery Tab above, to see each what each print in order to select which one you want. (These images are only samples and the end product will be the image itself without the words and background, signed and numbered). After choosing this perk, place the name of the piece you want in the "comments" section of the campaign at the top of the page. 







Artists (links to their homepage):

Joshua Walker, Simon Haiduk, Andrew Pawly, Eduardo Khen & James Williston


Shipping?

Books ~ All Canadian orders will be free of shipping charges. For US ORDERS, please add and extra $5 for the added shipping. 

For ALL NON-CANADIAN/US ORDERS please refer to this page for shipping information. Please then add the the shipping method you prefer to the comments tab above and appropriate amount for that method your donation. 

Art/Book Combo ~ Art will be shipped in a cardboard envelope, separate from the book. Shipping costs for prints Canadian are included in the perk price, US please add $5. 

FOR NON-CANADIAN/US orders, please add $20 to your order to cover international shipping. 

***When the additional costs for international shipping is not added, it redirects funds from the project as a whole to cover that unpaid shipping. PLEASE be sure to add the appropriate shipping amount.***

Thanks :)



How Else Can You Help?

If for whatever reason you are not able to contribute but would still like to help, there are several ways you can lend a hand.

Social Networking:

You can share a link to this campaign via whatever social networking platform you prefer. There are Share Buttons on the top left of this page.

Newsletters:

If you have a newsletter associated with a blog, website, or other community group and would like to inform them of this campaign, send out a link in your newsletter.

Blogger/Podcaster/Journalist:

Do you have a blog, podcast, newspaper, magazine, etc. whose readership would be stoked on this book and campaign? Please contact me through indiegogo to set up an interview.



Praise for The True Light Of Darkness


“Sensitive and with an eye to guiding others who are seeking psychedelic medicine, James W. Jesso highlights the tutorial nature of the psilocybin experience, showing how psilocybin mushrooms can be used as a therapeutic tool to face, and subsequently integrate, buried psychological traumas. A courageous and valuable addition to the growing field of psilocybinetics!”

Simon G. Powell, Author of The Psilocybin Solution and Magic Mushroom Explorer


"Behind every great theory there lies a great story, and James' adventures and learning curves with the Psilocybe mushroom is no exception. The True Light of Darkness is an engaging and entertaining tale of the author's bemushroomed ways, and deserves to be picked and tried by the curious and the psychonauts alike."

Robert Dickins, Editorial Director for Psychedelic Press UK


“James has written three cautionary tales of high-dose mushroom experiences, each one focused on reaching for the light by going through the darkness. His ability to re-create the journey in compelling detail, combined with his own observations made during and later while integrating the insights is accurate, savvy and sensitive.  He directly confronts his deepest demons: self-loathing and being unable to love with courage, candor and even a sense of humor. A welcome addition to the mapping of consciousness."

James Fadiman, Ph.D., Microdose Researcher and Author of The Psychedelic Explorer’s Guide: Safe, Therapeutic and Sacred Journeys 


“The True Light of Darkness is a journey into a place of feeling, understanding, knowledge and inner strength. It is a brave expose of uncovering the veils and depths of being, when our egos are confronted with questions of who we are. The book looks at Psilocybe medicine in the true context of its ability to fragment and integrate. It is a noble contribution to the fungal pharmacy.”

Robert Rogers, Clinical Herbalist and Author of The Fungal Pharmacy 


“The True Light of Darkness is James W. Jesso's latest foray into documenting not just his own psilocybin explorations, but in laying down maps of consciousness for those that come after. Jesso bravely recounts three engaging journeys across the emotional, physical and psychic spectrum to reveal the healing power these entheogenic substances have in disentangling the mind, freeing repressed emotion and erasing societal conditioning. There are some witty, insightful and downright hilarious moments in Jesso's journeys, and collectively they enrich the cultural tapestry not just as trip reports, but as reflections of the eternal mystery. Jesso gives language to the highs and lows, the mystical intuitions and the transmissions from within, but he crafts the delivery in an everyman style that you can relate to, and you will certainly want to read.”

Rak Razam, Writer/Producer of Aya: Awakenings


"Jesso’s telling of his insightful journeys on the mushroom are both poignant and intriguing. What begins as a humorous tale of the psychedelic experience unravels into a deeply honest portrayal of one exploring the dark crevices of their own mind; their shadow. A necessary process for healing, yet unfortunately many of us do not have the courage to do so. Hopefully through reading his words, it will spark inspiration for others to use this sacred and ancient medicine to heal the wounds that are ingrained within us all.

Thank you for sharing your story, it was a necessary read for my own process and I am filled with nothing but gratitude."

Daniel Miceli, Writer for Reset.Me


"Eloquently written and flowing with ease, 'The True Light of Darkness' takes readers through the personal innerscape of James during his deeply turbulent emotional rides into the dark recesses of his psyche. Committed to a respectful, honouring, and humble relationship with the mushroom, James provides a map to the psilocybin terrain that is accessible and useful for experienced as well as beginner psychonaughts alike. His languaging of the intense emotional and mental chaos, as well as the process by which he applies and integrates the experience to evolve his individual "psychospiritual maturation", told through story narrative, extends beyond the contextual use of the mushroom itself. If utilized, the conceptual tools that James presents give readers the ability to effectively navigate mental and emotional turmoil, including depression, regardless of whether one chooses to ingest mushrooms."

Skye Dreamer, Author of The Spirit of the Gift: A Storymap of Living in the Gift


"James Jesso’s new book, “The True Light of Darkness”, is a journey down the rabbit hole that even the most adventuresome Alice would have avoided, preferring instead to keep safe company with her hookah-smoking Caterpillar. But Jesso’s goal is to be searingly honest and fearless in his entheogenic quest to illuminate the darkest corners of his psyche, to get to the root of the depression, anxiety and loneliness that has shadowed his entire adult life.

Powerful stories of his work with the psilocybin mushroom are interwoven with philosophical asides and psychological insights that help ground readers as they enter realms of non-ordinary states of consciousness, some of which may be unfamiliar or emotionally intimidating. But Jesso is always there to hold your hand, even as he himself is at the end of his tether, terrified of what lies ahead. Anyone who saw the film  “Altered States” will feel the same mix of foreboding and anticipation as they enter the sensory isolation tank with Jesso in the final story of the book.

Part psychological thriller, part meditation on the transformative potential of psychedelics, at heart this book is a spiritual autobiography revealing Jesso’s quest for healing, integration and forgiveness. It’s beautifully written. You don’t have to be a psychonaut or even a mushroom lover to enjoy and deeply appreciate this book. I suspect Jesso has other rabbit holes to explore and we’ll all benefit from whatever he finds."

Richard Meech, Director of Ayahuasca: Vine Of The Soul


"Jesso's book is a vulnerable, humorous, and weird foray into the deeply unpleasant places egos often go when tossed overboard into the psychedelic superconscious. As a set of awkward but illuminating trip reports, and as a map of mental traps that frequently ensnare this generation's psychonauts, The True Light of Darkness is a prime example of how daring curiosity, committed practice, and at least a little masochism all converge as integral components of the frontier attitude, and lifestyle, therapy like this requires."

Michael Garfield, Central and Senior Editor at Globalish.com

~Original Video~

www.TrueLightOfDarkness.com

The Story
Established in the conceptual framework of my first book Decomposing The Shadow, I offer you, with as much honesty as I can muster, The True Light Of Darkness.
This book presents three of my most notable experiences of facing the darkness of my psyche through psilocybin. Each story takes place at different points of development within my own practice, and they progress with increasing darkness and complexity. This book explores how these experiences manifested in my personal consciousness, how I navigated and integrated them, as well as the explanations of the psychological, social, and spiritual mechanisms they expose.
As Decomposing The Shadow is a book presented to engage the intellect, a book established on an accessibly scholarly approach to the psychology of psilocybin-educed spiritual experiences, its demographic is limited to a certain subset of people. Within the pages of this book, I offer a storytelling narrative to engage the heart and hopefully offer my process of effectively navigating deeply challenging emotional experiences with psychedelics to an even broader audience. 
I need your help to bring this book to the masses. 



"This is about more than just getting a book funded, it's about deepening the culture around psilocybin so it can spread and inspire others. It's about letting others know they are not alone in the darkness they have faced and the benefits they have earned. This book is a fruiting body of something much larger than the author, and this campaign is the spore liberation. "  Excerpt from the press release, read it here.

More About The Actual Content Of The Book






About Me
My name is James W. Jesso. Four years ago I began a journey that would change my life forever by committing to taking a significant doses of (magic) Psilocybin Mushrooms once every month, and go out into the night alone to meditate and reflect on my life. Through this process I hoped to address some invasive and destructive mental illness patterns, particularly depression and borderline psychosis,  which had emerged from a year of destructive drug use. Over the thirteen months in which I remained committed to this practice, I changed my life entirely for the better. Since then, I have done everything I could to unlock these same potentials to as many people as possible.



Where is your contribution going?
The various expenses in writing a book can mount quickly. Several great people have offered their time and skills to assist with the project, and this campaign will help me to pay them for their investments. At the same time, you will be supporting the progression of this book into your hands the world beyond. 
By preordering the book, you are a direct contributing factor to its existence.
We Need At Least $3500 To Just Get This Project Out There
WE HAVE ACHIEVED THIS GOAL AND SURPASSED $3500!!!! Now, onto the next milestone.
Book:



Editing (from structural to proof) ~ $650


Cover Design ~ $400


Ebook Conversion ~ $200-$300

Printing (8.5x5.5in, 160pg, Soft Touch Matte Cover) ~ $700-$1200+

Book-Success Ecology




Promotion (flyers, postcards, posters & buisness cards) ~ $200 +


Website Design ~ $500-$700

Perks (Art Prints & Eco-Solvent Vinyl Stickers) ~ $300+ 
Indiegogo Costs (video, promotional flyers, fees) ~ $400 +



BUT For This Campaign To Be FULLY SUCCESSFUL, We Need just over $5000 
Now that this campaign has exceeded the basic funding amount, we will continue to grow towards further expanding the reach of this project:





@ $4000 ~ I will produce an animated short
for the book. (SUCCESS)


@ $4500 ~ I will invest deeper into the online
presence with SEO and website upgrades as well as various other promotion.
 (SUCCESS)

@ $4700 ~ I will produce a limited edition set of
T-shirts through a local independent company (DNA Screen
Printing) with the cover image of the book (Designed by Shannon Reignhodlt) to be sold at a special
discount to Indiegogo supporters.  (SUCCESS)

@ $5200 ~ I will be able to buy plane tickets to fly to the West Coast Canada and facilitate presentations in several cities, including Calgary, Vancouver and Nelson. All of which will be recorded and shared for free online.  (SUCCESS)


@$5500 ~ I will throw a Free Launch Party in Kitchener, ON with dancing and great music. (SUCCESS)



@ > $5500 Surplus will go towards supporting my continued journey. This means the various costs of things web-hosting, office supplies, computer repairs (ouch), other administrative needs, and into nourishing me to further produce inspiring content and experiences for you and others (including new book projects I have in the works for the years to come, my four related websites, various articles and essays, on-location videos and my podcast, ATTMind Radio). 

I am completely funded by supporters like you. For me to keep going, all the support possible is needed.

Official SoundTrack Sampler



This is a brand new perk! The full album will be released at the same time as the book in July.

!?Fine Art Prints?!
"It is through this 'community' that great possibilities can come to fruit." This is why I reached out to five inspiring and talented artists to read TLOD and capture their impression in an original work, specifically for this campaign. They have offered their time and skills to producing work inspired by TLOD to not only help with the campaign, but to help diversify the community intersecting around this project. Please take a movement to honour their efforts (pictures below).
These will be Limited Edition, Signed and Numbered, Archival Prints, and will only ever be 30 of each of them (EVER!).  25 each for the campaign  + five extra for each piece (two for the Artist, two for the author, and one to be held for donation to other projects funding psychedelic-research).
They will be printed through the a high end Giclee process on watercolour paper. "The term  "Giclee print" connotes an elevation in printmaking technology. Images are generated from high resolution digital scans and printed with archival quality inks onto various substrates including canvas, fine art, and photo-base paper. The Giclee printing process provides better colour accuracy than other means of reproduction. Archival quality ensures that the prints are light-fast and non water soluble." [source]
Take a look directly below, or at the Gallery Tab above, to see each what each print in order to select which one you want. (These images are only samples and the end product will be the image itself without the words and background, signed and numbered). After choosing this perk, place the name of the piece you want in the "comments" section of the campaign at the top of the page.

Joshua Walker, Simon Haiduk, Andrew Pawly, Eduardo Khen & James Williston

For ALL NON-CANADIAN/US ORDERS please refer to this page for shipping information. Please then add the the shipping method you prefer to the comments tab above and appropriate amount for that method your donation.

Thanks :)

If for whatever reason you are not able to contribute but would still like to help, there are several ways you can lend a hand.
Social Networking:
You can share a link to this campaign via whatever social networking platform you prefer. There are Share Buttons on the top left of this page.

If you have a newsletter associated with a blog, website, or other community group and would like to inform them of this campaign, send out a link in your newsletter.
Blogger/Podcaster/Journalist:
Do you have a blog, podcast, newspaper, magazine, etc. whose readership would be stoked on this book and campaign? Please contact me through indiegogo to set up an interview.

story:
Co-piloting the future of work 

Due to feedback received, we have decided to KIV this experiment for now. We have written all funders and regret any inconvenience caused.

CrowdPowers is a Singapore experiment to openly engage and empower strangers globally to pilot a new way of doing business for everyone’s benefit.  By eventually giving away up to 97% equity, CrowdPowers aspires to become the world's first global crowd actualized branding agency, exclusively focused on Tomorrow matters.  

Terms will be crowd defined, progress will be on www.crowdpowers.com and the initial proposed blueprint will be in the published book.  As you participate, you will shift mindsets from “Me” to “We” and yes, even invent your dream jobs/startups.

Our "New century, old business models?” book will share how different the 21st century is and kickstart creating a global community of doers passionate about openly co-creating our shared future. NOTE:  Book release is postponed to July 2014.  (See gallery for content and sample chapter) and website is BETA (yes, still buggy).

What we need & what you get

The initial $13,999 raised will seed costs of creating shared opportunities to crowd actualize a happier 21st century:

  • Pilot the future of work around giving of our best for everyone's benefit
  • Share percentage of net profits from this campaign with the best co creators
  • Crowd actualize book fulfillment (paperback, mobi and ePub versions) 
  • Develop and maintain Phase I responsive mobile website
  • Marketing and hosting charges
  • Crowdfund basic fees for 3-4 people to harness the power of the crowd to scale the “Tomorrow matters” momentum

The impact

Unleashing autonomy, mastery and purpose for more purpose driven lives

“Each of us has the perfect gift to give the world. It’s what we were born with. So, whether actualizing a startup or inventing our ideal job, if we are able to each give what’s so uniquely ours - won’t we be able to create magic for and with each other?”  Betty Lim

To kickstart empowering strangers globally to crowd actualize a happier 21st century around piloting the future of work, net campaign profits will be shared with the Best Why tomorrow matters creators:

Instagram, Pinterest,Youtube or Vimeo (30 seconds MAX) why you matter tomorrow on www.crowdpowers.com. Get all your friends to like it.  We will announce when the crowd start voting.  Creators of the Most Liked entries will share a percentage of our net campaign profits. The more people participate, the bigger the pool and MORE to share.  

Other ways you can participate

To start actualizing the world's first global Tomorrow Matters branding agency, why not pre-order our book and spread the word?  Your participation is KEY to our experiment to crowd actualize a happier 21st century.  As we power a new way of doing business at our best, we can make history and change the world! Other initiatives will be announced on our spanking new website so DO JOIN www.crowdpowers.com NOW!!

From the bottom of our hearts, WE THANK YOU for our future generations!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funds to promote this title
  • Those who donate will get either a digital copy of my book or a free mp3 download of my kid's song entitled "Rock Wit It, Roll Wit It."  International performing artist, Muniklip, produced the music and raps on this song.

The real world story this book illustrates will touch anyone that has been bullied.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, maybe you network socially via Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, Bebo, Wordpress, Blogger, etc . . . .  Help get the word out about this campaign.

story:
Write for Life: Expressive Writing for the Cancer Community

 ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Every 23 seconds, someone in America is diagnosed with cancer. What if they began writing about their experience?

What if they could take better control of their situation by communicating more effectively and sharing their feelings?

Research conducted at the Lombardi Cancer Center at Georgetown University indicates that expressive writing––dealing with one’s deepest thoughts and emotions––may contribute to improved physical and emotional health.

A study in The Oncologist medical journal found patients who participated in a single 20-minute writing session improved their outlook on cancer and their physical quality of life.

WHY I AM WRITING THIS BOOK

Expressive writing can become a therapeutic, educational, and artistic tool not only for patients and survivors, but for caregivers, family members, friends and medical staff.

But the question persists: How do I start? This is often the toughest part for anyone, especially someone associated with a cancer diagnosis.

Writing can be intimidating, especially finding entry points. Write for Life offers a simple collection of do-it-yourself exercises, prompts and examples to help anyone––and I mean anyone––make writing work for them in positive and healing ways.

Since cancer comes out of the blue, why not simplify a complex tapestry of emotions by breaking down the writing process into manageable and meaningful steps? That is what Write for Life is all about.

WHO IS DAVID TABATSKY?

I am the Co-author of Chicken Soup for the Soul’s The Cancer Book: 101 Stories of Courage, Support & Love, and co-creator and facilitator of the Write to Fight Cancer workshop program (sponsored by Genentech), conducted in cancer centers around the country including The Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center at Harvard University in Boston, and University of California Medical Center in San Francisco.

I am the editor of two cancer memoirs: It’s Just a Word, by Elizabeth Bayer and Slipping Reality, by Emily Beaver, as well as the co-author (with Mark Banschick MD) of The Intelligent Divorce book series and The Wright Choice: Your Family’s Prescription for Healthy Eating, Modern Fitness and Saving Money (with Randy Wright MD).

I am the founding editor of High School XPress, a national newspaper for secondary students and a teaching artist in the New York City public school special education system.

PROJECT STATUS

Write for Life has been in progress for the past year-and-a-half. Your support will allow me to finish the book, arrange the layout, finance the first print run and navigate distribution. I have excellent colleagues lined up to make this book a reality –– as soon as I finish the manuscript!

I aim to have the book in print by early fall to coincide with a series of live events I am conducting around the country in cancer centers, support institutions and therapy retreats, so it’s critical I raise the money now. Funds collected will pay for graphic design, website, printing, and initial distribution.

If you think this book can help people, please contribute!

HOW THE FUNDING WORKS

Your contributions of $100 or more are 100% tax deductible.

This will be facilitated by Unique Projects, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation, acting as my fiscal sponsor (www.pentacle.org).

WHAT IF WE EXCEED THE FUNDING GOAL?

It's great news for the book and all the people it’s meant to help. All funds go toward producing a quality product and getting it into the hands of those who can benefit most––patients, survivors, caregivers, family, friends, doctors, nurses, etc..

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT WRITE FOR LIFE

Please send this link to your friends and colleagues. Post it on Facebook, LinkedIn, etc., and enlarge the network! Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

THANK YOU FOR CHECKING OUT WRITE FOR LIFE. 

I AM GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

Write for Life has been in progress for the past year-and-a-half. Your support will allow me to finish the book, arrange the layout, finance the first print run and navigate distribution. I have excellent colleagues lined up to make this book a reality –– as soon as I finish the manuscript!
I aim to have the book in print by early fall to coincide with a series of live events I am conducting around the country in cancer centers, support institutions and therapy retreats, so it’s critical I raise the money now. Funds collected will pay for graphic design, website, printing, and initial distribution.
If you think this book can help people, please contribute!
HOW THE FUNDING WORKS
Your contributions of $100 or more are 100% tax deductible.
This will be facilitated by Unique Projects, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation, acting as my fiscal sponsor (www.pentacle.org).
WHAT IF WE EXCEED THE FUNDING GOAL?
It's great news for the book and all the people it’s meant to help. All funds go toward producing a quality product and getting it into the hands of those who can benefit most––patients, survivors, caregivers, family, friends, doctors, nurses, etc..
OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT WRITE FOR LIFE
Please send this link to your friends and colleagues. Post it on Facebook, LinkedIn, etc., and enlarge the network! Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
THANK YOU FOR CHECKING OUT WRITE FOR LIFE. 
I AM GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

story:
* Danke für so viel Hilfe & Unterstützung ! *

     Wir sind total überwältigt angesichts solcher Anteilnahme! D A N K E !


Chance auf Heilung


Danke für Deine Zeit diese Seite zu lesen. Weil wir keinen Film haben ist der Text etwas länger geworden.

Ich heisse Boris Gröber-Schuhmann. Ich mache diese Kampagne für Tatjana, meine Frau. Sie ist 43 Jahre alt und Mutter unserer 6-jährigen Tochter.

Meine Frau leidet seit 4 Jahren an Krebs. In dieser Zeit hat sie alternative Heilungsmethoden, eine grosse OP, eine Chemotherapie und viele Krankenhausaufenthalte durchlaufen. Leider ist, trotz der Nebenwirkungen der Behandlungen, der Krebs immer wieder aktiv geworden. Die Schulmediziner sprechen nicht mehr von Heilungschancen, nur noch von Linderungsmöglichkeiten und ein wenig Zeitgewinn. Stück für Stück zerstört die Krankheit alles, was man als ein normales Leben, mit Höhen und Tiefen, bezeichnen könnte. Für sie, für uns als Familie.

Trotz dieser scheinbar aussichtslosen Situation hat Tatjana nie die Hoffnung auf eine vollständige Heilung aufgegeben. Sie kämpft immer weiter, weil sie, wie sie sagt, noch so viele Aufgaben in ihrem Leben hat.

" Ich möchte vollständig gesund werden. Ich möchte die starke innere Kraft der Heilung die in jedem von uns steckt beweisen. "

Mir hat sie schon lange vor ihrer Erkrankung gesagt, dass sie einmal im Hospiz sterbende Menschen begleiten möchte. Ich war, will sagen: geschockt. Und ich weiss nicht ob es einfach meine eigene Angst vor dem Tod war, die sich da gezeigt hat, oder dieses überwältigende Mitgefühl von ihr. So ist sie : mitfühlend und unerschrocken. Unersetzlich.

Tatjana ist mein bester Freund. Ich will dass sie diese Chance auf Heilung bekommt. Denn ohne baldige Heilung werden wir sie wahrscheinlich verlieren.

Konkret geht es um die Finanzierung einer neuen effektiven Ursachenbehandlung und einer mehrwöchigen stationären Krebstherapie (nach Dr. Max Gerson). Beide werden nicht von der Krankenkasse getragen. Die Kosten einschliesslich der Unterbringung, Verpflegung, Transportkosten und Gebühren betragen 10.000,-€.

Da es unter den gegebenen Umständen kaum möglich ist, einen halbwegs normalen Alltag als Familie aufrecht zu erhalten, ist uns bisher nicht gelungen hier einen Film zu präsentieren, der uns besser vorstellen könnte.

Wenn der Gesamtbetrag nicht vollständig erreicht wird, dann wird Tatjana auf jeden Fall die erst genannte Behandlung finanzieren und versuchen, die Mittel für die Krebskur auf andere Art zu sammeln.

Ehrlich können wir den Spendern nur den Dank zurückgeben einen mutig kämpfenden Menschen zu unterstützen. Einen Menschen der eine Diagnose wie `unheilbar` schon wegen der Hoffnungslosigkeit der Aussage nicht aktezptiert. Einen Menschen, der sich sein ganzes Leben weiterentwickeln will um zu beweisen, dass es für uns alle möglich ist Grenzen zu sprengen. Für sich, für sein Kind, für alle Menschen.

Bitte macht unsere Kampagne bekannt auch wenn Ihr nichts spenden könnt oder wollt.

Manch einer der uns kennt fühlt sich vielleicht verpflichtet oder gar genötigt uns zu unterstützen. Das wollen wir nicht: keiner von euch schuldet uns etwas. Bei dieser Kampagne geht darum eine faire Chance zu erhalten, auch wenn man selbst nicht genug Geld hat.



Wer mehr über Tatjana erfahren möchte kann hier einige Dinge lesen die Freunde über sie sagen:

" Sie ist einer der mutigsten Menschenl, die ich kenne. Obwohl sie von sich selbst meist zuviel erwartet, hat sie für andere immer ein gutes Wort, sprich: sie ist nachsichtig. Und sie tröstet auf eine Art, die überzeugt und mich schon aus einem tiefen Loch geholt hat. " Freundin

"Ich habe Tatjana als einen sehr aufrichtigen Menschen kennengelernt, auf dessen Wort man sich verlassen kann. Sie zeigt stets grosses Engagement anderen zu helfen und zu unterstützen." Freund

" Tatjana hat ein offenes Herz. Sie ist ein wunderbarer Mensch mit wunderbaren Träumen und Zielen voller Liebe und Hingabe für andere. Man kann wunderbar mit ihr lachen. Die offenen und ehrlichen Gespräche zwischen uns sind etwas ganz besonderes. " Freundin

"Es beeindruckt mich, mit welchem Lebensmut sie ihr Leben meistert. Und ich danke ihr für so viel Spaß und Freude, die ich an ihrer Seite mit erleben darf." Freundin

story:
The 146 Poems of Love project was inspired by Love146 (www.love146.org) - an organization that works in the prevention and aftercare of trafficked and exploited children. The project was launched in 2011 and after making a call for submissions, I was overwhelmed by the works that flooded my inbox – poems, collages, photographs, paragraphs of poetic prose, and even songs – each telling stories of heartbreak, longing, joy, courage, risk, fear, loss…the very raw and beautiful things that we all experience in love. Stories from all over the world, from all sorts of different people, with all sorts of love stories to share. 

I am now in the process of compiling these stories into book form, and together they are creating an inspiring and beautiful definition of what love means to each of us.

The book will be published on February 14th, 2014. By contributing to this campaign, you will help fund the initial publishing costs and materials needed to complete this project on time.

Any funds that exceed the goal will be donated to Love146.

For more information about the project and updates on this publishing process, please visit www.ambermorris.com. For more information about Love146 please visit www.love146.org.

story:
Bring the beauty of Yosemite to your home. Give a gift that will inspire a journey. Support your national park by supporting the publication of this book of landscape photographs by Yosemite-photographer Nancy Robbins and essays by author Mas Masumoto. 

In this breathtaking collection of photographs, essays, and extensive photographer’s notes, Yosemite visitors—and readers who haven’t yet made the trip—will follow an intrepid photographer to her favorite places and experience the park through her lens. This book not only reveals a beautiful landscape, it also shares a photographer’s stories of her adventures and a writer’s consideration of a public space in personal terms.

Photographer Nancy Robbins arrived in the Sierra over a decade ago to photograph people in nature. Writer David “Mas” Masumoto farms peaches in California’s Central Valley. They intersect in Yosemite National Park, a 1200-square-mile jewel sculpted from granite, alive with crashing waterfalls, home to charismatic wildlife, and beloved of visitors from around the world.

Once completed, proceeds from the sale of each copy of A Sense of Yosemite support enhancement projects in Yosemite National Park, helping to fund trail and habitat restoration, wildlife protection programs, scientific research, youth in Yosemite programs, and more.  The Conservancy needs to raise $10,000 for editing and color proofing of A Sense of Yosemite.

Once we are able to raise funds for this book, we expect to bring this project to completion without obstacles. The Conservancy has a proven track record of publishing high quality books, from park maps to children’s storybooks to Yosemite history. 

Yosemite Conservancy provides for Yosemite’s future. We inspire people to support projects and programs that preserve and protect Yosemite National Park’s resources and enrich the visitor experience.

As the park’s primary philanthropic partner, Yosemite Conservancy is providing for over 40 projects in 2015 alone through donations from generous Yosemite-lovers, purchases of authentic Yosemite books and educational products, and other programs.

Thank you for supporting your park by supporting this Campaign through both your contribution and by sharing this with just one friend. A portion of all perks are tax-deductible to the extent allowable by law.

story:
Longing to GO

Every now and then we hear about a woman who seems to defy the culture, a woman who braves the great unknown and walks away with breathless tales. She has a certain something about her. We see her, and we wish we could be her, but a great many things keep us stuck right where we are. Resisting our deep inner urges, we often spend years vacillating, waiting and aching, afraid to go and afraid of not going. I was such a woman.

Letting GO

Finally, the pain of staying stuck outweighed the fear of moving forward. Last August, with very little planning and a lot of anxiety, I embarked on a solo journey that would take me from one corner of the country to the other, to the edge of myself and beyond. I packed my car as best I could figure, and with my 9-year-old pup as my only companion, I said goodbye to the life I knew and pressed down on the accelerator.

Helping others GO

Many women dream of travel and adventure, but they don't always understand why, and they are rarely encouraged to pursue these deep longings. I believe the Wild is calling to us, calling us to connect to nature, to our instincts and to our soul.

The Wild has secrets to impart to us. When a woman chooses to answer this call, she can learn the secrets to healing herself, her children and our planet. My purpose is to help more women move beyond the pain of being stuck and into her epic adventure in a way that is safe, smart and sacred.

 

You can help

I could have lived on the road for the rest of this year with the money I had saved. Instead, I chose to go all in on this book, and I committed more than I had left to make it happen. I believe in this message and the women who need to hear it. While I may travel solo, I am no lone ranger. I deeply appreciate making connections with like-minded people, and I believe these connections are critical to making a real impact in this world. Your support will help in many ways toward the realization of these results:

  • Producing a book that actually makes a difference
  • Creating a publishing plan that achieves that goal
  • Creating a marketing plan that gets the message to the right audience
  • Having the tools and training needed to produce quality services

 

More than the money

A good book will never make a difference if no one reads it. You can help spread the word about this book and this message.

  • Use the Indiegogo tools to share my campaign
  • Visit my website to push my social media buttons
  • Visit my website to enroll in By the Byway, my travel & adventure newsletter
  • If you or someone you know is a woman who dreams of solo travel and adventure but feels stuck, I want to connect with you personally.

story:
Please note! Everyone who clicks the 'back it' button next to the video and donates upwards of £10 will become a 'Citizen of the Republic of Consciousness', and be entered into the shortlist raffle, AS WELL as  being listed as a patron on our website, receiving priority invitations to all our events and being part of a growing literary prize (citizenship includes all or none of the above, as you wish - email us if you don't want your name listed!). This also applies if you order any of the perks, too. If you would like to receive a perk, but also donate more than the perk costs, you will have select the perk & then donate again via the back it button. A thousand thank you's.

 

The Republic of Consciousness Prize for Small Presses was founded last year to reward the innovative & exciting literary fiction being published by small presses across the UK & Ireland. We are unique among literary prizes in that we don’t ask publishers to financially contribute when they apply to the prize, & any prize-money awarded is split between the publisher and author. We believe publishers should be rewarded for trying to spread the word, not penalised (see Lynn Michell’s article on The Bookseller for more on this). Our rules for entry are simple: every small publisher (under 5 full-time employees) can enter one book of fiction (novel, short-story collection, translation: whatever) each year. We announce the longlist towards the end of the year, the shortlist in the new year, and the winner in the spring. Last year, the prize was won by Counternarratives by John Keene, published by Fitzcarraldo Editions. For more information, you can visit our website here.

A prize is a great way to help promote small presses & their books because it allows us to focus in and celebrate a select group. Prizes curate, and as small presses are publishing so much wonderful, diverse and innovative literature, we want this prize to act as a gateway drug to the rest of the small press world. 

 

WHAT WE’RE ASKING FOR

 

Originally the passion-project of author Neil Griffiths, in 2017 the Republic of Consciousness has now partnered up with the Times Literary Supplement, secured funding from The Arts Council and will be holding events this year in partnership with Waterstones, the New School of Writing in Manchester and the University of Westminster. We have linked up with bookshops across the country to promote the shortlist.

Basically, in our second year, the prize is growing. We would like to see is the prize-fund itself grow too. We currently have a prize-pot confirmed that exceeds last years; in order to make a real difference to the shortlisted/winning publishers & authors, though, we want to have more. That’s where you come in.

We’re hoping to raise £4,500 towards the prize fund – this will bring the overall prize fund to around £10,000. If we can make more than £4,500 here, great! All the money raised by this drive will go to directly to the shortlisted & winning publisher/authors. If we don’t quite reach the target, we will still put all the money donated towards the prize fund.  

The prize fund will be split between the 5 shortlisted books to start with, with 10% going to each press, presented at the winner’s event this spring. The remaining 50% will then be presented to the winning book at the end of the evening. So, if we have a prize fund of £10,000 – all of the shortlisted books will receive £1,000, with one winner receiving an additional £5,000 cheque. All winnings will be split 70/30 between the publisher & the author.

 

PERKS PERKS PERKS

 

But hey, why would you want to donate money towards a literary prize for small presses (apart from the fact that you’re doing your bit to support a fragile and crucial literary ecosystem)? Well, if you look over to the right of your screen, you’ll see why. Many small presses have donated books, subscriptions and other goodies to us, and if you donate on this page, you can get your hands on them. We’re also offering 15 donors the complete shortlist of 5 books, as well as tickets to our events. We’ll be adding perks along the way, so you can always alter your selection further down the line.

And if you can’t donate a large amount, but do still want to help, we’re offering a raffle ticket perk (£3 for 1, £5 for 2); all donors at this level will have their names written down, thrown into a hat, and FIVE winners will receive the shortlist. These winners will be subsidised by our generous higher-amount donors.

And if you really don’t have any spare change right now at all, no worries; please do consider sharing the this page on social media, or tell your friends about it in “real life” (yuck).

 

THANK YOU!

 

Thank you for helping us help some of the most talented and creative people working in the UK & Ireland today.

For any more information, or if you'd like to get involved in any way, contact us using this website, or at neil [at] republicofconsciousness [dot] com

Well, if you look over to the right of your screen, you’ll see why. Many small presses have donated books, subscriptions and other goodies to us, and if you donate on this page, you can get your hands on them. We’re also offering 15 donors the complete shortlist of 5 books, as well as tickets to our events. We’ll be adding perks along the way, so you can always alter your selection further down the line.And if you can’t donate a large amount, but do still want to help, we’re offering a raffle ticket perk (£3 for 1, £5 for 2); all donors at this level will have their names written down, thrown into a hat, and FIVE winners will receive the shortlist. These winners will be subsidised by our generous higher-amount donors.And if you really don’t have any spare change right now at all, no worries; please do consider sharing the this page on social media, or tell your friends about it in “real life” (yuck). THANK YOU! Thank you for helping us help some of the most talented and creative people working in the UK & Ireland today.For any more information, or if you'd like to get involved in any way, contact us using this website, or at neil [at] republicofconsciousness [dot] com

story:
Our sexual experiences, some incredibly intense, some subtle, have shaped us. But at any point in our lives we can be active in how we allow ourselves to be shaped. It is never too late. You can decide if you want to carry your family’s values about sex. You can chose to believe what your high school girlfriend said about you or what Cosmo magazine said you were supposed to be. You can keep listening to those internal voices that remind you of your failings or those that drive you to behave in a certain way. You can do just want you think your partner wants. You can also recreate yourself at any time, you can self define, you can embrace old abandoned parts of yourself. You can even rewrite your story, or at least what it means to you, but first you have to listen to your own voice and turn a caring eye to your story. First you have to get interested in your own sexual self.

I believe we cannot change what we are unwilling to engage with. We cannot even make choices about something unless we look at it, wonder about it, and understand what we want from it. Our sex lives flourish when they are given caring attention and wither away when they stay are relegated to a dark corner of our minds. I want more people to be awake to their sexuality – and I want to help make that happen on a larger scale than I can in my private practice.

So The Conscious Sexual Self Workbooks are coming to life. These workbooks will be distillations of the things I teach in human sexuality courses, key themes in sex therapy that I find myself going back to as a Sex Therapist in my practice with new clients again and again, and popular posts from my blog, Conscious Sexual Self. They will also include journaling prompts so people can do their own exploration process, and practice sections with exercises that people can try at home to wake up their sexuality in safe, fun ways.

What The Funding IS For:

The first two workbooks, that this campaign is supporting, are :

The Conscious Sexual Self Workbook : Wake up to Your Self

The Conscious Sexual Couple Workbook : Wake up to Each Other

I am choosing to self publish so I can get these out to the public quickly. So I am raising money for :

A graphic designer to help me format and create cover art

Cost of self publishing

Cost of a starter publicity campaign to market the books when they are ready

story:
Crowdfunding kampanja za izdavanje knjige o URK-u i klubu Močvara je završena. Uspjeli smo prikupiti potreban iznos, čak i nešto više od toga - 7.944 $ neophodnih za skupi tisak knjige.

Izdavanje knjige je donirala 201 osoba uglavnom iz Hrvatske, ali i iz mnogih drugih zemalja, kao što su Njemačka, Austrija, S.A.D., Armenija, Slovenija, Irska, Ujedinjeno Kraljevstvo, Nizozemska....

U ovih intenzivnih mjesec dana koliko je kampanja trajala imali smo zaista ogromnu podršku sa svih strana - od starih i novih suradnika, naše mnogobrojne publike, svih medija, i naravno - marketinške agencije Brodoto koji su nas savjetovali i otkrili tajne i čari uspješnog crowdfundinga.

Naša kampanja na stranici indiegogo.com imala je više od 9.000 posjeta.

Jako smo uzbuđeni zbog fantastičnih rezultata ove naše prve crowdfunding kampanje, koja će nas motivirati i za sljedeće slične projekte.

Vjerujemo da ćete svi biti jako zadovoljni kada izađe ova reprezentativna knjiga o preko dva desetljeća nezavisne kulture u Zagrebu.

Iako je kampanja službeno gotova imate još uvijek priliku osigurati svoj primjerak knjige na linku www.bit.ly/mochvara.

Puno hvala svima na podršci!

Vidimo se u Močvari!


***Please scroll down for English version.***

Klub Močvara i URK, udruga koja ga vodi, oduvijek su osobit kotač nezavisne kulturne scene i kulture mladih - onaj koji pokreće stvari i daje upute o pomalo skrivenim, a mnogima od nas zapravo bliskim svjetovima.

20 GODINA NEZAVISNE KULTURE NA JEDNOM MJESTU

Knjiga Močvara i priča o URK-u predstavit će bitne momente ove organizacije, dajući istovremeno pogled na širu scenu u kojoj ona djeluje. Na preko 400 stranica velikog formata (21*28), uz sjajan omot Igora Hofbauera, raspoređeno je preko 70 što većih, što manjih poglavlja. Sadržaj ove bogate knjige predstavlja zajednički rad više od stotinu autora, pa tako imamo sjajne tekstove (Jura Šiftar, Feđa Vukić, Ante Perković, Marko Pogačar...), već klasične plakate (Igor Hofbauer, Ivan Eror, Darko Kujundžić, Tomislav Vranić...), ali i neke novije (Željka Tkalčec, Krunoslav Nemčić Rakun, Lovro Škiljić, Benjamin Beljan Žac..), stripove (Igor Hofbauer, Aleksandar Zograf, Helena Klakočar) te mnoge fotografije (Mladen Pobi, Ratko Mavar, Nives Milješić...).

+ SINGLICA MANCEA: "MEKANI HITOVI ZA MEKANI GRAD"

Prilog knjizi je vinilna single ploča Mekani hitovi za mekani grad s neobjavljenim pjesmama Milana Manojlovića Mancea.

KNJIGA POČINJE PRIČOM O GALERIJI ESCE 1990. GODINE...​

Knjiga je strukturirana tako da poglavlja obuhvaćaju neke važne aspekte našeg rada, ali bez namjere da se ispiše točna i potpuna kronologija događanja, niti da u prvom planu budu sadržaji za koje je pojedinačno vladao najveći interes. Najmanji i najveći ovdje su u istoj ravnini i u šarolikoj, ponekad nepredvidljivoj priči oni jednakom snagom otvaraju nove prozore, jednako nas zabavljaju ili oduševljavaju.

Početna poglavlja govore o prostorima nastalim znatno ranije, koji su imali važnu ulogu u razvoju scene. Tako je opširno predstavljen zaboravljeni period rada Galerije ESCE iz razdoblja 1990/91. koji je utjecao i na koncept rada Močvare. Također smo se prisjetili jedinstvene epizode iz 1994. godine o Kuglani, prvom zagrebačkom skvotu, koji je bio poticaj za daljnje poduhvate.  

O DIZAJNERIMA, AUTSAJDERIMA, KULTNIM BENDOVIMA...

Pored brojnih plakata koji prate pojedina poglavlja kroz knjigu se stalno isprepliću i dijelovi posebno posvećeni našim dizajnerima plakata u ukupno 14 mapa radova.

Dijelovi knjige posvećeni su nama jako dragim i važnim ljudima kojih više nema - Ivica Baričević Bara, Marko Čaklović, Dragan Pajić Pajo i Željko Zorica Šiš.

S obzirom da je uz brojne druge interese glazba ipak jedan od dominantnijih, predstavili smo riječima, fotografijama i stipovima i neke zanimljive autore i bendove koji su nam gostovali, kao što su na primjer Jonathan Richman, The Residents, Einstürzende Neubauten, Figli Di Madre Ignota, Gogol Bordello, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Khebez Dawle, Shellac, Mike Watt ili česti gosti Let 3.

Pojedini glazbeni pravci obilježili su Močvaru, pa smo tako dio prostora posvetili metalu, elektronici, hardcoreu i punku.

U knjizi su predstavljeni i zanimljivi i važni projekti koje URK i Močvara redovito provode, kao što su Galerija Močvara, Human Rights Film Festival, Kum – kazalište u Močvari, Močvarni laboratorij, Začarana Močvara, Primijenjena u Močvari. Tu su i neki bivši projekti kojih se svi mi, a i mnogi drugi rado sjećamo - Otokultivator na Visu, te festivali Ponikve i Nikad čuo.

Također, imamo i jedan strip Igora Hofbauera o dogodovštinama imaginarnog benda kojeg već godinama možete sresti na zidovima pored šanka.  

Pored navedenog, imamo i niz zanimljivih priča s periferije ili iz bakinog sanduka: o našoj tajanstvenoj moćnoj arhivi, o divnim autsajderima svih vrsta, o životu i smrti programskih knjižica, o URK-ovom klubu u Rupi, o prvoj Močvari u Runjaninovoj ulici, o prvom koncertu URK-a 1996. godine, o prvim fotokopiranim plakatima, o Zlim bubnjarima, a tu je i velika kronologija tvornice Jedinstvo od 40-ih godina, pa sve do skore budućnosti.  

KUPI KNJIGU PUTEM CROWDFUNDING KAMPANJE I OSIGURAJ NJEN TISAK

Bacili smo se u crowdfundanje zato što nam, unatoč dijelu osiguranih sredstava koja smo uložili u digitalizaciju plakata, dizajn, produkciju i mnoge druge troškove potrebne za realizaciju ovog malog remek-djela, nedostaje ukupno $7000 potrebnih za tisak.  

Ne sumnjamo da u posljednjih 20 godina Močvara i priča o URK-u nije trajno obilježila samo naše živote, već da je na jedinstven način dotaknula i tvoj. Upravo zbog dobrih priča koje te vežu uz Močvaru, nadamo se da ćeš prepoznati vrijednost ove inicijative i pomoći nam da uspješno dođemo do cilja.

Zauzvrat, osigurali smo ti par nagrada - osim same knjige, donacijom u crowdfunding kampanji možeš si osigurati i jedinstven Hofov plakat, godišnji upad u Močvaru ili što već poželiš s liste nagrada pobrojanih s desne strane ovog teksta.

Pozdrav s Trnjanskog nasipa!

P.s. Prati nas na Facebooku, Twitteru i Instagramu za sve novosti!


***For you, our supporter from abroad.***

The Močvara club and the Cultural Development Association (CDA), a non-profit organization that runs it, have always been a staple of Zagreb's independent cultural scene. So, the Močvara and the Story of the CDA book will take a peek under the skin of both Močvara and CDA and present the most important moments of this organization to public, whilst also providing an overview of a wider cultural scene that Močvara is a part of.

20 YEARS OF INDEPENDENT CULTURE AT ONE PLACE

On over 400 pages of the large-format book, behind an amazing cover drawn by Igor Hofbauer, are more than 70 chapters. The content of this book is a joint effort of over a hundred authors, who provided some great writing, some classic and some newer poster art as well, comics and many photos.

+ UNRELEASED SONGS OF A LOCAL SINGER-SONGWRITER MANCE

As a special bonus, the books comes with a 7'' vinyl of previously unreleased songs by Mance, a cult local singer/songwriter and friendly ghost of Močvara.

The book is structured to include important aspects of our work, but with no intention to put together a completely accurate timeline nor give extra space to events that drew the biggest interest of the public - both big and small things are equal in this exciting story.

THE BOOK BEGINS WITH THE STORY OF ESCE GALERY IN 1990...

The opening chapters talk about venues from way back that played important roles in the development of the scene in Zagreb. One of these venues is the Student Centre Gallery, a place that hosted many important bands (Fugazi, The Jesus Lizard, All, MDC...) in 1990/1991, and also greatly influenced the concept of Močvara. We also reminisced about "The Bowling Alley", the first squat in Zagreb, which was squatted in 1994 and had inspired similar endeavours in the years to come.

ABOUT DESIGNERS, OUTSIDERS, CULT BANDS...

As hosting shows is one of the most dominant activities taking place at Močvara, we've presented some interesting artists and bands whose shows we've booked so far, such as Jonathan Richman, The Residents, Einstürzende Neubauten, Figli Di Madre Ignota, Gogol Bordello, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Khebez Dawle, Shellac and Mike Watt. Generally, some music genres have left an important mark in the life and times of Močvara, so we've dedicated a number of pages in the book to metal, electronic music and hardcore punk.

The book also covers many interesting and important projects that Močvara regularly runs, such as the Močvara Gallery, Human Rights Film Festival, KUM (The Močvara Theatre), Močvara's Laboratory (workshops) and Enchanted Močvara, a music program focused on singer/songwriters. We also remember some great past projects, such as Otokultivator, an art and music festival on the island of Vis, as well as some other festivals, such as the open-air Ponikve and Nikad Čuo, a music festival that hosted local underground bands.

Finally, we've got many interesting stories from the vaults: our almighty yet mysterious archive, wonderful outsiders of all sorts, the life and death of our monthly program brochure, the Rupa (Hole), a short-lived improvised venue run by the CDA, the first location of Močvara, the first show by CDA in 1996, the first xeroxed show posters, and there's also a comprehensive timeline of the defunct Jedinstvo factory, a building that now houses Močvara.

BUY THE BOOK THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN AND SECURE ITS PRINTING

We've started this campaign because, despite the secured funds that we've invested in fees for digitizing posters, design, production and many other unavoidable costs, we are still lacking $7000 for book printing. 

Support us today - get your copy, choose one of our unique perks and share the word among your friends through social media accounts! 

P.s. You can follow Močvara on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Generally, some music genres have left an important mark in the life and times of Močvara, so we've dedicated a number of pages in the book to metal, electronic music and hardcore punk.The book also covers many interesting and important projects that Močvara regularly runs, such as the Močvara Gallery, Human Rights Film Festival, KUM (The Močvara Theatre), Močvara's Laboratory (workshops) and Enchanted Močvara, a music program focused on singer/songwriters. We also remember some great past projects, such as Otokultivator, an art and music festival on the island of Vis, as well as some other festivals, such as the open-air Ponikve and Nikad Čuo, a music festival that hosted local underground bands.Finally, we've got many interesting stories from the vaults: our almighty yet mysterious archive, wonderful outsiders of all sorts, the life and death of our monthly program brochure, the Rupa (Hole), a short-lived improvised venue run by the CDA, the first location of Močvara, the first show by CDA in 1996, the first xeroxed show posters, and there's also a comprehensive timeline of the defunct Jedinstvo factory, a building that now houses Močvara.BUY THE BOOK THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN AND SECURE ITS PRINTINGWe've started this campaign because, despite the secured funds that we've invested in fees for digitizing posters, design, production and many other unavoidable costs, we are still lacking $7000 for book printing. Support us today - get your copy, choose one of our unique perks and share the word among your friends through social media accounts! P.s. You can follow Močvara on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

story:
Per iniziare...

Buongiorno, mi chiamo Lorenzo Vargas e sono uno scrittore esordiente di 21 anni.

Dopo lungo peregrinare nel mondo editoriale (ho cominciato presto) ho raggiunto la consapevolezza che, fuor di certi canoni di tipo commerciale, senza un determinato background è quasi impossibile pubblicare qualcosa di nuovo sul panorama italiano oggigiorno.

Poi, all'improvviso, mi è venuta un'idea.

Essendo il libro PER i lettori, perchè non far scegliere a loro, se esso vedrà la luce o meno?

Per questo ho contattato due fidati disegnatori, anche loro esordienti, Matteo Stella ed Annamaria Dassori, per dare ulteriore valore all'opera con copertine ed illustrazioni originali.

Così è iniziato il progetto "Pierre non Esiste"

Potete trovarlo QUI raccontato meglio da Lokee

Oppure QUI, sviolinato da Cronache Maceratesi.it!

Il Libro

Nato nel 2011 da una malsana idea di esperimento diaristico, il libro (di cui potete golosamente vedere la copertina qua sopra) prende vita nei tempi morti delle lezioni, tra un caffè e dell'altro, in stati mentali non sempre dei più lucidi e parla di Pierre.

Pierre è un emerito signor nessuno che vive in una immaginario prossimo futuro orwelliano. Divide la sua esistenza tra una relazione insoddisfacente, un lavoro senza prospettive ed un mondo attorno a lui generalmente abbastanza scialbo.
Il Nostro, però, sin da piccolo, soffre di una strana allucinazione paranoide, un personaggio multiforme di nome Rho, che non fa altro che chiedergli: Sei felice?
Ma cosa succede quando Pierre, per la prima volta ponderando la propria risposta, scuoterà la testa?
E se Rho non fosse un'illusione?
Se lo fosse tutto il resto?

Volete qualche informazione in più? O addirittura vorreste una piccola anteprima? CLICCATE QUI PER IL PRIMO CAPITOLO!

Perché illustrato?

Senza troppi mezzi termini, perchè si.
Il romanzo è pieno trabordante di immagini evocative e situazioni grottesche (per non parlare del magico magico penultimo capitolo...) per questo motivo ho sentito il bisogno di illustrarlo.

Questa furba trovata risale però al primo tentativo, ancora convenzionale del romanzo. Ora, dovendovi offrire il libro migliore possibile (del nostro possibile) ho deciso di chiamare per la parte grafica persone capaci in questo campo quanto io reputo di essere nel mio.

La fortuna ha voluto recapitarmi Matteo Stella, un talentuosissimo tatuatore ed illustratore ed Annamaria Dassori, più che promettente artista digitale e non, che si sono occupati rispettivamente delle illustrazioni (una per capitolo, in un meraviglioso bianco/nero milleriano) ed alla più generale grafica ed estetica del volume (siete poc'anzi inciampati su uno dei prodotti della Dassori, la copertina).

I due hanno affrontato l'impresa (titanica se si considera che è stata portata avanti insieme all'Accademia delle Belle Arti) con la giusta determinazione, dando ancora una volta prova che ci sono in fondo ragazzi pronti ancora a tirarsi su le maniche per creare qualcosa.

Il nostro obiettivo

La campagna ha tre principali obiettivi:
 
Primo, dare alle stampe una prima tiratura del volume, che ammonterà a cinquecento copie (o più, dipende da voi), per poi presentarlo in giro per farlo conoscere al più vasto pubblico possibile.
 
Secondo, portare avanti l'intero processo editoriale in modo totalmente indipendente, appoggiandoci solo a mezzi non convenzionali e per lo più quasi open source. Ci saremo soltanto noi ed il denaro che ci concederete.

Terzo, permettere a tre esordienti di campi estremamente chiusi (mondo editoriale e dell'illustrazione) di potersi fare un nome con le proprie forze, senza dover passare per l'inevitabile fase di gavetta prostitutoria.
 
In questo modo speriamo di mandare un chiaro messaggio ad un mondo paralizzato da delle leggi di marketing che privilegiano nella diffusioni i prodotti alle opere.

Un po' di numeri

La base della campagna, 1600€, copre:

  • La stampa delle prime 500 copie del romanzo.
  • L'invio di parte delle stesse tramite Piego di libri di Poste Italiane per le rispettive donazioni.
  • Cartoleria e affrancatura varia per il suddetto invio.

Tutti i fondi che eccederanno i 1600€ saranno utilizzati per organizzare e coordinare le presentazioni che allestiremo in modo quanto più uniforme secondo le esigenze di chi ci ha seguito.

Raggiunte particolari cifre-svolta, i fondi saranno riorganizzati come segue:

  • 2300€: La tiratura verrà raddoppiata ed aumenteranno anche le presentazioni.
  • 3500€: Il libro verrà tradotto in lingua Inglese da un professionista ancora da definirsi
  • 4500€: Verranno aggiunti ai premi (da 25€ in su) alcuni articoli di merchandise. Forse magliette. Troppo ottimismo mi divide dal pensare seriamente a cosa fare.
  • >4500€: Tiratura di 1500 e vi GIURO, su ciò che mi è più caro al mondo, che vado a piedi alla direzione centrale Mondadori entro nell'ufficio del responsabile editoriale, gli grido PUPPA e poi me ne vado.
Ovviamente, qualora non raggiungessimo il nostro obiettivo, la campagna è programmata in modo che non ci arrivi nemmeno un centesimo, al che torneremo piangendo dal pertugio da cui siamo gocciolati all'inizio di questa avventura. Forse qualcuno di noi non supererà la notte per lo shock.

Ma niente è per niente...

Le vostre non saranno veramente donazioni.

Il punto di questa piattaforma è che i soldi non sono donazioni ma finanziamenti e come tali hanno una ricompensa:

  • 10€
    Vi verrà inviato il libro a casa, senza spese di spedizioni, autografato dall'autore.
  • 15€
    Come sopra, ma la copia sarà autografata (e disegninata) da tutti e tre i colpevoli del Progetto.
  • 20€
    Come la ricompensa da 15€, in più vi contatterò per scrivere una piccola paginetta illustrata su di voi con la mia fidata Lettera22. Il tutto ovviamente condito dal mio personalissimo tocco di persona molto bisognosa di un trattamento al litio. Un esempio QUI!
  • 25€
    Come la ricompensa da 15€, più il vostro nome (o pseudonimo) sarà nella pagina dei ringraziamenti del libro, ben evidenziato con un evidenziatore di nostra scelta. (Max. 200)
  • 40€
    Come la ricompensa da 15€, più una riproduzione ad alta risoluzione di una delle illustrazioni del romanzo, scelta ed autografata dai tre colpevoli
  • 100€
    Come la ricompensa da 15€, più un artwork originale (a voi la scelta se fatto da Matteo o Anna) su vostra consegna. Ovviamente tri-autografato. (Max. 20)
  • 600€
    Come nella ricompensa da 25€, più ci impegnamo, ovunque viviate a fare una presentazione nel vostro paese (o dintorni), intrattenerci a pranzo/cena con voi e, se sarete così gentili da lasciarci una cuccia di cane dove dormire, vi faremo compagnia tutta la giornata, per poi sparire nelle nebbie una volta tornato il sole. Vi autograferemo tutto quello che vi pare, da fogli a mobili a parti del corpo. Unica cosa, dovete indicarci un luogo dove fare la presentazione, a metterci daccordo coi tizi ci pensiamo noi. (Max. 10)

Non vuoi aiutarci finanziariamente, ma vuoi comunque sostenere il progetto?


Se non potete permettervi di pagare anche solo 10 euro per un libro, ma il senso di colpa vi spinge, come un imperativo morale kantiano, a sostenerci comunque, diffondete la pagina, fate passaparola, consigliate a parenti e amici, fatevi foraggiare dai vostri genitori, insomma fate in modo che la notizia si imprima in più cervelli possibile.

In questo modo potremo raggiungere obiettivi che nemmeno ci saremmo immaginati!

Il progetto vi incuriosisce, ma avete ancora dubbi?

Venite a farci TUTTE le domande che vi saltano in mente sulla PAGINA FACEBOOK o, se siete timidi, basta un messaggio personale!

Siamo a disposizione.

E per concludere...

Donate, donate, donate!

Non mi ripeterò mai abbastanza, questo è un progetto importante e purtroppo ancora insolito nel nostro Bel paese. Sarete parte di una svolta.

Non vorrei che vi pentiste del contrario

 

La staff del progetto:

Lorenzo "Glasya-Labolas" Vargas
Matteo Stella
Annamaria "Mepheesto" Dassori
