story_txt:
Summon the Summary!

A blessing or a curse?
Trinia wakes up on her 16th birthday to find she can duplicate herself in mind and body, and the implications of her power spells doom for her people.
Her power-hungry father, Chieftain Caderyn, plans to use her gifts to create an army large enough to conquer the world, starting with her people. She goes on the run to seek out someone, anyone, who she can stand with to fight against him.
Deep in the Forest of Nex she finds Údar, a man of legend, who she hopes to convince to help her stop her father before it’s too late.
But when the ancient darkness of the Banshee Queen begins to rise and Trinia encounters far worse evil than her father, it becomes harder and harder to ignore the ancient prophecy that sealed her fate before she was even born.
That she will destroy the world.

About the Book
Hello everyone, my name is Stephen Howard, and I am the author of The City of Snow and Stars. When I sat down to write this book, it was supposed to be one book. I told myself I was going to keep things simple, nothing crazy like I had tried to do in the past... Now, it's a planned Trilogy. Least I can say is that I tried.One reason I wrote this book is that, as a Christian, I’ve been faced with hard questions that I didn’t have answers for. Why does God let bad things happen? Why are people abused? What does it mean to follow God when everything is going wrong? Questions I've asked myself countless times and wanted to explore and discover for myself.These are tough topics to address on a good day, let alone write them into a book! Funny thing was, the characters of Trinia, Údar, and others seemed to write themselves and I was just along for the ride. They each share a common hurt from my past, but the way they processed and handled it differently made them uniquely their own person. In the end, I found more of them in me than me in them.I love these characters and have spent countless hours with them (they are a rowdy bunch) and now I get to share them with you. I hope that in reading this book you will discover the pieces of the flawed and broken characters who are looking for the answers in yourself the same as I did. Their story is our story in so many ways because the truth is this: we are all a little broken.You will love this book if you enjoy characters that are relatable, broken, imperfect, and human. They are flawed in so many ways, each one searching for something and not knowing fully what it is. They want to be loved, cherished, powerful, perfect, successful and seen for their merits. They, like us all, seek to overcome the pains we’ve gone through and find something better.The City of Snow and Stars speaks to young adults and those in their early to mid-twenties who want to grapple with why God lets bad things happen and how we can address not only our brokenness but reach out in love to those who are broken.Ultimately, I hope that The City of Snow and Stars inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions that help us understand:

Why we cannot make it "going it alone"
How our brokenness comes in many different shapes
And how, in the end, God can bring forth beauty from pain

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing God, abuse (be it physical, sexual, emotional, or mental), and slavery (human trafficking) in new ways that will change us all for the better.
 
Welcome to My World
The land of Wintenaeth is vast. Filled with majestic mountains, lush valleys, craggy shorelines, and wild forests, and is called home to no less than five kingdoms. It's a land filled with variety, bounty, and promise. A land where all peoples share in the magic and power gifted to them by Elohai, though now seldom use it. 
But it was not always so. Ruins from bygone eras rise from the mists in each of the five kingdoms, a reminder to the brutal past under the reign of the Airgid Empire over a thousand years ago. A time when darkness held the land captive.
After the fall of the Empire, the kingdoms rose to take their place:
- Canamor claimed the northeastern section of the Empire, from the Forest of Nex to the sea. It is slightly more advanced in its armor and weapons than any other kingdom, but lacks adequate farming and relies heavily on the sea. 
- Thydu claimed the northwestern portion of the Empire, and are a more hardy people. Known for their prowess with horses, it is their primary source of trade and extremely lucrative.
- Ungaar beat the others in claiming the heart of the fertile lands that once kept the Empire fed. Populated mainly by farmers, the kingdom is not defenseless as it boasts Qepho City, home of The Academy of Mages. Combined with their sheer numbers, Ungaar is quite the force to be reckoned with and is by far the most powerful of the kingdoms.
- X'phos made up the southern border of the Airgid Empire and is made up of free peoples who serve no one. Their strength is in the community and their wealth in the vine. It is also the homeland of the Iomliad, a people with shape-shifting abilities unique only to them.
The world is rich with cultures, peoples, and places, and I am so excited to share each of them with you all!
 
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020 (even editors need editing)
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder! (Although they look pretty sweet)
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats) (You want to be able to read it)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication (because gooder grammar doesn't cut it)
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Christmas season. (because my team is awesome)
 When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. (Do you know how bad I want the audiobook? I built a vocal booth in my office and I have pics as proof.)I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: 
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
A full-color map of the world I'm building
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Authors Note of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
Stephen Howard is an author, Developmental Editor, and Story Coach running his own business, The Editing Bard. As passionate as he is about writing his book, Stephen started his business with the goal of helping others achieve their publishing dreams and put their best books forward.In 2016, Stephen had a number of suppressed trauma memories resurface, which led him to ask God why He’d let it all happen. Over the years, and with a lot of therapy, God finally gave him a personalized answer that helped not only heal from the abuses, but showed how He was using it to bring healing to others.To be frank, Stephen has some serious control issues, swears way too much, is obsessed with Lord of the Rings, and can quote half the movie (okay, maybe this isn’t so bad)... The point is, he’s very much like the characters in his book (whispers: he’s got issues, shhh) and is on the same journey they are.For more information you can connect with Stephen at sdhowardauthor@gmail.com and on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Pinterest.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. story:
About Meaghan

I am a twenty-two year old writer currently residing in Peterborough, Ontario. As an avid reader and writer, I've always dreamed of having my work published. The indie revolution has afforded me that opportunity, but my bank account isn't quite keeping up with the rest of my life.

I am currently in the throes of passion with my first novel, "The Big Sleep." With one editor on board and a free prologue in the works, this project is moving along fast.

About "The Big Sleep"

Rain Collins lives in a world that has suffered invasion. Thirty years ago the Dream Walkers came to Earth and devoured the minds of its inhabitants.

Now, they're back. Rain, her family, and friends will have to face-off with their greatest fears, or else die trying.

What I need

Whether I make my goal or not, I need your help! Self-publishing is a long and tedious process, with tonnes of hurdles along the way, including:

  • Cover
    • Who doesn't judge a book by its cover?
  • Content editor
    • Making the story work
  • Line editor
    • Grammar and style improvements
  • Proofreader(s)
    • Further improvements
  • Marketing
    • Features on various websites
    • Trailer
    • Website

What else can you do?

  1. Spread the word! Tweet, text, tumble, stumble, or otherwise let your social network know about my goal.
  2. The prologue for "The Big Sleep," entitled "Dusk," will be released for free on August 25, 2012. Download it!

Thank you so much for visiting. I very sincerely appreciate any assistance that anyone can offer. Follow me (@meaghangray) for updates.

story:
"I want to be a doctor"

That's what Becky told us when we visited her school in northern Sierra Leone. Though there is a lot to worry about, from making ends meet to now staying strong through Ebola epidemic, there is always something to be thankful for. That's pretty awesome. Join us as we try to make girls like Becky achieve their dreams. 
Happy Thanksgiving to you and your families!
Love,
Memunatu Magazine Team

The Power of a Magazine

We grew up reading EVERYTHING. As kids, we'd get Scholastic News in the classroom and every issue, there was something new and exciting. As we got older, we'd read Seventeen and Teen Vogue. For us, magazines offered three things: community, empowerment, and something fun to read. For teenage girls in West Africa, who face struggles such as low literacy, limitations on their ability to advance, and societal pressure that takes away their voices, a magazine is a platform--a platform for 11.7 million girls that can build community, foster a culture of reading, and improve women's outcomes.   


Memunatu aims to promote literacy, leadership, and empowerment for teenage girls (10-17 yrs old) in West Africa through a classroom magazine. Our mission is to create a unique, community-driven publication that will specifically target under-served girls with a range of educational and fun content. Distributed through secondary schools with accompanying Teacher’s Guide, Memunatu bridges the gap between educational and extracurricular life.  Starting in Sierra Leone, Memunatu has the power to engage and inspire girls across the continent. 

The ASK

The team is looking for $5,000 to help make Memunatu Magazine a reality

Funding will go towards the following:

  • Production: Creative design for the first issue  
  • Outreach: Connecting with schools in the region 
  • Distribution: Informal networks to bring Memunatu to the girls

Perks are a way to be a part of the Memunatu experience! Participate in person, leaving your mark on the publication, or engage with the people Memunatu aims to reach.


Who we are:

We (founders) are twin sisters, who, as daughters of immigrants from Sierra Leone, grew up with knowledge and interest in the region. This was strengthened by educational and internship experience in law, public policy, international relations, and journalism. We created Memunatu (named after our mom) and have worked to take it through the ideation stage.

Memunatu has an amazing team of interns and a student advisory board (volunteers who helped with strategy) with experience in finance, at the UN, and top consumer magazines. Other advisors include diplomatic staff, education professionals, and diverse faculty mentors. We are building the West Africa team and are getting ready for launch!


Where we’ve been:
Memunatu has been recognized as an Echoing Green Semifinalist, Harvard Business School New Venture Competition Semifinalist, Dell Social Innovation Competition Fellow, Clinton Global Initiative University presenter, and as a Wharton Venture Initiation Program company. We were recently a resident team at the Harvard Innovation Lab and are now at 1776 incubator in Washington DC.

We sent a pilot issue to three schools in Sierra Leone (total population is about 4,700 girls) and have been building off that experience! 


The Impact  


Risks & Challenges

We are working in a dynamic environment. With the Ebola outbreak in the region, we are constantly adapting to our environment. We are confident that with our international team, focus on the readers, and commitment to improving female outcomes, that Memunatu is able to affect positive change.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word!

story:
¿Qué?

Golden Galaxy Tour aborda el apocalipsis desde un punto irónico que recuerda, sin duda, a Bill el héroe galáctico y similares. Una novela ideal si buscas desconcectar... del mundo.

Yo no esperaba que mi vida fuese esto. Iba a terminar mi carrera, encontrar un trabajo, quejarme bebiendo cerveza con los amigos cada noche, puede que incluso acabase casándome o (más probablemente) coleccionando gatos y aprendiendo a hacer ganchillo. Quizás no era el mejor plan del mundo, pero era mi plan.

El problema es que la Tierra tenía otro plan: implosionar. Adiós a la carrera, la cerveza y el resto de la Humanidad. No tanto a los gatos, pero esa es una historia más larga. En estos momentos solo me quedan un alien proscrito, la delincuencia y mucho tiempo libre para hacer turismo. Y el peligro añadido de ser la última humana del Universo, que es como decir "venid a venderme por trocitos".

¿Sabíais que somos como una especie de fetiche para otras razas?

Da igual... Ahora estoy sola con Mate, entre cuyas aficiones se encuentran seducir mujeres, pilotar con los pies y confundir el cine con la realidad. Supongo que robar una nave y huir del hospital en que me he despertado solo ha sido el principio...

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Claudia G. Rivas.

Nacida en Asturias un frío día de 1991, vivió en Oviedo hasta 2012, cuando decidió emprender la aventura Erasmus y se marchó a la Eötvös Lórand Tudomangyetem en Budapest. Allí, además de enamorarse del húngaro, hacer de los trenes su segundo hogar y caerse numerosas veces en la nieve, empezó a escribir Golden Galaxy Tour, probando que el letal invierno magyar y los cursos sobre ciencia ficción solo habían acentuado su locura.

Ahora es (por fin) filóloga hispánica y vive en Filadelfia. Hace su máster en Estudios Hispánicos a la par que trabaja en Villanova University. Su escaso tiempo libre lo reparte entre escribir, discutir con su madre y comer tarta con amigas. También ha publicado relatos en la revista El Cid, de la Citadel College. Golden Galaxy Tour fue finalista en el III Concurso Internacional de Novela Contacto Latino.

Claudia G. Rivas desborda calidad y entusiasmo.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Golden Galaxy Tour que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Claudia G. Rivas vea publicada su obra. 

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
For English, please scroll down.

LA COMUNIDAD DE BOSQUE SHAMBALA

Somos una pareja que decidimos dejar la ciudad para desarrollar una vida autosustentable en un bosque de niebla en mayo de 2014 y destinar este proyecto al desarrollo de la conciencia. Nuestra misión es formar parte de los sembradores de la nueva conciencia a través de métodos y medicinas naturales. Invertimos todo lo que teníamos en este objetivo, nuestros ingresos económicos, nuestra energía, tiempo, amor y vida. Nuestro trabajo es crear una comunidad autosustentable, un centro de sanación holística y una escuela de permacultura; dar servicio de salud gratuito para las comunidades indígenas marginadas que están a nuestro alrededor; recibir gente de todo el mundo interesada en esta forma de vida, a quedarse por temporadas o en residencia permanente y así, formar parte de una red invisible de personas comprometidas a crear un mundo mejor, compartiendo ideales, esperanzas, sueños, de lo que implica este estilo de vida: felicidad, salud y altruismo. 

PARA ESO NECESITAMOS UN CAMINO

En mayo se cumple un año que iniciamos el proyecto y ahora necesitamos construir un camino ya que, para llegar a la comunidad hay que caminar en medio de la vegetación y de las rocas a través de un sendero muy escarpado. En los días lluviosos los pacientes no pueden desplazarse hasta la comunidad a recibir sus terapias porque el suelo está muy resbaloso y algunos vienen en muy mal estado de salud. Esta zona no tiene ningún hospital ni servicio médico y tienen que caminar durante tres o cuatro horas para llegar al médico más cercano. Por este motivo hacemos un llamado a las personas que quieran involucrarse en esta misión, a formar parte de Bosque Shambala realizando una aportación económica para construir este camino. 

DESCRIPCIÓN DEL PROYECTO

Con tu ayuda en este proyecto podremos recaudar fondos para formar un equipo en el que trabajarán cinco personas de las comunidades vecinas. Se usarán herramientas manuales a lo largo de casi dos kilómetros en suelo escarpado, con muchas rocas, abriendo el camino a dos metros de ancho de pura terracería. Dependiendo de las condiciones climáticas, este trabajo durará seis meses aproximadamente y tendrá un costo de $109,000 pesos ($7,160 USD). Les damos las gracias a todos ustedes por ayudarnos a crear un camino para el futuro, los invitamos a visitarnos. Si quieres conocer más sobre este lugar entra a la página de Facebook: Bosque Shambala.




ENGLISH:

A PATH FOR THE FUTURE

A dedicated holistic community with a natural health center needs a secure, safe walking path so they can receive patients from isolated villages in their region.

THE BOSQUE SHAMBALA COMMUNITY

We are José Luis and Alejandra, a couple who decided to leave the city and develop a self-sufficient life in the rain forest in May of 2014. Our project’s goal is to raise the awareness of the conscience, and our mission is to spread the seeds of the new world through, various natural methods and medicines. We invest all we have in order to reach this goal: our economic incomes, energy, time, hope, love and lives. Our purpose is to create a self-sufficient community, holistic healing center, a permaculture school and to give free health care to the indigenous and isolated communities around us. We also want to receive people from all around the world interested in this lifestyle and encourage them to stay for a short time or permanent residence. We hope to be part of a worldwide network of people connected by their mutual ideals, hopes and dreams of what a happy, healthy, altruistic community can look like.

But first, we need a path.

Currently, if the stone and dirt path is dry, we can receive up to 5 patients a day, even in its poor condition. However, after rainfall, the path is barely accessible to an able-bodied person, and to a person with a physical disorder or an elderly person, the path is not accessible at all. We feel confident that with your help to build our new walkway, we will be able to treat people as they wish without the weather hindering their ability to reach us, and our wish to help them.

THE TANGIBLE GOAL

With your help, we will have funding to gather a team of dedicated supporters from surrounding communities to clear a path nearly two kilometers long and two meters wide with manual tools. With our climate and terrain conditions, this job will take approximately six months to complete, with a cost of $109,000 pesos ($7160 USD). If you can find it within your hearts to help us build the path to realize our dreams, we will extend our utmost gratitude to you, and hope that you visit us here at Bosque Shambala to experience all that we have to offer.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Hallo, ich bin Vanessa, 21 Jahre alt und gelernte Krankenschwester. Ich liebe es zu schreiben, zu reisen und würde dir gerne davon berichten - in einem Reise-Blog. Jedoch fällt es mir nicht leicht mit meinem Gehalt als Krankenschwester genug zu sparen. Dazu kommt, dass die Mieten in Freiburg nicht billig sind. ;)
Wenn du mich unterstützt, unterstützt du, dass ich in Indien starten und durch Süd-Ost-Asien reisen kann. Ich werde die ganze Zeit über in meinem künftigen Blog davon berichten.  Ich werde erklären, was es in Indien zu beachten gibt, was die perfekte Vorbereitung für deine Reise nach Süd-Ost-Asien ist, wie es ist ein Motorrad zu kaufen und welches die schönsten Strecken sind.
Es ist mein großer Traum und ich hoffe du kannst mir dabei Helfen ihn zu verwirklichen und davon profitieren!

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Das Geld benötige ich für den Flug, für Unterkünfte, für Essen und Trinken. Ich werde versuchen so billig wie möglich zu reisen und dir auch davon berichten, wie gut es funktioniert.

Man benötigt in Süd-Ost-Asien nicht viel Geld, daher reicht schon wenig aus, um lange zu reisen und viele Informationen zu sammeln, Blog-Artikel zu schreiben und damit dir bei deiner Planung, Fragen und Ängsten weiter zu helfen.

Das besondere an der Reise und dem Blog wird sein, dass ich mit meinem Partner unterwegs bin. Wir werden davon berichten, welche Auswirkungen das auf die Beziehung hat, vor allem, wenn man bedenkt, dass wir zu zweit auf einem Motorrad unterwegs sein werden. Außerdem kann ich kein Motorrad fahren und habe vor das in Indien zu lernen...

Es gibt schon einen konkreten Homepage-Entwurf, bzw. eine Adresse dazu: www.2travellers.de
Geplant ist, dass der Blog am 15.11.2015 startet.

Falls du uns ohne einen Beitrag unterstützen möchtet, dann merk dir die Seite und sei beim Start live dabei! Erzähle allen reisebegeisterten Freunden davon und mach uns populär!

story:
Short Summary

Almost 20 years ago I left my secure position as a teacher/manager in education.

Embracing my uniqueness, with the realization - that is who I am!

Zoetic Soul was born out of my passion for all things spiritual, my souls direction and a desire to enable others to live in their souls intended miraculous way. My life as the black sheep, the one that is always wrong, the one who is always blamed, the one who years to break free. You will read about the journey of others and see glimpses of your own, you may have tears of joy or sadness as you resonate with the tranced dialogues. You will recognise sections of your personal journey as you read  about and contemplate change. What Zoetic Soul will give you is the triumphant feeling that you are not alone. It will show you that even the smallest step in the right direction is the right direction.You are ready to move on in your life. You are ready to be you. You are ready for abundance. You are ready to becomeYou!

You know there is  more... release your souls armour and conditioning, to live your souls purpose. 

Own one of the first signed copies of Zoetic Soul, with a personal dedication in exchange for £15.00

Everyone can feel worthy, special and passionate -  Zoetic Soul gives you the tools.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need £2100 to publish Zoetic Soul, and take into account the indiegogo fee structure. I have initial interest from a publishing company who will tailor a package for my needs. The funds will be used to:

  • Finally prepare for publication
  • PR and Marketing plan
  • Distribution
  • Secure a venue for the debut workshop and workbook preperation
  • Online workshop streaming with any funding over my initial ask

PERKS!

  • All contributors will receive an inspirational poem, from a collection yet to be published.
  • £1 will receive an inspirational poem.
  • £15 will receive an inspirational poem and a signed copy of Zoetic Soul with dedication.
  • £25 will receive a PDF copy of 10 inspirational poems and a signed copy of Zoetic Soul with dedication.
  • £25 will receive a pdf copy of 10 inspirational poems and a 30 minute psychic/mediumship/coaching session.
  • £50+ will receive a pdf copy of 20 inspirational poems, one written for you. Two signed copies of Zoetic Soul with dedication.
  • £100+ will receive a pdf copy of 20 inspirational poems, on written for you and 3 family members. Four signed copies of Zoetic Soul with dedications.

The Impact

 Zoetic Soul is about recognising  and realising that nothing is stopping you once you have made small changes in your thoughts and actions. To having what you really deserve in life. Change your story through Zoetic Soul.

Bring about change

Spread the word through my accounts on social medial, you-tube etc

  •  facebook 5337 likers now...https://m.facebook.com/janpsychic.mayfield/?ref...
  • tweeting https://twitter.com/i/notifications
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • look out for Zoetic Soul on my website www.janpsychicmedium.com

A review from a beta reader

Zoetic Soul – Pertaining to life -by -Jan Mayfield

I was very skeptical about the subject of this book  partially “written in trance”. However when I started to read, it became very difficult to put down, with well described scenarios.

I became totally immersed in the subject and began to reflect on my own life my “Zoetic Soul” pertaining to my life.

It became very clear to me that we are on earth for a very short time, everything planned and set out for us before birth. We are here to learn and grow our souls from our experiences here.

I felt that each scenario was being passed on as learning experience for me and found it enlightening and intriguing.

I found this book a very good source of valuable information which would help everyone to have a glimpse into their own soul and learn from the experience.

At times I was mesmerized, with the rhythm of the tranced dialogue. 

I recommend it highly as a very well written book. A very good read indeed.

E A Franklin

My thanks to you and Indiegogo for enabling this funding, for your support and donations are so humbly received.

story:
A New Goal and New Perks

select yours on right

We're still pushing toward our stretch goal of 4k, and we're bringing some new perks to help get us there. An Oregon artist and metalworker, Brad Wagner, has created a burnished steel cut of our logo mounted on wood.

Award-winning writer, Kim Barnes, and award-winning poet, Robert Wrigley, have donated signed copies of two incredible books they wrote, In the Wilderness and Beautiful Country. They donated with wilderness in mind. These books speak to the unrelenting harshness and redemptive beauty of living in the wilds of the Inland Pacific Northwest. I have learned much from Kim and Bob and their work.

And Belinda made pillows. Mountain throw pillows. Handmade, this mini mountain range we're calling "The Belindas" could span your love seat.


Thanks to everyone, thus far, who has helped us hit our first goal of $2,500. We're now reaching for a stretch goal of $4,000, which will help us buy heavier equipment, like a chainsaw and gas-powered tiller, and double our greenhouse space. How do you get bigger than the mountains? The moon, naturally. This new perk is a chalk and charcoal black 80% cotton, acid-free archival paper created and donated by Laura Sievert. It is an original, one-of-a-kind. It measures 15x15" matted in a 30x30" silver frame. Laura and I collaborated on this, and the print comes with a section about the moon of a long poem I've written called "Woods." There's a sample of it below, written in calligraphy by John Go. We also have other perks coming, like handcrafted jewelry, belt buckles, and others. Stay tuned.

PEN/Margery Davis Boyden Residency

Last year, I was selected as the 2016 PEN/Margery Davis Boyden Wilderness Writing Resident. Originally designed as a 6 - 7 month residency, I have worked with the homestead owners to winter over in the Rogue River Wilderness and write for 1 year.  I won't have access to electricity, cell service or internet. During the winter, snowed in, I won't have access to the nearest town (2 hours away) or a grocery store. All donations will fund food stores and growing for those extra 6 months while I work on two major writing projects, a long poem and a novel, inspired by the ecologically diverse and preserved Rogue River Wilderness. By backing me, you will bring Western landscapes into your life and home. 

The Perks: Select Yours on the Right

The goal is to raise $2,500 to provide enough food stores, seed, fertilizer, tools and supplies for a long winter. I have collaborated with artists and naturalists to provide perks you get for backing me. Each perk is designed to bring to you, or bring you to, the beauty and stunning geographical features of our Western landscapes:

  • At $300, A two-night weekend stay in a cabin on Mosby Creek in Southwest Oregon. This cabin sits right on the creek, with an outdoor hot tub and total immersion in nature. Near Crater Lake (Doesn't include travel to cabin). 

 

 

  • At $200, Pick 1 of 5 11" x 14" distinct photographs that showcase Oregon landscapes, the state in which the residency occurs. Each photograph is hand matted and framed in custom all wood 16" x 20" frames.

 

 

  • At $100, painter Kayla Paisley has donated "In the Grain," Oil on barn wood. One of a kind.


  • At $30, a handmade and handbound journal, created by Montana book artist Peggy Christian. One of a kind.

 


  • At $25, Letters from the Mountains logo T-shirt. The logo was designed after the peak of Bonneville Mountain (pictured) in the Wallowa Mountains of Northeast Oregon. T-shirts come in all sizes, screen printed on tri-blend Gildan tees. (Curious about sizing? Click here.)


  • At $20, award-winning designer and art director, Jordan Sparrow, has created a broadside of my poem, "Poem," first published in Kahini Magazine. Read the full text here. Limited printing of 30.


  • At $15, pick an unframed 8x10 print of 1 of the 5 photographs featured in this campaign: Smith Rock, Punchbowl Falls, Sweet Creek Falls, the Wallowa Mountains or Sisters Mountains. (Print only.)
  • At $5, get a set of 5 bookmarks featuring the photos from this campaign, so you can mark trail into the wilds of your favorite books.

  • Anyone who backs me at $1 or more will receive a postcard from me from the Rogue River Wilderness to say thank you, personally. Designed with 1 of 5 photographs donated to this campaign.

The Risks

While the only thing standing between me and good writing is myself, wintering over in the wilderness comes with unique challenges. I will not have access to a grocery store, electricity, internet or cell service. The Rogue River is home to black bear, cougar and other large predators with keen noses. In an emergency or unexpected illness, I will have to rely on preparation and resourcefulness.  I will need to cultivate a sizable winter garden, erect a portable greenhouse, and stock food stores for 7 months in case the winter is harsh and long. I will also need certain tools, materials and supplies. Every contribution makes this level of preparation possible:

  • $2 – A packet of heirloom seed stock
  • $5 – A spade, gardening gloves, or other necessary hand tool
  • $7 – A typewriter ribbon
  • $15 – A shovel, hoe or other similar tool for cutting, tilling and planting
  • $40 – Wash bin, ringer, and powder soap to do laundry
  • $90 – Fertilizer for about two growing seasons for half an acre
  • $100 – 10 gallons of kerosene to power lanterns through winter
  • $125 – Jars, pectin, sugar, vinegar, citric acid and other supplies for canning and preserving food.
  • $150 – First aid supplies and emergency preparedness
  • $200 – A cord of firewood to burn for heat for 2-3 months
  • $425 – Materials to erect a greenhouse of about 48 square feet
  • $600 – Propane to power stove, alt. lighting, and refrigeration for winter
  • $1,200 – Foods stores for a seven-month winter

Backers Make It Happen

America has a track record for cultivating some of the world's greatest artists, by investing in the arts. This residency lives in the artery of this tradition. By backing me, you provide 6-7 additional months of time for me to work, study and dedicate myself to quality writing in an inspiring place. I don't view this residency as a vacation, or time off, by any means. I intend to work, to write every day, to study and to yield writing that contributes meaningfully to our cultural conversation. I have been doing this for some time now. I have earned a BA and MFA in English and Creative Writing, received fellowships from the University of Idaho and Centrum Foundation, and my work has  appeared in national publications including Willow Springs, Lake Effect, Kahini Magazine and Boston Review.

Special Thanks to the Team

First and foremost, Frank & Bradley Boyden, who live in Oregon. Without them, and their invaluable support for the arts, this residency would not exist.

Clinton Begley has built a life traveling waters between lands with kayak and camera, and now he works on rivers in Oregon, where he brings people together in cooperation and stewardship of important and thriving waters.

John Daniel is an award-winning writer and editor of poetry, fiction, and nonfiction--and an advocate for the arts and artists. With PEN Northwest, he administers this residency. His book, Rogue River Journal: A Winter Alone, details his experience winter over in the Rogue River Wilderness. 

Peggy Christian is a book artists living in Montana.

Kayla Paisley lives and paints in Portland, Oregon.

Spence Palermo has 28 years experience in film and television production throughout the US, Canada, Latin America, Europe, Asia, the Artic and the Pacific. Clients include National Geographic, Discovery Channel, PBS, History Channel and a host of other non-fiction venues and private non-broadcast clientele.

Matt Parker resides in Bend, Oregon with his loyal companion, Murdock (a German Shorthaired Pointer). He spends every free minute mountain biking, skiing, climbing, hiking and enjoying the backcountry on his dual-sport motorcycle.

Laura Sievert spends her days doing commercial art but is most happy when getting back to "messy" art forms like drawing and sculpting. She's an avid outdoorswoman and is especially drawn to cycling, kayaking and hiking.  She is married and has one son who shines more brightly in her life than the sun, moon and stars all combined. She is currently living in Quincy, IL.

Jordan Sparrow is a national award-winning graphic designer and art director, and a dear friend of Eric Greenwell.

Loren Tracy is a Midwest transplant living in Portland, Oregon. He is a visual designer who loves music and the outdoors.

Sharing this Campaign

And it would really help if you can spread the word by sharing Letters from the Mountains with your friends--hikers, travelers, writers, photographers and wilderness enthusiasts--those who understand and value wilderness experience. Share on Facebook, Twitter and other networks with the tools below or on the left-hand side of the page. Thanks!
story_txt:
A New Goal and New Perks 

select yours on right
We're still pushing toward our stretch goal of 4k, and we're bringing some new perks to help get us there. An Oregon artist and metalworker, Brad Wagner, has created a burnished steel cut of our logo mounted on wood. Award-winning writer, Kim Barnes, and award-winning poet, Robert Wrigley, have donated signed copies of two incredible books they wrote, In the Wilderness and Beautiful Country. They donated with wilderness in mind. These books speak to the unrelenting harshness and redemptive beauty of living in the wilds of the Inland Pacific Northwest. I have learned much from Kim and Bob and their work.
 
And Belinda made pillows. Mountain throw pillows. Handmade, this mini mountain range we're calling "The Belindas" could span your love seat. 

Thanks to everyone, thus far, who has helped us hit our first goal of 
$2,500. We're now reaching for a stretch goal of $4,000, which will help
 us buy heavier equipment, like a chainsaw and gas-powered tiller, and 
double our greenhouse space. How do you get bigger than the mountains? 
The moon, naturally. This new perk is a chalk and charcoal black 80% 
cotton, acid-free archival paper created and donated by Laura Sievert. It is an original, one-of-a-kind.
 It measures 15x15" matted in a 30x30" silver frame. Laura and I 
collaborated on this, and the print comes with a section about the moon 
of a long poem I've written called "Woods." There's a sample of it 
below, written in calligraphy by John Go. We also have other perks coming, like handcrafted jewelry, belt buckles, and others. Stay tuned.



PEN/Margery Davis Boyden Residency
 Last year, I was selected as the 2016 PEN/Margery Davis Boyden Wilderness Writing Resident. Originally designed as a 6 - 7 month residency, I have worked with the homestead owners to winter over in the Rogue River Wilderness and write for 1 year.  I won't have access to electricity, cell service or internet. During the winter, snowed in, I won't have access to the nearest town (2 hours away) or a grocery store. All donations will fund food stores and growing for those extra 6 months while I work on two major writing projects, a long poem and a novel, inspired by the ecologically diverse and preserved Rogue River Wilderness. By backing me, you will bring Western landscapes into your life and home. 
The Perks: Select Yours on the Right
 The goal is to raise $2,500 to provide enough food stores, seed, fertilizer, tools and supplies for a long winter. I have collaborated with artists and naturalists to provide perks you get for backing me. Each perk is designed to bring to you, or bring you to, the beauty and stunning geographical features of our Western landscapes:  At $300, A two-night weekend stay in a cabin on Mosby Creek in Southwest Oregon. This cabin sits right on the creek, with an outdoor hot tub and total immersion in nature. Near Crater Lake (Doesn't include travel to cabin). 

   
  
At $200, Pick 1 of 5 11" x 14" distinct photographs that showcase Oregon landscapes, the state in which the residency occurs. Each photograph is hand matted and framed in custom all wood 16" x 20" frames.



   

  


 At $100, painter Kayla Paisley has donated "In the Grain," Oil on barn wood. One of a kind.



At $30, a handmade and handbound journal, created by Montana book artist Peggy Christian. One of a kind.

   

At $25, Letters from the Mountains logo T-shirt. The logo was designed after the peak of Bonneville Mountain (pictured) in the Wallowa Mountains of Northeast Oregon. T-shirts come in all sizes, screen printed on tri-blend Gildan tees. (Curious about sizing? Click here.)



At $20, award-winning designer and art director, Jordan Sparrow, has created a broadside of my poem, "Poem," first published in Kahini Magazine. Read the full text here. Limited printing of 30.



At $15, pick an unframed 8x10 print of 1 of the 5 photographs featured in this campaign: Smith Rock, Punchbowl Falls, Sweet Creek Falls, the Wallowa Mountains or Sisters Mountains. (Print only.)

At $5, get a set of 5 bookmarks featuring the photos from this campaign, so you can mark trail into the wilds of your favorite books. 



Anyone who backs me at $1 or more will receive a postcard from me from the Rogue River Wilderness to say thank you, personally. Designed with 1 of 5 photographs donated to this campaign.





 The Risks
  While the only thing standing between me and good writing is myself, wintering over in the wilderness comes with unique challenges. I will not have access to a grocery store, electricity, internet or cell service. The Rogue River is home to black bear, cougar and other large predators with keen noses. In an emergency or unexpected illness, I will have to rely on preparation and resourcefulness.  I will need to cultivate a sizable winter garden, erect a portable greenhouse, and stock food stores for 7 months in case the winter is harsh and long. I will also need certain tools, materials and supplies. Every contribution makes this level of preparation possible:



$2 – A packet of heirloom
seed stock

$5 – A spade, gardening gloves, or
other necessary hand tool
$7 – A typewriter ribbon
$15 – A shovel, hoe or other similar
tool for cutting, tilling and planting
$40 – Wash bin, ringer, and
powder soap to do laundry
$90 – Fertilizer for about two growing seasons for half an acre
$100 – 10 gallons of kerosene to
power lanterns through winter
$125 – Jars, pectin, sugar, vinegar, citric acid and other supplies for canning and preserving food.

$150 – First aid supplies and emergency preparedness

$200 – A cord of firewood to burn for
heat for 2-3 months
$425 – Materials to erect a greenhouse
of about 48 square feet
$600 – Propane to power stove, alt.
lighting, and refrigeration for winter
$1,200 – Foods stores for a seven-month winter



Backers Make It Happen



 
America has a track record for cultivating some of the 
world's greatest artists, by investing in the arts. This residency lives
 in the artery of this tradition. By backing me, you provide 6-7 
additional months of time for me to work, study and dedicate myself to 
quality writing in an inspiring place. I don't view this residency as a 
vacation, or time off, by any means. I intend to work, to write every 
day, to study and to yield writing that contributes meaningfully to our 
cultural conversation. I have been doing this for some time now. I have 
earned a BA and MFA in English and Creative Writing, received 
fellowships from the University of Idaho and Centrum Foundation, and my 
work has  appeared in national publications including Willow Springs, Lake Effect, Kahini Magazine and Boston Review.


  
Special Thanks to the Team

First and foremost, Frank & Bradley Boyden, who live in Oregon. Without them, and their invaluable support for the arts, this residency would not exist.
Clinton Begley has built a life traveling waters between lands  with kayak and camera, and now he works on rivers in Oregon, where he brings people together in cooperation and stewardship of important and thriving waters.
John Daniel is an award-winning writer and editor of poetry, fiction, and nonfiction--and an advocate for the arts and artists. With PEN Northwest, he administers this residency. His book, Rogue River Journal: A Winter Alone, details his experience winter over in the Rogue River Wilderness. 
Peggy Christian is a book artists living in Montana.
Kayla Paisley lives and paints in Portland, Oregon.
Spence Palermo has 28 years experience in film and television production 
throughout the US, Canada, Latin America, Europe, Asia, the Artic and 
the Pacific. Clients include National Geographic, Discovery Channel, 
PBS, History Channel and a host of other non-fiction venues and private 
non-broadcast clientele.
Matt Parker resides in Bend, Oregon with his loyal companion, Murdock (a 
German Shorthaired Pointer). He spends every free minute mountain biking, skiing, climbing, hiking and enjoying the backcountry on his dual-sport motorcycle.
Laura Sievert spends her days doing commercial art but is most happy 
when getting back to "messy" art forms like drawing and sculpting. She's
 an avid outdoorswoman and is especially drawn to cycling, kayaking and 
hiking.  She is married and has one son who shines more brightly in her 
life than the sun, moon and stars all combined. She is currently living 
in Quincy, IL.
Jordan Sparrow is a national award-winning graphic designer and art director, and a dear friend of Eric Greenwell.
Loren Tracy is a Midwest transplant living in Portland, Oregon. He is a visual designer who loves music and the outdoors.

story:
- What is Starry Eyed: Literary Magazine?

  • A new magazine founded by Brennen Wedl and Thea Evinger
  • The magazine contains student artwork and writing (poetry, short story, etc.)
  • This Academy of Holy Angels' first ever literary magazine on paper.

- What inspired this magazine?

  • Since our school is so sports dominated, we wanted to bring the fine arts side.
  • We wanted even ratio of sports:fine arts
  • This magazine helps bring out the artistic sides of people and the community as a whole.

- What makes this magazine different?

  • This is the first time a school magazine has ever been printed on paper.
  • The magazine be a lot more popular if it were on paper.

- Why we need the funds?

  • Printing in school is not an possibilty and we have seek outside printing options.
  • The cost for the magazine is around $300, but we would like to raise more for our future issue.

- What are some perks?

  • If one donates $25 they will receive their name in the back of the issue the "Special Thanks" page.
  • $80 or more one will receive their name in the back of the issue and a free copy of the magazine.

- How will it effect the school?

  • It writers and artists out of their shells.
  • It will make the school better as whole, with more extra curricular activities.

story:
American Athenaeum: Why this journal matters?

We've just debuted the first issue of American Athenaeum, and we need you help to keep printing voices across America (and the world) that often go unheard.

Who We Are

Our commitment is to our readers. Besides sourcing works of fiction from across the globe, we offer a place to talk books. We think of our press as the coliseum, the open fire, the desert range, the place to connect you with fiction that resonates a sense of nostalgia for the old days, while at the same time offering a view of the future.

American Athenaeum is a cultural magazine that features fiction, poetry, essays, opinion, author book reviews, and more. Each journal explores the world of words like a patron explores a museum—by offering a view of the past, right up until the present. We consider this journal to be a museum of artistic endeavors, filled with cultural appreciation and stories that not only teach, but demonstrate the frailty of the human condition.

Getting Starting: Your Pledge

To order the digital issue, please pledge $10.

To order the printed book, please pledge $25.

To pledge, click a button on the right. We're looking to raise $8,450 by the Oct. 30, deadline.

What we will use the funds for: 

  • Printing the next, and subsequent issues
  • Paying for layout, cover artist
  • Monthly expenses (From webhosting fees, to postage)
  • Marketing and advertising: A single, cheap (but good) advert is around $500. We need to get the word out on AA. 
  • Paying staff (Everyone is volunteer here. We'd like to pay them). Paying writers. 
  • Purchasing a table at a conference, like the AWP in 2013.

 

Rewards For You!

We can't do this without you! And for your support, for your backing, for your say in supporting this independent publisher, we pour out our sack of goodies to you. Everyone who donates to the American Athenaeum project gets something in return--not just the glowing feeling of supporting this project, but jingling tangibles.

An $10 Pledge

An $10 pledge gets you the ebook of Colossus: American Athenaeum, our debut issue. 

A $25 pledge gets you the print version of Colossus: American Athenaeum. In this issue you'll visit exhibits of poetry, fiction, and essays from contemporary writers around the world. You'll also get a ticket to the past as we drive through the minds of a few choice orators who still have something to share with us. Our special departments are sure to delight, like America Talks, 1 Bookshelf, Writers Adopt Endangered Species, Author Book Reviews, and a novel serialization. There is something for everyone here.

A $40 pledge gets you a print copy of Colossus and The Understanders Issue, due out in December. (Should be available for the holiday season, and will make a great gift.) 

And there are still more pledges and gifts for you to choose from. Just scroll down on the right-hand side to see what other jingles are available. 

Why We Need You? (Please read)

"We are the music makers,
And we are the dreamers of dreams." ~A. O'Shaughnessy.

Publishing is big business. But we believe in the small community of readers. Did you know Jane Austen's book, Emma, had a print run of only 2000? Seems small in comparison to big authors today. But for us, we think 2000 is something else! 2000 readers is huge! For us the important thing is being appreciative to ALL our readers, all those willing to take a chance to make this dream come true.

We encourage you to check out our website, see what we're doing. We're small bananas right now, but we have a vision, and could really make a difference in breaking through the static and void created by the big publishers. Down here, there are so many worthy writers, poets, artists, and we'd like to give them the chance to be published and heard. Join our community. (You can also make donations through our website.) 

Please make a pledge today and back this project.

Warriors Warriors: Connect

Help us spread the word. This is an incredible journal, one that we can't wait to share with you. Every writer needs an audience. We love talking about books, writing, and always about our collections. Ways to stay connected and updated with us:

  • Our blog
  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Website

Ways that you can help spread the word

Get your messenger hat on. We need to kick this project all across the map! Here are a few ideas to help you spread the word. Feel free to come up with your own.

  • Hosting American Athenaeum on your blog with a Kickstart interview.
  • Post our project on your blog, FB, or other social media.
  • Talk to your friends, teachers, and librarians, let them know that there is an important journal looking for wings.
  • Buy a copy of the journal for your public or college library. (They love donations). (Yes, the book has an ISBN and ID#). 
  • Email blast telling the world about this wicked cool journal project! 
  • Hang at the coffee shop with a big sign about our project. (If you do, let us know, we'll bring some friends, a guitar, and we'll make a song about it!) 
  • Thank you!

From my universe to yours, we humbly thank you for taking the time to consider this project. It's about you helping us. Like we said at the beginning of this thread, American Athenaeum is an important vehicle of free speech. 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Your pledge is everything! If you are on the fence, drop us an email. If you're ready to publish this journal with us, click the green pledge button for American Athenaeum! To cheer us on Facebook, click the "like" button under the video.

***For your pledge and your wishes and support, we are so grateful, and will never forget your kindness.

story:
This campaign is to raise money for my friend Andy who was recently attacked by a pit bull while jogging in a public place, leaving him with a substantial amount of medical bills.

Like many Andy is a current college graduate (SUNY Geneseo) working hard to balance jobs and does not have health insurance.  

My friend does not know I am campaigning for him and would never expect perfect strangers to help support him financially. He is an optimistic and kind person who goes out of his way to help and listens empathetically to the troubles and triumphs of his friends.

With this campaign I hope to raise enough money to cover his medical expenses, which as of now include an ER visit, ambulance ride, and follow up care. Let's wow Andy with our generosity and show him that not all dog owners are the bite-and-walk type!

Below is his story, as posted on Facebook, in his own words:

"Dear World on Facebook:

Yesterday, I went for a run through Cobbs Hill Park and around the reservoir. On a humid day, around 1:30pm I was headed back to East Avenue. Running down Culver Road, I came up behind a guy walking his pit bull after crossing the bridge over 490. The pup was almost comically fat with an orange/red coat, and the owner roughly 5'10", skinny, light skinned with 3-4" brown hair, wearing a backwards turned baseball cap and sunglasses.

Between the off ramp and Harvard St I decided to pass the two on the grass to the right, between the sidewalk and a fence. I looked down at the adorable, waddling pooch, and as I did this it jumped up and bit me, tearing my shirt. I was immediately startled as it jumped up again and bit my left thigh. I fell forward to the ground as the owner restrained the dog. I got up, looked at him, and the first words that came out of his mouth were: "Maybe you shouldn't sneak up on a pit bull."

Feeling blood run down my leg, I looked through the sunglasses to where his eyes would be and asked, "Are you serious right now?" From a silver car stopped at the red light in lunch time traffic an onlooker yelled, "Hey, I saw what just happened. Do you need me to call an ambulance?" Another car, red, carrying two passengers, pulled up on the side of the road. One of them asked, "Are you okay?" and "We saw everything that happened."

I looked down at my shorts, a dark stain spreading across the fabric, and back up to the dog owner. He said, "Maybe you should take care of your leg." I looked down at my leg, peeled back my shorts and torn boxers, and saw a [chunk] of my skin missing, the wound spilling with blood. I looked up and said, "Yeah, you're right (thanks, I wasn't sure of what I should do next)," and asked "Do you have a cellphone?" He told me he didn't. I asked the two people in the red car the same question, and they drove off. The man in the silver car had already driven off, presumably with a green light.

I looked at the dog owner, and of course I wanted to punch him in the face. I looked at the dog, and all I could think was that if I called the police and pushed further, then the dog would most likely be put down. It's not the dog's fault his owner is, well... whatever you'd like to call him. So, I thought, "Screw this," and walked the quarter or half mile to my grandparents house, left shoe filling with blood. The owner continued walking his dog, seemingly unfazed, down Harvard St.

After a brief, expletive filled walk, I called up to my grandmother and asked her to grab some water, her car keys and to bring me to the emergency room. After a few minutes, she appeared with my grandfather, taking a moment to put some ice in the water (gotta/God love her). Driving towards Highland Hospital, we came back to the same corner, where a RPD Animal Control vehicle was just pulling up. I got out and spoke with the officer, and filed a report. I have no personal information for the owner. She sat me down in some shade, and washed my wound with water as I drank a bit. I took an ambulance ride to the U of R Medical Center where I was treated...

...I've been told that if a pit bull bites at a person once it is likely to do it again. I hate the idea of the dog being put down, though it could be for the best. I wouldn't want a child or anyone for that matter to get bitten.

So all I can say now is, please, be good to your animals and be good to each other."

story:
We’re seeking your help to raise $5,000 to publish and promote our new book “Monster-in-Law…and the Rest of Her Rotten Family”. Let’s Go!

 

At last! A proper guide on how to deal with the ‘other woman’ in your partner’s life – his MOTHER! 

 

What is this project about?

‘Monster-in-law…and the Rest of Her Rotten Family’ is a must-read guide for any daughter-in-law (DIL) having trouble with her mother-in-law (MIL). A hilarious read, it is one of the bitchiest, most cleverly crafted, laugh-out-loud books of its kind; chock full of fast facts, short stories and full colour cartoons.

My name is Nicola Milan and together with my co-author (and mum) Judy Davies, we wrote and illustrated this book to help me heal from the dramatic and stressful breakdown of my engagement to my fiancé. Why did we break up? Because of HIS MOTHER. 

To create this book we interviewed women dealing with a problem MIL, conducted extensive online research and drew on our own experience. We quickly realised that there are women all over the world struggling with a difficult mother-in-law and this book has been designed to help you learn what ‘type’ of MIL you have and how to manage her behaviour.

We have even covered other rotten family members you might encounter. You will learn how to deal with a lascivious FIL (father-in-law) or bitchy SIL (sister-in-law.) It is also a wake-up call to older women who are becoming MILs for the first time. Some readers may even recognise themselves as one of the MIL types! 

How you can help.

We need your help to print and promote this book. We have done all the hard work writing and illustrating, so now we just need the funds to make ‘Monster-in-Law...and the Rest of Her Rotten Family’ a reality and spread the word. 

 

What else do you get?

This book is GUARANTEED to make you laugh but it is much more than just a giggle-fest. We really believe this book will help you learn how to Manage Your MIL and will help countless other women just like you find some much needed relief from dealing with a difficult mother-in-law.

There are some fantastic prizes up for grabs for anyone who lends us a hand and supports this campaign. You can even have your own MIL cartoon drawn based on a photograph of your choosing!

So if you are a bride-to-be, in a long term relationship or married and have been struggling with mother-in-law problems for years, then this book is for you! Please support this campaign and pledge today.

 

Other Ways to Help

You can share this campaign by clicking the Facebook and Twitter buttons under the video and help spread the word. Your friends can have a giggle at Judy’s acting debut in our video!   

 

Thank you!!

Nicola and Judy x

 

About the authors

Judy and Nicola are a mother-daughter team based in Perth, Western Australia. Nicola is an award winning cartoonist and responsible for all of the hilarious illustrations throughout the book. Her cartoon ‘The Glass Ceiling’ won an award in the International Cartooning Competition “Women on the World” and she has written and illustrated ‘Trolley-rage: Surviving the Peak Hour Food Shop’. Nicola is also a graphic artist and designed the book layout and cover.

Judy has finished writing her third book ‘Golden Spires’ about her adventures in Southeast Asia and has published her first solo e-book ‘Vietnam’. She blogs regularly under her pseudonym ‘Auntie-Flo’, a bumbling grey nomad who travels the world.

 

‘Together we can do this!’ Pledge today! 

 

Find out more - www.milsndils.com is an interactive web forum for DILs dealing with a problem MIL. Do the 'MIL Quiz' and find out which MIL you have!

story:
What the who is me?

I'm Rob! The author of the KarateQuest novellas. (karatepedia.hatsandwich.com or you can search "KarateQuest" on Amazon)

What the why am I asking for donations?

My books have sold pretty well for being un-marketed and fairly poorly edited. But people like the idea of an interactive novel and many like the universe I created. With the first season of the novella coming to a close, I want to make an "Ultimate Edition Boxed Set" with supplemental lore and other pieces. This will include all seven books that have been re-edited and revised to fit the greater canon.

But I'm not asking you to pay me to write. I want to hire a bunch of random artists via Fiverr.com and give them a chance at making art for the Ultimate Edition. That's where you come in.

A small donation of at least $6 (the five dollars for art plus the Fiverr/Paypal and Indiegogo admin fees) gets me one picture to add to the book. In doing so, I will make sure you get a credit (if you want) in the back of it. You don't even have to sponsor one piece, go high and more creative people can get opportunities to share their talents with the world via my book.

What the how else to help

Dropping a few bucks my way helps me get closer to my goal. But you can also help by telling your friends about this project! The more money I get, the more art I can add to the book.

Support the creative people out there and help out!

Track our progress.

I value your investment. Updates will be posted on karatepedia.hatsandwich.com along with articles. You can even go there and read the free (revised) copy of my first book!

story:
Una danza profunda,

que nos una a todas y todos

en el amor incondicional

que sana, que limpia y que cura.

Mi nombre es Carmen Sanchez, soy actriz de teatro social en Puerto Rico y dirijo un grupo de danza y teatro etnobotánico llamado, ArbolAdas. Nuestra misión es crear consciencia mediante el arte, la danza, el teatro y la performance convirtiéndonos en la voz de nuestros árboles. Encarnamos diferentes árboles llevando su mensaje a la humanidad como defensores y guardianes de nuestra madre, LA TIERRA.

 

Que es la Danza de la Luna?

Kalpulli Teo Chanti / Puriscal , Costa Rica

La abuela luna nos llama a esta danza sagrada

Séptima Ceremonia de Luna 

 METZTLIYOLILIZTLI

Por segunda vez llegan las mujeres de Borikén a la Danza de la Luna

en Costa Rica!

Durante cuatro días y cuatro noches danzaremos entre 165 mujeres, diosas y guerreras de luz. Mas de 15 países, diferentes lenguas, diferentes culturas, pero todas danzando en un solo Corazón.

Viviremos la hermosa experiencia de este poderoso rezo de la tradición Mexika para fortalecer el corazón, encontrar nuestro camino espiritual y reconocernos en la verdad que nos hará libres.

Este evento se realizara en Puriscal Costa Rica a partir de el 12 de Febrero y consiste en danzar nuestros rezos por cuatro noches corridas, en ayuno voluntario . La Danza de la Luna conlleva un compromiso de cuatro años, donde volveremos a Costa Rica para levantar la energía sagrada en esta ceremonia.

Esta danza es un ritual ceremonial de búsqueda espiritual.

Es una ceremonia donde sabias abuelas han compartido enseñanzas ancestrales del camino rojo y códices aztecas decodificados a través de los tiempos. El trabajo de la danza, nos abre el corazón hacia la memoria antigua como mujeres sabias, intuitivas, guardianas de la medicina, guerreras, diosas, servidoras de la voluntad del gran espíritu y de la nueva conciencia de amor, armonía y paz para toda la humanidad.

La simbología comprende el honrar la energía femenina, la luna, los elementales, los ciclos de cambio y transformación, utilizando estas enseñanzas para reconectarnos.

La purificación o sacrificio (oficio de lo sagrado) comprende el ayuno, danzar toda la noche, temaxcales (ceremonia de sudor)  dos veces al día, la observación del ego, el silencio, el servicio y el rezo.

Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes:

 

Necesito recaudar los fondos antes del 11 de febrero para cubrir mi pasaje hasta Costa Rica y algo para gastos de la ceremonia como:

Traje Blanco Ceremonial

Hamaca

Poncho

Maraca

Mocasines

El costo aproximado de toda la travesía incluyendo pasaje, transportación, donaciones, y comidas luego de finalizar el ritual de la danza serán aproximádamente $800.

Mi meta para poder partir son $600.

Puedes ver las diferentes recompensas que hay para cada donante, pero recuerda siempre que no importa cual sea tu aportación es enórmemente agradecida y podrás enviarme aquella razón de importancia en tu vida por la cual deseas que eleve rezos por ti mientras esté danzando en Costa Rica.

Si no logro mi meta a tiempo y no puedo unirme a la Danza de la Luna este año, se guardaran los fondos obtenidos y continuare recaudando para unirme a esta danza sagrada en 2015. 

* De no lograr la meta las recompensas se otorgarían a mi regreso de el viaje en el 2015.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar:

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • Puedes ayudarme al difundir esta campaña usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
  • Puedes donar cualquiera de los artículos en lista.
  • Puedes ser apoyo desde donde estés enviando energía y orando por nuestro oficio de lo sagrado.
  • Cualquier aportación es agradecida con toda el alma.

“El bailarín del futuro será aquel cuyo cuerpo y alma hayan crecido tan armoniosamente juntos, que el lenguaje natural del alma se habrá convertido en el movimiento del cuerpo humano.


 El bailarín no pertenecerá entonces a nación alguna sino a la humanidad”

Isadora Duncan, bailarina, EE. UU

Paz y gratitud para todos los seres sintientes del planeta

story:
Short Summary

  • Dear readers, Dexter and Trooper were tied to a post through some of the area's worst winters. The only reason that the dachshunds survived, was because Dexter built them a nest in the snow. Trooper had two hurt back legs, and Dexter had frostbitten ears. Many of the boys' teeth were rotten and had to be extracted. They were starved and had small frames and little bony tails. Dexter's nose is scarred the whole way up his snout from burrowing into the ground for shelter. 
  • This campaign is important to me, an indie house, published author, because Trooper, Dexter's brother, is still receiving therapy for his back legs and is separated from us. Their story is unfinished, but together we can finish it. Trooper receives acupuncture and swim therapy (through the kindness of donors such as yourself) to help him get out of his wheelchair and back to using his back paws again. I want Dexter, who assists my disabled husband, to be his brother's own therapy dog and save Trooper for a second time. 
  • The other problem with rejoining the boys without your help: my husband has degenerative disc disease, and he will be receiving another operation soon. As you can imagine, the men in my life, by no fault of their own, need special care that is keeping us united but in separate homes. I am asking for your help today, the only way I know how, by using my talent, to back a product to completion. Not any product, but one that you can receive as a thank you with a larger perk below (hopefully soon). (Dexter will give you something for now, of course, while you are waiting). The book is half-written, but I want to write about the boys' recovery process. 
  • Don't you want to hear about their happy ending? Limited donors of fifty-dollars or more can receive the book if we reach our goal (small perks to come promptly-SEE "PERKS" SECTION IN SIDEBAR FOR MORE DETAILS). 
  • There is also great information in my book about rescuing a dog. The process, as you can read, has its ins and outs. The beginning of this book, thus far, is the Marley & Me of rescue dog stories, and it should not be missed! All agents and publishers willing to back the book are welcomed to contact me.
  • Someday, we will also sell the book at our area events (for those who miss out on the perks with smaller donations of under fifty). We will use the donations we receive now, to supplement our own monies to help with Trooper's adoption fees, medicines, treatments, and our bills (as supplement pay to working my day job, as a hairdresser). Any money, if there is any leftover, will go to editing and promoting the book. The book sales will hopefully keep life going a little smoother. We will receive most of whatever our funding is at the end, so please give what you can. Spreading the word about our campaign is a plus!

Will you rescue the rescuer a second time? 

Thanks for reading,

Cathy T. Colborn and family

Cathy T. Colborn is the author of Madame Lola's Marvelously Amazing Medicine Show, a steampunk adventure set in New Orleans. She is also the creator of Philly Flash Inferno, a literary journal, with the ongoing theme of the seven deadlies. Visit Cathytcolborn.blogspot.com for upcoming fundraising events and author appearances. 

Perks, Perks, and More Perks!

A twenty-five dollar donation will get you a 4X6 print of Dexter in his steampunk hat (*IRL), with his celebrity paw print on back. (limited number, see perks in sidebar)

A fifty-dollar donation will get you a 5X7 print of Dexter (*IRL) with his celebrity paw print on back (immediately upon payment clearing) and nonfiction book (upon completion--only if goals are reached). (limited number, see perks in sidebar)

A one-hundred dollar donation or more will get you a t-shirt, with the book campaign graphic (above), printed on the front (upon payment) and a book (upon completion--only if goals are reached). (limited number, see perks in sidebar)

*(IRL=In Real Life) No super graphics:)

The Impact

Backing this book may not make the biggest impact, but for those hero dogs, the impact will be massive! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the convenient Indiegogo share tools!

Take Care!
