story:
The Chrysalis is a late 2015 psychological horror book, published originally in Greek, by Editions Anatypo. Myself (the author) and Vaso (the illustrator) decided to bring it to a next level, by publishing an illustrated English edition.

It is a collection of intertwined first person narratives, forming a chrysalis as a space inside of which the next move is being planned. Surrounded by an environment both strange and hostile, yet still alluring due to our human will to live on, the human thinkers in these stories attempt to walk a line between what is real and what is hidden in dreams.

The sense of something "real", moreover, can seem to them as being another of the traps they so carefully try to neutralize...


All illustrations appearing in this campaign are samples of Vaso's work.



  • Our goal



The book we want to create is based on the original edition in Greek, now to be elegantly illustrated with Vaso's brooding work and translated to English.

(related urls; National writers database, Facebook Chrysalis page)


  • Info about the Chrysalis stories


The Chrysalis is a horror story collection, composed of twelve interconnected works.

The tales are about change, symbolized by the stage of metamorphosis inside a chrysalis. Metaphorically, the territory of alteration can also contain the vastness of an individual's inner world, and a motif in the stories is the unexpected - and often unnerving - manifestations of that internal Abyss that humans carry around- despite normally being oblivious as to its machinations.

A central theme of the work is the will- or need- to change, in order to survive. This personal will, however, can easily reveal just how little travelled is the environment ourselves- and the narrators of these stories- consider as their own; consider as known and easy to walk onto or form calculations about.

For example, in the most extensive story of the collection, titled "The Object of All Dreams", the main character attempts to better his impossibly dire financial condition and get away from a no-end work he maintains due to needing to pay the bills for his already spartan-like style of living. He aspires to present nothing short of a firework of a success, by presenting a mathematical proof concerning one of the unsolved problems, and consequently live off the considerable cash prize attached to that solution...!

In his opinion he is nearing the stage where he can make a breakthrough. But then he is met with a most unexpected obstacle.  One not of this world.


  • Bio notes



Author

My name is Kyriakos Chalkopoulos (Κυριάκος Χαλκόπουλος) and I live in the northern Greek city of Thessaloniki. My main interest is art, and in particular the more unsettling types of it. I graduated from the University of Essex, in the UK, with a degree in Philosophy, and I work as a seminar creator for the municipality of Thessaloniki. Along with London, Thessaloniki is the core environment of the stories in The Chrysalis.

I also organize and present programs on classical literature (Kafka, Borges, Gogol, De Maupassant, Poe and others) and lately present some courses on modeling and animating -using the open-source program Blender.

You can have a look at my page in the Greek Writers database, or visit my home-page for the Greek edition of The Chrysalis, on Facebook. You might even wish to see a couple of pics (from presentations of The Chrysalis, or my seminars in libraries) found in my Personal FB account.




Illustrator

The illustrator, and main associate of this project, is a very talented artist, Vaso, whose site you will likely love, and you should explore it at Vasodelirium. In the same page you will find links to her accounts at DeviantArt, Youtube, Facebook and other sites.

In her own words, her description follows:

"I'm a (mainly) traditional illustrator from Greece and am here to share my ideas with the world. I'm highly inspired by the natural world as well as fantastic zoology, mythology and fairytales. My dream house is a library or a lighthouse (heaven would be a mix of both!) and is placed in Ulthar. Always enjoy loosing myself in good comics and books with my sketchbook somewhere near to take notes or make doodles of my thoughts. I also enjoy leaving notes in my books and see them again every time i decide to re-read it. I respect every form of life, with a tiny bit more attraction to felines."

In her Facebook page you can find some more of her works, including works in progress and information about her current work as a graphic designer for Athens-based publishing houses and as a freelance illustrator...

Finally, I want to express my own admiration of Vaso. I can regard her as a friend, despite never -by now- having met her in person (we live in different cities... Thessaloniki and Athens). I do know that she likes my own work as well- she has read both The Chrysalis book and other works of mine- be sure to check the campaign's Gallery for more pieces of her wonderful creation...!

She deserves to become more known, despite already being a very respectable young artist!



  • A story from The Chrysalis





The following is the introductory chapter of the book, translated (placeholder translation) into English:


"Gray Walls"

"It was a noon during the middle of summer, which was of some importance given the hot Sun allowed the opportunity to the staff -and the patients- to have a walk at the great yard of the public mental health hospital. I arrived on time to meet with one of the doctors that I knew from days of old. The occasion for my visit was a distinction awarded to one of my stories. I had promised to read it to him personally, as I used to do in the past when we would get together.
My acquaintance, who worked there, gave me a tour of the areas comprising his office and also of those other ones open to the public, in the department which he has been administrating for a short while now. “All the walls here are gray” he said.
At some moment, as we were still in his spacious office, sat comfortably in our armchairs and having each lit a cigar, my acquaintance having just recalled something of significance told me that I have to see one more location.
I accepted, only was saddened a little that I should now rise from such a nice environment, and also have to extinguish my cigar, but soon we were in the corridors, and there we walked, him in front of me, and myself at the back.
For some time we marched in corridors which in equal distances were being separated by doors with diaphanous glass in their upper parts, whereas other doors to the sides of us- themselves not diaphanous- were leading to places unknown to me. At last we reached the end of the floor. He opened the final door- which also was not diaphanous and thus I had guessed that it would be the door to a single room and not one behind which there existed the continuation of the corridor- stood in front of it, told me to “please, go on”, and as I went inside the empty white room he closed the door abruptly and locked it...

Since that time I remain here. From the window I gaze at the yard, below, sometimes I shout but no one seems to listen to me. It has even happened that I would deem that one had heard- such a development perhaps not at all easy as those others were thirty meters below, but I yelled with all my power- a group of patients which must have belonged to the persons with mental disability raised their heads and seemed to look at me, and this in turn caused me to cry against my will...
I am thinking of the betrayal by that person. To have locked me here, where there exists nothing… Or rather at first I thought there existed nothing, since at some moment – I supposed that I was becoming crazy- I noticed a protrusion, white as well, on the floor, and I neared it so as to assure myself that it was merely a delusion. But it was not. It was a small white piece of chalk!

From that time I am looking at the chalk, and the walls, with horrible speculation. From that time I have moved away from the walls, stay at the window, holding the chalk in my hand as I stretch it outside towards the powerful Sun. Should I let this fall?

And a thought devours me. That the walls outside of this cell were all of one color. That if I neared, perhaps, the walls of the cell, if, against all hope, I dared scratch a bit onto them with my hand, the color of the used-up and existent everywhere chalk would diminish, and then I would be forced to watch more carefully, the endless series of letters on that wall, and then – how much do I fear it! – to find scribbled, between other ones, even this very story which I am now narrating to myself…".






  • An overview of the twelve parts of The Chrysalis and its original 162 pages


1) Gray Walls (the piece presented also in part #3 of this campaign!)

Gray Walls is geared to immediately create the sense that the book has a world of mirrors and facades, where not much can be certain to be deemed as what it may appear to be.

2) The Fault

This is a relatively large short story, dealing with a painter's strange fault, which makes him banished from Art School, and causes him to plot a way to return... The "fault" is about automatic and horrible movements by his hands while painting.

3) The Ceremony

A story about a dead body, and a low-rank police officer first on the scene, waiting for his superior to get specific orders. Or is it...?

4) Darkness

Possibly one of the bleakest (externally) pieces of the Chrysalis, Darkness is about a young student in England (more specifically The University of Essex), who develops a threatening fascination with a peer who has some horribly deformed body parts.

5) The Spider

The Spider is a story I wrote influenced by the eponymous movie (adapted from a British novel), starring Ralph Fiennes. However, in this Spider story, the protagonist is trying to commit suicide. A sinister web appears as a direct result of that decision.

6) The Object of All Dreams

The largest piece of this collection, and briefly described in this campaign already. It is a story about the world of Dreams, and the Abyss which opens in them. The story has a passage by ancient philosopher Empedocles as accompanying the title, however it could also be prefaced by Heraclitos of Ephesos apofthegm, according to which "Most people forget all about thoughts they have when awake, much like they forget all about what they do or think in their dreams"...

7) At the top floor

A second story taking place in England, and the University I studied in. Actually, this is the only purely autobiographical piece of this collection. About a very dangerous progression of events, concerning my views about the very strange and potentially dangerous system of perpetually moving elevators of the 5-level Library of this University! Being 18 can be very bad for one's health! :)

8) The ultimate veil to be lifted

A quite large story focused on an imposing building in the city center, and the will of a student to get inside and witness if he was correct in imagining it features an internal garden. Also deals with painting, and the human form.

9) The Singular Attempt

One of the shortest pieces of the collection (larger only than the Gray Walls). This is a tale about being trapped in a deep well, or some similar empty pit surrounded by four walls, a metallic ladder, and a locked door.

10) The Chrysalis

The piece which gives this book its title, and one of the largest ones in the collection. Also one of the darkest-toned ones, despite hope co-existing with the first pages (which can indeed be termed as very saddening). The story starts in a hospital's bed, where the narrator tries to examine- without being able to do so directly- if he suffered as much harm as he feared he had, and mumbles about "the surgical operation".

11) The Landmine

The second largest of the stories. A series of police investigations triggered by the gruesome remain of a young person, found in one of his apartment's rooms. Apparently the dead figure had once believed that there existed some kind of landmine in the city, one which he might run a real risk of running into, while preparing to leave to a far-away location (or even a different dimension altogether?)

12) The Untravelled

The final story of The Chrysalis, it is one written down as the notes in real time of a man spending time in the luxurious house of an old friend. At some time, though, he discovers that he cannot get out...







  • What you get for helping/perks




The nine perks are named after parts of ancient Greek philosophy... They are of three main categories: digital and physical commemorative artworks (three levels), inclusion of your name in the thank you lists of the published book, and physical copies of the books.

-Two perks involve receiving pre-published stories of The Chrysalis, in digital form

-A special perk involves choosing an added language for some of the stories, to be printed alongside the rest.

-The Diogenes perk is one which is included in some later perks, but not all!

The entire list of perks, with detailed description for each, is available to the right of the screen!

I am sure that Vaso and myself will have loads of fun with the feedback generated by sent perks... Already looking forward to that!





  • Where/how financial support will be spent & plan for release of the end result!


List of costs

a) Pay of a Native English speaker, professional translator, who will be translating the 12 stories plus any bonus pieces

b) Costs of physical objects given (card and poster artwork, copies of the original book and of the Illustrated new version, shipping costs)

c) Paying for book as well as perk-tied illustration work by Vaso

d) Any funding asked by the Publishers, to allow for physical copies of the illustrated Chrysalis in English, initially of up to 200 physical copies

e) Unexpected other costs, shipping costs and campaign fees


Analysis

a) The original book has 162 pages, and the new edition shall have roughly 200 pages. Translating to English will cost around 1000 Euros (1130 US Dollars), depending on level of expertise of the English translator. It may be a little below or above that amount.

b) Each original physical copy of The Chrysalis has a market price of 13 euros, set by the Publishing House. While negotiating a better price in case of bulk shipping is realistic, this still means that (for example) 40 copies would cost at least 500 US Dollars. In general, any larger quantity (more use of that perk or perks past it) can stabilize the cost at that amount, so I think it can be roughly estimated here as being in the region of 500 US Dollars.

c) For the entirety of her work, Vaso has agreed to a fixed pay of 1200 euros (1370 US Dollars) in the case of a fully funded campaign ($5.000 or more raised). Important note - despite being a bit gloomy!: In the (hopefully only theoretical) case the campaign is not funded nearly as much as to reach the region of $5.000, there is a larger flexibility with Vaso's pay, and we both still are fully resolved to ship any perks promised (apart from any involving electronic or physical copies of the New Chrysalis book, cause it would not materialize at that point).

d) The creation (print) of 200 physical copies of The illustrated Chrysalis book will require a co-funding of the project, on my part, in the region of 600-1000 euros. More crucially, due to the bilingual version's difficulty in the local market itself, thus being more of a risk to the publishers. The final price may be a little less than that, depending on the campaign's development, yet it is a realistic estimate... So, if it is roughly 1100 euros/ 1130 US Dollars.

e) Around 800-900 US Dollars reserved for any unexpected costs for translating, shipping costs for the perks, and campaign fees.

This also makes provisions for myself of not over-extending financially while still focused primarily on this important project- which, indeed, for myself is a very considerable step...: Regardless of how a book does as an example of use of its own language, it is very true that the spread of ideas or of art only happens through the lingua franca of any time, being primarily English in the case of our own times.


  • You turn around, towards your own world again, but take with you our thank you note!



Ending notes, thank you for your support!!!


Thank you so much for being interested in our campaign! We look forward to making this project, and are hopeful it shall be of a very high standard...

We wish, in ending this presentation, to draw your attention again to the fact that both myself and Vaso shall do our best to send all perks not including the copies of the English edition, even if the asked amount ($5K) is not reached. We also mean to keep in touch, and look forward to any of your questions or messages! You can also contact me at FB if you wish...


Finally, we want to ask that even if you cannot support this project financially, you can mention it to others, and help spread the word!

The Chrysalis is a late 2015 psychological horror book, published originally in Greek, by Editions Anatypo. Myself (the author) and Vaso (the illustrator) decided to bring it to a next level, by publishing an illustrated English edition.
It is a collection of intertwined first person narratives, forming a chrysalis as a space inside of which the next move is being planned. Surrounded by an environment both strange and hostile, yet still alluring due to our human will to live on, the human thinkers in these stories attempt to walk a line between what is real and what is hidden in dreams.
The sense of something "real", moreover, can seem to them as being another of the traps they so carefully try to neutralize...

All illustrations appearing in this campaign are samples of Vaso's work.







Our goal






The book we want to create is based on the original edition in Greek, now to be elegantly illustrated with Vaso's brooding work and translated to English.
(related urls; National writers database, Facebook Chrysalis page)

Info about the Chrysalis stories

The Chrysalis is a horror story collection, composed of twelve interconnected works.



The tales are about change, symbolized by the stage of metamorphosis inside a chrysalis. Metaphorically, the territory of alteration can also contain the vastness of an individual's inner world, and a motif in the stories is the unexpected - and often unnerving - manifestations of that internal Abyss that humans carry around- despite normally being oblivious as to its machinations.


A central theme of the work is the will- or need- to change, in order to survive. This personal will, however, can easily reveal just how little travelled is the environment ourselves- and the narrators of these stories- consider as their own; consider as known and easy to walk onto or form calculations about.

story:
My indiegogo.com fundraising campaign has come to an end!  I fell short of my "dream" goal of $8000, so I will be self-publishing Headed to Happy.  

Sincere thanks to each of you who showed me support, kept me motivated and even pre-ordered the book by making contributions to this campaign.  I appreciate your friendship and I will remain eternally grateful to you.

Big hug from me to you!

Your friend, 

~Kathie

________________________________________________

Like me on Facebook!
facebook.com/TheRealKathieStonehouse

________________________________________________

Hello Friend! 

Thank you for taking an interest in my book!

 

It's called "Headed to Happy" and was inspired by the friendships I have made on facebook with thousands of people all over the world. Every morning for over two years I have used my status updates to post positive and encouraging messages on my page.  Because of that, I have gained a following of over 14,000 people. (Pretty cool, right?!)

 

Many of my facebook friends write to me daily asking for advice or words of encouragement to help them through their day, so I thought it was time to put my thoughts into a book. 

 

"Headed to Happy" is an inspirational collection of some of my favorite quotes that I've posted, the stories that lead me to write them and advice from the wisdom I have gained along the way.  (My favorites are the stories that were inspired by my reactions to other people's status messages!)  These messages are designed to help as a guide for anyone wishing to set out on their own personal journey to Happy.

 

The Impact

   

Publishing this book would mean the world to me.  It would be so great to see my efforts enjoyed and appreciated by people in real life, not just online! It will also be a beautiful gift to keep for yourself or give to a loved one. *smile* 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I want the book to be beautiful inside and out.  I want it to be something I am proud to say that I created and that you would be proud to own.  I set my financial goal at $8,000 which will allow me to have the book professionally designed, edited and printed.  If I fall short of that goal, I will go ahead and self-publish the book anyway, but it might not look quite as great! LOL!)

 

This website (IndieGoGo.com) allows you to contribute any amount that you'd like to help me reach my goal, and every little bit helps!!!  But, everyone contributing $25 or more will receive a copy of the book. *Hooray!*

 

(If there are some angels out there I will be able to raise enough money to launch a multi-city book tour...that would be my ultimate dream come true!) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help spread the word by using the "share" buttons underneath the video! It will post this project onto your facebook page, and/or send a tweet from your Twitter account!  And, I will be forever grateful to you...

Ok, who's with me?  I'm Headed to Happy!  Let's go!

story:
Help me publish "Growing Up Alaska"!

Thank you so much for your time! My name is Niki Breeser Tschirgi and I lived in Tok, Alaska from 1982-1992. I am a stay-at-home mom of six (yes six adopted kids). That's another book for another time. I have always wanted to publish so to be doing this right here right now feels pretty amazing. I've been writing since the 7th grade and even studied creative writing in college. I've had personal blogs over the years mostly sharing about real life issues. My most recent one is available to read at SpokandyLand.com. I also wrote for an on-line magazine called Blindigo while living in Houston. Currently, I have a Facebook page called “Growing Up Alaska”. You should check it out!

Actually, my Facebook page is what encouraged me to publish my book. Over the months of writing stories about my childhood and posting old pictures I found that a lot of people connected with my writing and was encouraged to take the steps to publish my blog. So here I am. I can’t do this project alone so I am asking for help from my friends, family and whoever thinks this is a worthy project to support! My plan for the money raised is to help offset the cost of publishing, printing, postage, merchandise, etc. It will also help me get up to Alaska in the summer of 2015 for an official book release in the place where this all started…Tok.

What I Need & What You Get

I've got some pretty great perks for those who can donate! I'm kind of looking at this as a presale for my book. There are different levels of giving that earn you perks! Donate $1.00 and get a personal shout out on my “Growing up Alaska” Facebook page. Donate $10.00 and get a “Growing Up Alaska” car decal. Donate $25.00 and get a car decal and a book when it is published or donate $50.00 and get a signed book from me! The list goes on but I will have limited edition hoodies (Alaska state flag colors) ONLY for this crowd fund. I’ve lined up some cool business donations, too!  If you are feeling especially generous, you can have dinner with me in Tok (sorry you have to get there!) and a printed “thank you” in my book!

I’m hoping to reach my goal of $10,000 but if I don’t, funds will go first to publishing and fulfilling my perks. So, whatever I make I am pouring into the process of getting my book out there and printed and getting you the perks you signed up for!

The Impact

The feedback I have gotten from my Facebook page has been encouraging. So many of you out there have appreciated the nostalgia, the encouragement and the connection with growing up in Alaska. This book hopefully takes you back and helps you remember...even if you never were an Alaskan. Yes, it's a book. But so far it has been a subject that seems to have touched many people and made real connections with real people. You can help with that connection. Some of the comments from Facebook users have been “I've always wanted to visit Alaska, now you are giving me more reasons to come see.” And “You should write a book with all of these wonderful stories you share. It would be a book I would enjoy reading.”

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, hey, that's okay! There are other ways to support me. You can help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign by sharing it on your favorite social media sites. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools to make it super easy. You sharing my campaign is just as important as monetary donations and I appreciate any and all support.

Maybe you are a business owner or an artist who would be willing to donate an item or a service as a perk during my crowd fund. That would be a great help too. Everything matters. Everything counts.

So thank you. Thank you again for helping this stay-at-home mom make something pretty special happen. I know that if we work together we can make this dream of mine a reality and you can be a part of making something happen.

So...here's to helping make something happen...here's to publishing Growing Up Alaska.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I am Mark Tremblay, a registered patent attorney. I’ve worked on patents from smart phones to paper making equipment, lightning protection systems to bar code readers, wind generators to smart card systems:far, far too many technologies to list here! I really love learning how all these new technologies work!

However, throughout my career, I have seen systemic problems within the patent system that keep it from being optimal. Our patent system often hampers rather than promotes emerging technologies. Unfortunately, the problems within the patent system run deep, and typify problems permeating our entire political system.

I have suspended my work in patents to tackle the root problems in politics. I have created a plan for a solution I call the IParty Democrats.  Below is a short summary of the IParty. If you would like to see more videos, download audio files, or see a complete outline of the IParty plan, please visit the IParty Website. Links to IParty videos are found at the "website" link below.

The IParty creates an adjunct party within the Democratic party, to avoid dividing the Democratic party vote and throwing general elections to Republicans opposed IParty positions. The IParty joins elements of the Libertarian, Progressive, and Green wings of the Democratic party to form a voting bloc capable of winning primary elections. The IParty will seek to field candidates in all state and federal elections, including areas conceded by the Democrats.

The IParty structures itself as three democratic republics within three distinct organizations to exemplify the reforms desired in other parts of society. The IParty will fight to reform government and corporate structures by adding internal democratic, representative and constitutional elements. The IParty will champion individual liberties by working towards a constitutional convention to restore the eroded Bill of Rights, and enumerate additional rights. The IParty will seek to increase economic equality by reforming corporate structures, for example by adding members of corporate boards elected by employees, and reforming the distribution of stock options. The IParty will work towards improving our system of producing energy to mitigate environmental problems and to create jobs in the U.S. Finally, the IParty will live by a set of core principles to create a recognized brand trusted by voters.

Videos in the Indiegogo gallery for this campaign explain why the IParty is not an independent political party, why the IParty Super PAC is first for fundraising, and provide an overview of the IParty strategy and structure.

The IParty funding goal for this drive is very low; this is the minimum amount that will prevent the campaign from folding immediately. It is hoped that substantially more is raised to begin serious political activities.

Perks: 

  First, the greatest perk of donating to a worthy cause is the most genuine happiness money can buy. This is just plain old science. http://news.stanford.edu/news/2014/april/giving....

* When you give to the IParty, you are creating a social organization that you will participate in, and hopefully, meet new people. So this is a huge perk towards your personal happiness. http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/08/22/happin.... Wouldn’t you like to volunteer at an IParty function, and meet people working towards the same cause?  Wouldn’t you like to organize an IParty event to raise awareness of the IParty? http://i-party.us/iparty-front/strategies-metho...

  The IParty Democrats is a political organization whose power derives from the people joining the IParty, and from a firm commitment to democracy. Granting special favors and access to donors is basically antithetical to IParty principles. Just because someone donates money doesn’t mean they should get to set policy more than another person who donated less money. Democracy means democracy. See http://i-party.us/iparty-front/strategies-metho....

User names and e-mail accounts on the i-party.us and/or ipartydemocrats.net domains will be chosen according to who donates first. If you donate early enough, you may be able to choose a user name like “me” with an e-mail account like “me@ipartydemocrats.net”. Donors should record the time and date of their pledge to help determine their seniority in the IParty. The IParty will vote on whether to use seniority as a basis for weighting votes on issues. See http://i-party.us/iparty-front/strategies-metho...

 People who donate over $50 in this Indiegogo campaign cannot be annonymous, by law. Because your contributions are going to a political action committee, we must make best efforts to collect your name, address, occupation, and employer to supply this information to the Federal Election Commission. Please supply this information with your contribution as part of the shipping address, or e-mail the information to: contributions@i-party.us.  In order to contribute, all of the following statements must be true about you:

  • I am a United States citizen or a permanent resident alien.
  • This contribution is made from my own funds, and funds are not being provided to me by another person or entity for the purpose of making this contribution.
  • I am making this contribution with my own personal credit card and not with a corporate or business credit card or a card issued to another person.
  • I am at least eighteen years old.
  • I am not a foreign national (permanent resident aliens excepted), federal contractor, national bank, or corporation chartered by an act of Congress.

story:
In a Nutshell

If you've taken the time to stop by, you know that I moved to Chicago to study at The Second City and begin my acting career. The past year of study at this legendary training center has been absolutely everything I imagined and more, but God has been working in my life in ways I never would have expected. He used Second City to draw me here, but it didn't take long for me to realize that it was Soul City he had waiting for me once I arrived.

Soul City Church exists to lead people into a transforming relationship with Jesus, and after a year of being a part of this amazing community of people I have seen and been a recipient of this powerful transformation that is happening in this city. Words cannot describe how grateful I am to God for placing me amongst this incredibly faithful and talented group of people that is Soul City Church.

As if the blessing of being a part of such an amazing community wasn't enough, God chose to bless me with the opportunity to take part in Soul City's Leadership Intensive this summer. So that's what this campaign is all about! It has been my prayer that God would provide a way for me to devote my full attention to this Leadership Intensive so that I can receive everything God has in store for me there, and the area that is currently proving to be an obstacle is my finances.

Over the next 3 months, I will be working alongside and learning from some of the top leaders in the country, and by contributing to my campaign you will be a very real answer to a big prayer of mine! The ability to fully devote myself to what God is doing through this Intensive is something that will create an incredible amount of room for transformation and growth in my life that will then equip me to better understand just how I can best glorify God!

What's in it for Me & What's in it for You

$3,800 is a ridiculous amount of money! And because I'm asking you to contribute to this incredible number, I want you to know where your money will be going! Soul City has been very generous in providing a stipend to each of the proteges that will help with  some expenses, but it's not quite enough to meet the cost of living in Chicago. So here's a run down of the money:

  • $2,100- miscellaneous expenses: phone, internet, utilities, food, etc.
  • $1,000- security deposit and first month's rent for new apartment. My current lease is up August 31, and I'll need these funds for the costs involved with getting into a new place.
  • $380- giving. I'm trusting God to provide for me in ways that are absurd to me, and I want to make sure I'm giving back to him because he is good!
  • $320- Indiegogo keeps that. I love that this service exists, but unfortunately it's not free. The site will keep a portion of the monies raised.

I also want to give back to you! There will be perks for each level of giving! If you look to the right side of the window, you should see the different levels and what you can expect!

And just so you're aware, if my "Only God" goal of $3,800 isn't reached by the end date set at June 30, your contributions will still be very much appreciated and well stewarded. God is faithful.

The Impact

I'm so excited for what's happening this summer, and I want you to know what I'll be doing! So here's a little snapshot of what my life will consist of within this Leadership Intensive.

Each of the six Proteges (pictured above) have certain areas of ministry that will be his/her focus. Mine is, probably not a surprise to you, Student Ministry! One of the most exciting yet challenging aspects about the student ministry at Soul City is...there really isn't one. We currently have an incredible middle school small group that meets weekly, but it's on a small scale. And now we have the opportunity to really listen to God for what he has in mind for a full student ministry and how we can best make it happen!

Part of my role this summer will be to help develop a launch strategy for our student ministry, and I am so pumped about how God is going to be moving to make this ministry something exciting and different! I get a little emotional thinking about the ways in which Jesus will be impacting and transforming these students' lives in and through Soul City Students. This ministry is only going to add more and more "Only God" moments to what Soul City is already witnessing!

Other Ways You Can Help

It is my hope that you will be able to help out finacially, but another really big way you can help is to simply pray for me! Pray that God will provide and that I will trust in his faithfulness in the process. Pray that God will be moving in my life this summer as I learn to lean on him and to lead and love people well. Pray that God will be moving through Soul City Church to be a light to this city, and that he would open doors that need to be opened and shut those that need to be shut.

Another big way you can help is to share this campaign with others! Definitely share it with people who know who I am, but if you happen to know people who simply find joy in giving or praying feel free to share it with them as well!

Indiegogo has sharing tools for different social medias and such, but you can also copy and paste the link wherever you like.

So with that, I'll leave the rest up to God! Thank you so much for all your support!

The ability to fully devote myself to what God is doing through this Intensive is something that will create an incredible amount of room for transformation and growth in my life that will then equip me to better understand just how I can best glorify God!


What's in it for Me & What's in it for You
$3,800 is a ridiculous amount of money! And because I'm asking you to contribute to this incredible number, I want you to know where your money will be going! Soul City has been very generous in providing a stipend to each of the proteges that will help with  some expenses, but it's not quite enough to meet the cost of living in Chicago. So here's a run down of the money:

$2,100- miscellaneous expenses: phone, internet, utilities, food, etc.
$1,000- security deposit and first month's rent for new apartment. My current lease is up August 31, and I'll need these funds for the costs involved with getting into a new place.
$380- giving. I'm trusting God to provide for me in ways that are absurd to me, and I want to make sure I'm giving back to him because he is good!
$320- Indiegogo keeps that. I love that this service exists, but unfortunately it's not free. The site will keep a portion of the monies raised.

I also want to give back to you! There will be perks for each level of giving! If you look to the right side of the window, you should see the different levels and what you can expect!
And just so you're aware, if my "Only God" goal of $3,800 isn't reached by the end date set at June 30, your contributions will still be very much appreciated and well stewarded. God is faithful.


The Impact
I'm so excited for what's happening this summer, and I want you to know what I'll be doing! So here's a little snapshot of what my life will consist of within this Leadership Intensive.
Each of the six Proteges (pictured above) have certain areas of ministry that will be his/her focus. Mine is, probably not a surprise to you, Student Ministry! One of the most exciting yet challenging aspects about the student ministry at Soul City is...there really isn't one. We currently have an incredible middle school small group that meets weekly, but it's on a small scale. And now we have the opportunity to really listen to God for what he has in mind for a full student ministry and how we can best make it happen!
Part of my role this summer will be to help develop a launch strategy for our student ministry, and I am so pumped about how God is going to be moving to make this ministry something exciting and different! I get a little emotional thinking about the ways in which Jesus will be impacting and transforming these students' lives in and through Soul City Students. This ministry is only going to add more and more "Only God" moments to what Soul City is already witnessing!
Other Ways You Can Help


It is my hope that you will be able to help out finacially, but another really big way you can help is to simply pray for me! Pray that God will provide and that I will trust in his faithfulness in the process. Pray that God will be moving in my life this summer as I learn to lean on him and to lead and love people well. Pray that God will be moving through Soul City Church to be a light to this city, and that he would open doors that need to be opened and shut those that need to be shut.
Another big way you can help is to share this campaign with others! Definitely share it with people who know who I am, but if you happen to know people who simply find joy in giving or praying feel free to share it with them as well!
Indiegogo has sharing tools for different social medias and such, but you can also copy and paste the link wherever you like.
So with that, I'll leave the rest up to God! Thank you so much for all your support!

story:
Summary:

My name is Malcolm J. Brenner, and I'm the author of the 2010 novel "Wet Goddess: Recollections Of A Dolphin Lover."  Before that, I worked for 20 years as a reporter, winning numerous awards.  Now I'm raising money to self-publish an important book about my childhood struggle in a weird, pseudoscientific cult.

"Growing Up In The Orgone Box: Secrets Of A Reichian Childhood" is a 335-page memoir of the excruciating torture I suffered in therapy with Dr. Albert Duvall, a trusted compatriot of Dr. Wilhelm Reich.  Reich was the 20th Century's maddest "mad scientist," a psychiatrist who reduced all of human psychology to the orgasm, and who claimed to have discovered "orgone energy," a cosmic life-force which only he and his trusted band of followers could detect, measure and control.

What Reich didn't know, or refused to see, was that his buddy Duvall was a sadistic serial pedophile who molested hundreds of pediatric patients in the name of giving them better orgasms!  I know, because I've contacted many of them, and we all share pretty much the same sad story.  Needless to say, "orgone therapy" was all crap back in the 1950's and it remains crap to this day. Reich died in prison in 1957, but he still has many devotees.

Indiegogo has requested a disclaimer: this book contains adult content, that is, vulgar language and graphic descriptions of sexual acts such as sodomy, fellatio, masturbation and bestiality.  If this material offends you, there are many other worthy campaigns out there.

Your contribution to my Indiegogo campaign will help me self-publish "Orgone Box," as I have been unable to find an interested publisher, or an agent to represent me.  

What I Need & What You Get:

I have written, illustrated and done the page layout for "Orgone Box" myself. A talented graphic artist has designed the cover.  I use a local printer, who does good work and gives me a great deal.  I need $1,000 to pay for the first print run of 100 copies, which will cost $750, and to pay the artist $250 for the cover.

For each $25 you contribute from the US or $50 from overseas, you will get as your perk an autographed trade paperback copy of "Orgone Box" directly from me.  It's that simple.  Any and all funds raised will go to printing costs, then to the cover artist. If donations exceed my request I will print and ship more copies. 

The Impact:

"Growing Up In The Orgone Box" will expose Duvall for a pervert and Reich for the pseudoscientist he was.  Pseudoscience can drive out good science, because it tells us what we want to believe instead of telling us the truth about our world.  It happened to me, and I am convinced Reich's bogus "orgone therapy" also destroyed my family by making my parents' psychological problems worse instead of better.

I have a great track record.  "Wet Goddess," my 2010 autobiographical novel about a human-dolphin love affair, has sold 950+ copies in 17 countries around the world.  People in the publishing industry tell me this is astonishing for a self-published, self-promoted book with no major publisher behind it and no advertising budget.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you can't contribute, you can help spread the word.  Talk about my book to your friends, your enemies, anyone you know who might be interested!  Discuss it on social media, your blog or in forums.  And be sure to use Indiegogo's share tools to pass the word on.

Thanks in advance for your contribution, whatever it may be!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! 
Dear loved ones, friends, supporters, acquaintances, family & fellows,

We're the Art Amok Slam Team, representing North Georgia, Atlanta and Columbus and our communities. We're trying very hard to get to Oakland California to the National Poetry Slam in the first week of August, which is now only 2 weeks away. We are Stephanie Morey, Jonathan Samuel Eddie, Gabe Moses, Chiara Richardson, Shyla Hardwick and Karen G.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a little push up into the air! 

*Your donation will help fly 5 slam team members from Atlanta to Oakland
*Lodging for the whole team
*Peanut butter & jelly sandwiches, apples and Luna bars

Why are we asking?

Team members traveled with Brave New Voices to support  and invest in youthful poetry voices and the future of artistic expression. One team member was robbed recently and another a cancelled theater production, which were counted on for revenue. We are, admittedly, just shy of our goal in representing Georgia open mic voices on a national level.
However, in return for your tip in the collection plate, we will write poems for you, send you personalized letters, give you writing exercises,listening material, and books to read!
(If you are local and truly blessed, a massage might even be in it for you).

Our mission is to represent under-represented voices on a national level and also, to bring unique voices we find  and lessons learned at workshops, back to our local regulars and communities. Sponsoring our travels will come back to our venues in more promotion and advancement of art development locally and regionally.

We believe that we grow with travel and bring lessons back to share every time we go out. 

We all lead workshops, some of us with youth. We carry everyone's inspiration with us on the trip out, and on the trip back, we bring lessons we've learned and connections we've made back to our roots.

Every year, we rise to the challenge and return invigorated and ready to share. We realize we can't do it with out you. We are all working artists and all in this together!
This is our rushing the stage in a last bit of breeze to get under our wings.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We realize that times are tough and that other artists and teams of poets are also raising funds. Activists are campaigning for positive change. Friends are trying to get out from under medical bills. Every cause is a worthy one and a little goes a long way to each.
    People can also support each other by sharing all these necessary campaigns on social media and in emails and we encourage that in substitution of giving.

    We appreciate contributions for any team member. They can include gift cards at Starbucks, Subway, Trader Joe's, etc.They can include hugs and prayers, good vibes, and loving thoughts.

story:
Who, What, Why, Where?

The Missing Slate is the byproduct of a partnership between a logophilic Editor-in-Chief (Maryam Piracha), and an aesthetic Creative Director (Moeed Tariq). Founded in Islamabad, Pakistan in 2010, the journal aims to promote freedom of speech and creative expression worldwide. As idealistic as it sounds, we believe in the power of the creative arts in uniting a fragmented world as our multinational, multicultural team bears witness to. In the last four years alone, we've published the work of countless poets and writers from over 50 countries, who have, after being discovered by the magazine, been anthologized with publishing houses, and spoken at various literature panels and festivals. 

In February 2014, we started a series of creative writing workshops in Islamabad and Dubai, soon to be expanded to other cities and online. We've published twelve digital quarterly issues like clockwork, published translations from 13 (and counting) languages, and successfully held two writing competitions — a Hallowe'en Horror Writing Contest in October 2013 (for both fiction and poetry) and a New Voices Fiction Writing Contest in April 2014 with a prize that increased with each submission, beginning at $150 and going on to $500.

In May 2014, we started a series of podcasts on film, TV and important literary and social issues and then, in June, organized the massively popular Poetry World Cup (PWC) in parallel to the FIFA World Cup that saw poems from 32 countries go head-to-head in a knockout competition. Winners were decided by readers' votes (goals), resulting in a single winning poem. The PWC was covered in a number of international newspapers and incited an ongoing multicultural conversation. Our 12th issue published on June 15 was read and downloaded over 44,000 times in the first 10 days of its release.
 

What comes next?

We're so glad you asked. We've been fortunate to provide a platform, a home, for writers that might not fit anywhere else, but there's still so much we aim to achieve. Your funds will go towards the publication of our first glossy annual edition, culling the best of what we've published in 2014 (and later in 2015), as well as featuring a few select pieces exclusive to the anthology. 

Our planned print anthology will help bring literary, artistic and cinematic talents into the limelight. In addition, your funds will go towards more writing contests (we've held two, including one with a cash prize where we split our earnings with the winner), launching the magazine at multiple literature festivals, and increased focus on film and music. With your funds, we intend to do all this and to, at long last, financially remunerate our endlessly talented contributors. 

(Special credit to Lullatone for the music featured in our video. Check them out on Bandcamp!)

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $16,500 — it sounds like a lot, so we'll break down exactly what it will go towards.

  • Printing our anthology for two years.
  • Setting up and launching the anthology and the magazine at three festivals for two years (3x2).
  • An annual writing competition with a $750 cash prize.
  • Our first annual poetry competition with a $750 cash prize.
  • Our first annual short film competition with a $500 cash prize.
  • Set up an online distribution and subscription model for the magazine.
  • Fund / co-fund a writers' residency program (a long-term goal for further down the line)

As for what you get (besides our eternal gratitude and the warm, smooshy feeling that comes from supporting the arts), we're offering signed wall posters (11 x 14 in) of our gorgeous magazine issue covers from some of the world's best emerging artists, exclusive The Missing Slate canvas bags emblazoned with snippets from our issues, postcard packs of original artwork we've published, personalized recommendations from our staff with free e-books and audiobooks, personalized caricatures and a special piece from our featured artists — Mohsin Shafi, Maria Khan, Amra Khan and Sarah Mumtaz (usually priced anywhere from PKR 25,000 to PKR 50,000). Finally, you'll get a free copy of the anthology. You will also receive personal handwritten notes from the staff and be acknowledged as a donor both in the anthology and in a special section of our website.

Below, you'll find the three issue cover posters we're including in our perks.

   

                                 

Why Support The Missing Slate?

To put it simply: because there is no other magazine doing the work that we are with as much respect to the process of creation. 

Support us because we breathe freedom of speech and expression in a society that is not often known for these traits. Support us because we are actively striving to present the best in new and emerging writers and artists, breaking past the confines of geography to do it. Support us because you're awesome and see something in us, too.

Below you'll find some of the additional perks, including canvas bags and artwork postcards. The postcards are printed on high quality cards that you can choose to frame and use as artwork. They look fantastic hung on a wall!

Our special series of artwork postcards...


Strapped for Cash? You Can Still Help.

If you can't contribute but you're passionate about our cause, don't worry. You can still support us by:

  • Asking your family and friends (and their friends, and so on) to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Spread the word through Indiegogo's snazzy share tools!
  • Read and share as much of our wonderful content as possible, and help our readership grow.

We've made it this far based solely on the loyalty of our supporters and readers.  Whichever way you choose to support us, we thank you... and we look forward to keeping you entertained and informed in our (hopefully less shoestring-budgeted) future!

P.S. If you don't have a credit card, debit cards work too :)

P.P.S Below, you'll find The Missing Slate's senior editors from every corner of the world. Top Row L-R: Maryam Piracha, Moeed Tariq, Hassan Sagheer, Maria Amir, all from Pakistan; Second Row L-R: Jacob Silkstone (Norway), Aaron Grierson (Canada), Camille Ralphs (UK), Mahnoor Yawar (UAE); Third Row L-R: Ghausia Rashid Salam (Pakistan), Maliha Iftekhar (UK), Sana Hussain (Pakistan), and Tom Nixon (UK). The only reason every staff member's not here, is because we're 30 strong! Find out more about us here.

story:
Featured photo: Yogini Keri-Anne Telford in artist Chris Burden's "Urban Light" installation at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (c. Sarit Z. Rogers 2012).

 

Yoga Ph.D.: Path-Breaking Yoga Writing & Photography

Carol Horton, Ph.D., served as editor (with Roseanne Harvey) of 21st Century Yoga: Culture, Politics, and Practice. Sarit Z. Rogers shot the stunning photographs that grace the book's cover and website. Now, Carol and Sarit have teamed up again to bring you another cutting-edge yoga book - Yoga Ph.D.: Integrating the Life of the Mind and the Wisdom of the Body - and series of yoga photographs. They're asking for your help to cover the costs of publishing the book and producing the photographs as art prints.

 

Here's the scoop on the book and the photography:

 

Yoga Ph.D.: Integrating the Life of the Mind and the Wisdom of the Body

Yoga Ph.D. explores contemporary yoga from the unique perspective of a political science professor-turned-yoga teacher. Like most Americans, Carol Horton started studying yoga in search of nothing more than stretching and stress relief. Over time, however, yoga revealed itself to be a powerful yet subtle tool for exploring her body, mind, and the connections between them in ways she’d never previously imagined possible. This caused her to wonder: What is yoga, really? Where did it come from? Why has it become so popular? And what does it offer us, as individuals and a society?

In Yoga Ph.D., Carol integrates her diverse experiences as yoga practitioner and social scientist to provide provocative answers to these questions. Contemporary yoga, she notes, is a paradoxically multidimensional practice, pursued for everything from physical fitness to spiritual transformation – simultaneously commercial and mystical, recreational and therapeutic, scientific and esoteric. To make sense of such incongruities, Carol synthesizes personal reflections on her own practice with a research-based analysis of yoga as a sociocultural phenomenon. The result is a book that breaks new ground by offering a sympathetic yet critical analysis of the promise and pitfalls of American yoga.

Cutting-Edge Yoga Photography: Gritty, Inspiring & Real

Sarit Rogers creates a photographic style that not only celebrates her subjects as the they are, but allows viewers to look at the world in a different, more realistic way. A yogi herself, she is dismayed by the pastel world of yoga photography, finding herself perpetually uninspired. When Sarit was contacted about  photographing the cover of 21st Century Yoga, a floodgate of creativity opened. She was in her element, shooting something she loves, while supporting a practice that nourishes her recovery and soothes her mind. These images gave her the opportunity to create something authentic and tangible for anyone and everyone, regardless of their age, weight, gender, or race. 

Sarit's work for Yoga Ph.D. and 21st Century Yoga is a labor of love. She hopes this campaign will provide her with some of the financial support she needs to offset the creation of these shoots while also allowing her to purchase some new lights that will add to her versatility as a photographer. It would be wonderful to be able to take her shoots into more exotic places with more variable lighting situations that may be lacking in grounded sources of electricity.

 

About the Author and Photographer

Carol Horton, Ph.D., holds a doctorate in Political Science from the University of Chicago. She served on the faculty at Macalester College, and has extensive experience as a research consultant specializing in issues affecting low-income children and families. A Certified Forrest Yoga teacher, Carol teaches yoga to women in Chicago’s Cook County Jail with Yoga for Recovery. She is the author of Race and the Making of American Liberalism (Oxford University Press, 2005), and co-editor (with Roseanne Harvey) of 21st Century Yoga: Culture, Politics, and Practice (Kleio Books, 2012). Carol blogs about yoga and mindfulness at Think Body Electric and elephant journal.

Sarit Z. Rogers is a Los Angeles based photographer specializing in fine-art portraiture, creative commercial photography, and lifestyle photography focusing on musicians, yogis and the occasional pinup. In recovery since 1993, Sarit decided to use her art and writing as a means of helping others on their path to healing. Here's the scoop on the book and the photography:
 

Yoga Ph.D.: Integrating the Life of the Mind and the Wisdom of the Body 
Yoga Ph.D. explores contemporary yoga from the unique perspective of a political science professor-turned-yoga teacher. Like most Americans, Carol Horton started studying yoga in search of nothing more than stretching and stress relief. Over time, however, yoga revealed itself to be a powerful yet subtle tool for exploring her body, mind, and the connections between them in ways she’d never previously imagined possible. This caused her to wonder: What is yoga, really? Where did it come from? Why has it become so popular? And what does it offer us, as individuals and a society?
In Yoga Ph.D., Carol integrates her diverse experiences as yoga practitioner and social scientist to provide provocative answers to these questions. Contemporary yoga, she notes, is a paradoxically multidimensional practice, pursued for everything from physical fitness to spiritual transformation – simultaneously commercial and mystical, recreational and therapeutic, scientific and esoteric. To make sense of such incongruities, Carol synthesizes personal reflections on her own practice with a research-based analysis of yoga as a sociocultural phenomenon. The result is a book that breaks new ground by offering a sympathetic yet critical analysis of the promise and pitfalls of American yoga.
Cutting-Edge Yoga Photography: Gritty, Inspiring & Real
Sarit Rogers creates a photographic style that not only celebrates her subjects as the they are, but allows viewers to look at the world in a different, more realistic way. A yogi herself, she is dismayed by the pastel world of yoga photography, finding herself perpetually uninspired. When Sarit was contacted about  photographing the cover of 21st Century Yoga, a floodgate of creativity opened. She was in her element, shooting something she loves, while supporting a practice that nourishes her recovery and soothes her mind. These images gave her the opportunity to create something authentic and tangible for anyone and everyone, regardless of their age, weight, gender, or race. 
Sarit's work for Yoga Ph.D. and 21st Century Yoga is a labor of love. She hopes this campaign will provide her with some of the financial support she needs to offset the creation of these shoots while also allowing her to purchase some new lights that will add to her versatility as a photographer. It would be wonderful to be able to take her shoots into more exotic places with more variable lighting situations that may be lacking in grounded sources of electricity.

Carol Horton, Ph.D., holds a doctorate in Political Science from the University of Chicago. She served on the faculty at Macalester College, and has extensive experience as a research consultant specializing in issues affecting low-income children and families. A Certified Forrest Yoga teacher, Carol teaches yoga to women in Chicago’s Cook County Jail with Yoga for Recovery. She is the author of Race and the Making of American Liberalism (Oxford University Press, 2005), and co-editor (with Roseanne Harvey) of 21st Century Yoga: Culture, Politics, and Practice (Kleio Books, 2012). story:
“Pare che oggigiorno, per fare gli spettacoli, un attore il teatro se lo deve costruire da solo. Non perché vogliamo salvare il teatro - 'il teatro sta morendo?' - chissenefrega, lo facciamo perché vogliamo sopravvivere noi” 

Come nasce il progetto

Ecco perché nel 2011 con quattro amici mi costruisco, in 6 mesi, un teatro. Sì, me lo costruisco proprio con le mie mani. Trasformiamo una vecchia tipografia fatiscente in un accogliente teatro: il Caffè della Caduta. 

Inauguro con il mio primo Live Show. Giusto per non dimenticarci che siamo vivi.

Un talk-show teatrale in cui si fondono l’esperienza di 15 anni di teatro di strada e la passione per la comicità sottile dello stand-up anglosassone. Tutto è Live, accade “qui e ora”, il pubblico è protagonista, niente e nessuno viene escluso a priori.  
Si crea ogni sera uno spettacolo inedito. Scritto e riscritto, ogni volta diverso. 

In due anni ho raccolto storie, temi, racconti che vorrei far diventare un libro. Un tascabile interattivo, un live show portatile, un antidoto contro l'infelicità. Un Libro LIVE.

Làsciati guidare dall'umore del momento, segui le aspirazioni di giornata per addentrarti in uno dei tre percorsi: 

Alive. Esiste solo un luogo dove la sopravvivenza è possibile. Riuscirai a trovarlo?

Love. Euforici incontri, (in)solite perversioni inseguendo il vero amore.

Life. Incontri con uomini straordinari che cambiano una vita. Nel bene e nel male.

"La sopravvivenza del teatro sta al luogo come quella del libro al non luogo"

                                                           Jean Baptiste Sophiste 

Di che cosa ho bisogno

L'obbiettivo è quello di raccogliere 3200€ per la realizzazione materiale del libro: progetto grafico di copertina, impaginazione e sezione fotografica; la parte di editing che richiede la competenza di un editor, appunto, in grado di aiutarmi nella stesura del libro. Infine i costi di stampa per una tranche di 500 copie. La vostra ricompensa!

Perchè sostenermi?  

Non solo per avere una copia del libro, ma per diventarne parte. E' questo il gioco in cui voglio coinvolgervi. Per renderlo Live ficcatevi dentro. Nel modo che più vi rispecchia. Non prendetevi troppo sul serio e decidete se essere il personaggio che muore nel capitolo Alive o quello di cui mi innamoro nel capitolo Love. Alcune ricompense avranno bisogno di essere personalizzate. Scrivetemi direttamente a francesco.giorda@fastwebnet.it 

Altre cose da fare

Contribuisci come meglio credi, non solo economicamente ma diffondendo il progetto. Condividi e segui la campagna sul link di Indiegogo, spargi la voce, segui le novità sul mio profilo Facebook, sul sito www.francescogiorda.it  e su www.teatrodellacaduta.org 

La Presentazione

La presentazione ufficiale del libro e la consegna delle vostre 
ricompense avverrà in occasione del mio ultimo e nuovo spettacolo. 

"Francesco Giorda LIFE Show"

  21-22-23 novembre 2013 

  Caffe della Caduta 

  Via Bava 39, Torino

story:
English translation after French description

Qui ?

Je suis Pascal Nuti, 46 ans, passionné d'écologie, fervent acteur de l'efficacité énergetique et à son service depuis 20 ans.

L'objectif

Je lance ce projet pour aider Naoufel, 30 Ans, tunisien, un entrepreneur bio ethique en tunisie.

Les contreparties sont livrées sous la forme de flacons d'huile de figue de barbarie pure et bio, 100% premier pressage à froid, un miracle anti-rides que nous offre dame nature. Ce produit est aussi trés utile pour tous problèmes de peau : acné, rougeurs, irritations, vergetures etc..

Le montant minimum de 30000€ sera réparti entre trois personnes : Pascal Nuti, Naoufel et Ramzi, qui fait actuellement la production sur sidi bouzid, dans le sud de la Tunisie. Naoufel s'engage à financer son équipement avec ce financement, Ramzi fera vivre sa famille.

Comme Ramzi est déja en production, tout montant financé pourra être positif, et l'opération est donc validée par avance, il n'existe pas de risque autre que le ciel nous tombe sur la tête...

Les retombées

L'impact est énorme, nous réussissons ensemble une des premières levées de fonds qui, non contente de permettre de créer une entreprise dans un pays qui en a cruellement besoin, permet de payer les acteurs ruraux le double du prix du marché (et oui !), tout en bénéficiant d'un produit doté d'une pureté unique, le tout sans intermédiaire à un prix 40% inférieur au marché !!!!

Je dirige un autre projet le plus clair de mon temps sur place, et donnerais un coup de main aux équipes, tout en gardant un regard acéré sur la qualité du produit final.

A partir de l'automne, Naoufel se concentrera sur d'autres produits bio, éthiques, et locaux, sa gamme s'élargira afin de pouvoir financer une activité étalée sur toute l'année. Vous entrez ainsi dans une aventure dont vous serez l'acteur, ainsi que le membre : une base de données vous permettra de profiter de tous les lancements de produits, avant leur récolte, toujours à des tarifs plus bas que le marché : nous ne payons pas d'aggios à notre banquier, pas de dailly, et nous payons malgré tout, grâce à vous, tous nos partenaires cash. Par ailleurs, aucun réseau de distribution n'est requis, grâce à Indiegogo. 

Des dizaines de personnes vont pouvoir retrouver un peu de dignité grâce à ces fioles magiques : 1000kg de figues de barbarie pour un litre d'huile, un million de graines à sélectionner, laver, presser, filtrer, mettre en bouteille, ça fait du travail.

Le lieu de production, entièrement alimenté en énergie photovoltaique, est situé au bord du lac Ichkeul, patrimoine Unesco.

L'utilisation est très simple : il faut en passer un film d'huile sur la peau le soir, avant de dormir. Attention, cette huile ne protège pas des UV, une bonne huile solaire est toujours utile pour faire bronzette.

Comment nous aider ?

Vous n'avez pas de rides ? moi non plus ! mais nous avons tous une maman, une compagne, une amie qui sera heureuse et fière de reçevoir un tel cadeau. Vous pouvez aussi faire un don de soutien de 10€, c'est une journée de travail en Tunisie...

N'hésitez pas à faire passer le lien, et vérifier la pertinence du produit à travers ces quelques liens :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=es53xxpEdiU

http://huile-figue-de-barbarie.blogspot.fr/

http://www.aufeminin.com/soins-visage/huile-de-figue-de-barbarie-huile-prodigieuse-f196574.html

http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figuier_de_Barbarie

http://www.aroma-zone.com/aroma/ficheHVfiguebarbarie.asp

http://www.omegatunisie.com/

Extrait de l'article wikipedia :

"En effet, l'huile de figue de Barbarie est riche en vitamines et minéraux, ainsi qu’en actifs réputés pour leurs propriétés anti-oxydantes, agissant ainsi contre le vieillissement cutané. Les pouvoirs de cette huile dépasseraient ceux de l’huile d’argan. Hydratante, nourrissante et adoucissante, l’huile de figues de Barbarie possède, entre autres, 65 % d’acides gras poly-insaturés (nourrissants) - contre 33 % pour l’argan, ainsi qu’un taux de vitamine E (anti-oxydante) supérieur à 100 mg / 100 g - contre 65 mg pour l’argan8."

Notre huile est acompagnée de son certificat Ecocert.

Bonne lecture !

 

WHO ?

I am suis Pascal Nuti, 46 years old, fervent ecologist, battling about energy efficiency since twenty years. 

The goal

Help Naoufel, 30 Ans, tunisian, a bio ethic entrepreneur in north Tunisia. With benefits, he will buy the material to press the seeds, filtering machine and so on.

The gifts will be prickly pear seed bio oil, fresh and pure, 100% first cold pressed, a miracle for your beauty and your skin, the most active natural product you can find against aging of skin.

The minimal amount of 30000€ will be shared beetween three peoples : Pascal Nuti, Naoufel and Ramzi, who is actually doing the pricky pear seed oil extraction on sidi bouzid, in south Tunisia. We are so successfull in funding a bio ethic company in north tunisia, who's gone to pay correctly a few workers and their family, but you have also access to a very pure product, with a 40% rebate on the regular street prices.

Qui ?
Je suis Pascal Nuti, 46 ans, passionné d'écologie, fervent acteur de l'efficacité énergetique et à son service depuis 20 ans.

L'objectif
Je lance ce projet pour aider Naoufel, 30 Ans, tunisien, un entrepreneur bio ethique en tunisie.
Les contreparties sont livrées sous la forme de flacons d'huile de figue de barbarie pure et bio, 100% premier pressage à froid, un miracle anti-rides que nous offre dame nature. Ce produit est aussi trés utile pour tous problèmes de peau : acné, rougeurs, irritations, vergetures etc..
Le montant minimum de 30000€ sera réparti entre trois personnes : Pascal Nuti, Naoufel et Ramzi, qui fait actuellement la production sur sidi bouzid, dans le sud de la Tunisie. Naoufel s'engage à financer son équipement avec ce financement, Ramzi fera vivre sa famille.
Comme Ramzi est déja en production, tout montant financé pourra être positif, et l'opération est donc validée par avance, il n'existe pas de risque autre que le ciel nous tombe sur la tête...

Les retombées
L'impact est énorme, nous réussissons ensemble une des premières levées de fonds qui, non contente de permettre de créer une entreprise dans un pays qui en a cruellement besoin, permet de payer les acteurs ruraux le double du prix du marché (et oui !), tout en bénéficiant d'un produit doté d'une pureté unique, le tout sans intermédiaire à un prix 40% inférieur au marché !!!!
Je dirige un autre projet le plus clair de mon temps sur place, et donnerais un coup de main aux équipes, tout en gardant un regard acéré sur la qualité du produit final.
A partir de l'automne, Naoufel se concentrera sur d'autres produits bio, éthiques, et locaux, sa gamme s'élargira afin de pouvoir financer une activité étalée sur toute l'année. Vous entrez ainsi dans une aventure dont vous serez l'acteur, ainsi que le membre : une base de données vous permettra de profiter de tous les lancements de produits, avant leur récolte, toujours à des tarifs plus bas que le marché : nous ne payons pas d'aggios à notre banquier, pas de dailly, et nous payons malgré tout, grâce à vous, tous nos partenaires cash. Par ailleurs, aucun réseau de distribution n'est requis, grâce à Indiegogo. 
Des dizaines de personnes vont pouvoir retrouver un peu de dignité grâce à ces fioles magiques : 1000kg de figues de barbarie pour un litre d'huile, un million de graines à sélectionner, laver, presser, filtrer, mettre en bouteille, ça fait du travail.
Le lieu de production, entièrement alimenté en énergie photovoltaique, est situé au bord du lac Ichkeul, patrimoine Unesco.
L'utilisation est très simple : il faut en passer un film d'huile sur la peau le soir, avant de dormir. Attention, cette huile ne protège pas des UV, une bonne huile solaire est toujours utile pour faire bronzette.
Comment nous aider ?


Vous n'avez pas de rides ? moi non plus ! mais nous avons tous une maman, une compagne, une amie qui sera heureuse et fière de reçevoir un tel cadeau. Vous pouvez aussi faire un don de soutien de 10€, c'est une journée de travail en Tunisie...

http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figuier_de_Barbarie
http://www.aroma-zone.com/aroma/ficheHVfiguebarbarie.asp
http://www.omegatunisie.com/

"En effet, l'huile de figue de Barbarie est riche en vitamines et minéraux, ainsi qu’en actifs réputés pour leurs propriétés anti-oxydantes, agissant ainsi contre le vieillissement cutané. Les pouvoirs de cette huile dépasseraient ceux de l’huile d’argan. Hydratante, nourrissante et adoucissante, l’huile de figues de Barbarie possède, entre autres, 65 % d’acides gras poly-insaturés (nourrissants) - contre 33 % pour l’argan, ainsi qu’un taux de vitamine E (anti-oxydante) supérieur à 100 mg / 100 g - contre 65 mg pour l’argan8."

story:
ABOUT CHEWSLAM

ChewSLAM Teen Poetry & Spoken Word Club is a weekly program that takes place Saturday afternoons at The Chewstick Facility. It is designed to build literacy, confidence, self-esteem, presentation skills, creative thought and collaboration. ChewSLAM exists to give teens a safe space to cultivate their voice, and provide them with positive methods of self-expression though poetry and spoken word as an alternative to negative behavior.

 

ABOUT BNV

 

Brave New Voices (BNV) is a poetry festival that allows the free space, opportunity and platform for young poets to share in a like- minded and open space. At the core of the festival is a slam that allows youth poetry teams from all over the world to compete on an even circuit. 

 

What We Need

 

  • ChewSLAM needs enough money to fund the travel from Bermuda to Chicago for six competing team memebers and two coaches.
  • As well as all BNV conference fees.
  • & ground transportation
  • & a whole bunch of other expenses that arise from flying 8 people out of the country

 

YOU GET FROM US

 

an array of original Chewstick items including:

Chewstick T-shirt, Chewstick tote bags, Chewstick stickers and actual Chewsticks. As well as cds and chapbooks by ChewSLAM and Chewstick affiliated poets.

 

The Impact of BNV

It's important for Bermuda's youth to be able to contribute to the literary community. Their participation in BNV will not only do this but will open up doors for many opportunities for each and every youth poet to learn, be influenced and to be a part of a festival that is a once in a lifetime experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

TWEET, SHARE, REPOST, SHOUT FROM WINDOWS! If you can't lend a dollar then please lend us your voice. We will greatly appreciate any shine on ChewSLAM that you can give us.

 

Visit chewstick.org for more information as well as facebook.com/Chewslam
