story:
Let Them Stay 

Let Them Stay is a book of oral histories, public statements, and personal narratives of U.S. War Resisters in Canada from 2004 to the present.

Long before Chelsea (Bradley) Manning released the Iraq War logs and the Collateral Murder video, Canada had its own WikiLeaks in the embodied form of the American soldiers who fled to Canada seeking refuge from the UN-deemed illegal war in Iraq. Now, after an almost decade-long struggle to stay in Canada, their stories and related documents have been collected in one place: Let Them Stay, the book.

These stories are vital to understanding how the politics of war changed the lives of men and women who had valiantly served their country but whose consciences would not allow them to continue to fight. Did you oppose the Iraq War? So did these US soldiers. By contributing to Let Them Stay, you will help document the sacrifices made by these brave men and women fighting to stay in Canada.

 

What We Need:

With many War Resisters and activists volunteering time and talent to Let Them Stay, our supportive publisher, Iguana Books (http://iguanabooks.com/), has managed to keep production costs low. Among others, a professional editor, a professional graphic artist, and a professional videographer have all donated their time to getting this book launched.

Even with all the unpaid time and effort that have gone into the making of this book, we still need to secure funding for some aspects of production, marketing, promotion, and on-line world-wide distribution for eBook and print. The total budget for this campaign is $6500.

We would like to see the campaign exceed that goal so we can make a donation to the War Resisters Support Campaign (http://www.resisters.ca/index_en.html). Additionally, Iguana Books, Luke Stewart and Sarah Hipworth are donating the majority of the royalties to WRSC. This means that once Let Them Stay has been released, 85% of all sales will go directly to support the fight to keep conscientious objectors in Canada. Buying a book will help WRSC Let Them Stay!

 

What You Get:

Depending on your contribution level, you could receive:

+ a copy of Let Them Stay in eBook, paperback, or signed hardcover format
+a hardcover version of The Deserter's Tale by Joshua Key with Lawrence Hill, signed by both authors (http://www.lawrencehill.com/the_deserters_tale.html) 
+ a copy of the trade paperback novel L.M.F. by Matthew Bin, signed and inscribed by the author (http://matthewbin.com/publications/)
+ a copy of the video “Let Them Stay: Voices of U.S. War Resisters in Canada”, narrated by Shirley Douglas (http://www.resisters.ca/video.html)
+ a copy of the video “War Resisters Speak Out”, an interview with War Resisters conducted by retired CBC broadcaster Andy Barrie
+ “Make Love Not War” and “Let Them Stay” stickers.

Let Them Stay is scheduled for release in January 2014.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute directly, you can still help:

+ Tell your friends, family, colleagues, and comrades about the project
+ Use indiegogo's share tools to spread the word!

If you want to contribute but don't feel comfortable donating online through PayPal, please contact the Let Them Stay campaign team, Luke Stewart and Sarah Hipworth, at letthemstaybook@gmail.com. They will be able to make an anonymous contribution on your behalf.

About Luke Stewart and Sarah Hipworth

Luke Stewart (Co-Editor):

Luke Stewart is a Ph.D. Candidate in History at the University of Waterloo, writing his thesis on the war crimes movement during the Vietnam War. Stewart has volunteered as an independent researcher for WRSC since 2009 and was the main organizer of the September 2011 conference “Looking Back, Moving Forward: War Resisters in North America.” Stewart is also on the steering committee of Historians Against the War.

Sarah Hipworth (Co-Editor):

Sarah Hipworth has lived, studied, and worked in Hamilton, Montreal, Paris (FR), Vancouver, Brooklyn (NY), and Toronto. She became involved with the War Resisters Support Campaign in 2008 while studying the role of publishing on War Resister immigration to Canada during the Vietnam War. She lives and works as a writer and editor in Hamilton.

story:
SuccoAcido magazine crowdfunding updates @ http://igg.me/at/SuccoAcidoNeverending2

THANKS, MERCI, GRAZIE

Scroll down your mouse for French and Italian languages...

14 years, 3948 press-releases in agenda, près de 1000 articles and interviews, 24 printed issues, more than 100.000 Euro invested, 130.000 copies distributed in the international circuit of art, film, comics, theater, music, literature. They are just numbers, not so great indeed, that they can not give you back the idea of ​​work, effort and joy experienced in recent years. That's why a Crowdfunding: to tell a story of free and independent press, and perhaps continue it...

What is SuccoAcido?

SuccoAcido is a multilingual international free magazine onpaper, a web magazine and a online community. Based in southern Italy SuccoAcido lives in Europe and in the Mediterranean area but winks to other continents, because the goal is to publish in all languages of the world within the next 10 years. For 14 years the magazine represented a model of independent journalism. SuccoAcido features articles, interviews, reviews and events about art, cinema, comics, music, theatre and writing published in different languages. Our purpose is to let people cross several cultural circuits and languages in as many ways as possible.

About this crowdfunding campaign

No advertorial. Our resources based on advertising or on subscriptions of those who want to distribute a free magazine that are the guarantee of our independence and our neutrality editorial.

SuccoAcido magazine needs funding for the next printed edition of 2015, as well as for the maintenance of SuccoAcido website and community, in addition to the developing of an app dedicated to our readers and distributors. SuccoAcido online digital edition is daily updated, the printed edition will be updated every 3/4 months.Besides all this, we want to extend distribution to many other countries now!

Everywhere in the world, Culture should be the first investment for the benefit of all, but unfortunately it is not. Since we started, we have invested more than twice the amount we are asking today, but we continue to believe that there was no better way to spend our money in spite of the fact that it has never returned in our hands. We have reinvested in the magazine all that we have gained. We made our best but we cannot continue to support by ourselves such a complex cultural project that today requires more investments. If you believe that SuccoAcido is a useful resource for our brains, it's time to help us to go ahead! Join us untill the end of this campaign...

SuccoAcido editorial project helps you to think about the differences among peoples and own limits, doesn't it? It sounds like as a little manifesto of human complexity to be exported to other galaxies and worlds, doesn't it? We hope so...

Remember: if you'll support SuccoAcido you'll support all those cultural networks that SuccoAcido have supported over the past years.

a first page from SuccoAcido latest onpaper edition (2012/2013 years)

In particular your money from crowdfunding campaign will be used:

  • TO PRINT & DISTRIBUTE SuccoAcido magazine 2015 onpaper new issues
  • TO DEVELOP & MAINTAIN SuccoAcido website and community
  • TO DEVELOP a very useful SuccoAcido app for iPhone, iPad & Android
  • TO EXTEND our team for articles and translations
  • TO REALIZE SuccoAcido bags, cups and t-shirts and TO PRINT more cd as perks for you
  • TO PERFORM AND FILM SuccoAcido Collective Reading non-shows...

At the end of this crowdfunding campaign (on 23/12/2014) if we will not reach our goal first we will re-formulate magazine with a lower circulation and with only one or two issues out for the year 2015. Then, in early 2015, we will launch new crowdfunding campaigns to achieve our goals and/or to develop a more widespread distribution of the magazine in new states and continents. Instead. if we reach our aim, we'll be able to employ our contributors, which is our biggest dream ever.

About SuccoAcido perks

Support us with any perks or amount and let us know your real name, we'll publish it on the next special SuccoAcido issue onpaper which will be published on February 2015. 
Some first pages from SuccoAcido vintage onpaper edition (2001/2004 years)

   

   

   

Supports us and receive: 

- a very rare SuccoAcido magazine old issues onpaper dated years

- onpaper subscription for 2015 SuccoAcido editions

- "SuccoAcido Collective Readings"

- music cd and Quaderni d'Arte from DeDieux/\SuccoAcido 

- some copies of SuccoAcido onpaper to be distributed for free in your city (with your name and link inside)

- holidays in Casa SuccoAcido 

- SuccoAcido bags, cups and t-shirts perks

- Other perks are dedicated to art galleries, museums, music labels, theaters and theatrical companies, who'd like to distribute the onpaper magazine 2015 edition in theirs own venues and networks. 

   


SuccoAcido Collective Readings Spring 2015 Tour & Film (available dates)

A "SuccoAcido Collective Reading" is a game focusing on the media world. A show dedicated to different cultural scenes, an opportunity for talking about the Information System and today's Publishing issues, connected to political situation. It's a performance based show which aims to stimulate the exchange of ideas, music, words. The tuning of the paper and the public reading of the copies of the newspaper are the beginning of an experience that is always different. In each city, several artists will be invited to play or act on stage.
The tour will be filmed for a second road movie from Marc De Dieux (Pulp Critic). You can get at home 10 back SuccoAcido's copies to film 1 minutes of your SuccoAcido Collective Reading with friends, then send us your video to be part of the film.
Please contact us before choosing this perk, to check availability of dates. Write to: sacr[at]succoacido[dot]net

Thank you

Since we started, 14 years ago, lots of friends contributed for free and supported us to make this magazine a rare example of mixing networks. We like to send a special thank to all those friends who supported us and contribute to SuccoAcido's editorial history, first of all thanks to our editors staff who have helped us in recent years and many friends who are indicated at the bottom of this page.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family, take this page on Mars…


--------------
Française

Aidez-nous à imprimer notre magazine indépendant, multilingue et international, augmenter la distribution, réaliser l’application.

14 années, 3948 communiqués de presse dans l'agenda, about 1000 articles et interviews, 24 numéros imprimés, plus de 100.000 Euro investi, 130.000 exemplaires distribués dans le circuit international de l'art, le cinéma, la bande dessinée, le théâtre, la musique, la littérature. Ils ne sont que des chiffres et pas si grande en effet, qu'ils ne peuvent pas vous redonner l'idée de travail, l'effort et la joie connu au cours des dernières années. Voilà pourquoi un crowdfunding: raconter une histoire de la presse libre et indépendante, et peut-être continuer...

Qu’est-ce que c’est SuccoAcido?

SuccoAcido est un magazine gratuit indépendant, multilingue et international en papier, une revue en ligne et une communauté d’art. Le magazine est basé dans le sud de l’Italie SuccoAcido vivent en Europe et dans le bassin méditerranéen, mais un clin d'œil à d'autres continents, car le but est de publier dans toutes les langues du monde dans les 10 prochaines années. 14 ans de journalisme indépendant en Italie. SuccoAcido propose des articles, des interviews, des critiques et des événements sur les mondes de l’art, du cinéma, des BD, de la musique, du théâtre et de l’écriture dans des nombreuses langues. Notre raison de vivre est de laisser les gens traverser langues et circuits dans autant de pays que possible.

Une première page de SuccoAcido dernière édition de onpaper (2012/2013 ans)

À propos de cette campagne de crowdfunding

Ni publireportage. Nos seules ressources reposent sur la publicité ou sur les abonnements pour ceux qui veulent distribuer un magazine gratuit qui sont la garantie de notre indépendance et de notre neutralité éditoriale.

Le magazine SuccoAcido a besoin d’argent pour continuer et augmenter le tirage et la distribution des prochains numéros de SuccoAcido 2015 en papier, ainsi que pour la maintenance du site Web et de la communauté de SuccoAcido et de plus pour le développement d’une application dédiée aux lecteurs et distributeurs de SuccoAcido. SuccoAcido édition numérique est mise à jour quotidiennement en ligne, l’édition papier sera mise à jour tous les 3/4 mois.

Nous voulons étendre la distribution dans de nombreux pays maintenant! Publié dans autant de langues que possible, SuccoAcido est un rare exemple de mélange des cultures et des circuits d’une manière très simple et inhabituel.

Partout dans le monde, la culture doit être le premier élément de l'investissement pour le bénéfice de tous, mais malheureusement il n'est pas. Depuis que nous avons commencé, il ya 14 ans, nous avons investi lentement plus du double de la somme que nous demandons aujourd'hui et nous croyons toujours qu'il n'y a pas de meilleure façon de dépenser notre argent en dépit du fait qu'il n'a jamais retourné dans nos mains pour être réinvestis sur le magazine. Nous avons fait de notre mieux, mais nous ne pouvons plus continuer à soutenir par nous-mêmes un projet culturel si complexe qui nécessite en effet d'énormes investissements. Si vous croyez que SuccoAcido est une ressource utile pour beaucoup de nos cerveaux maintenant il est temps pour nous aider à aller de l'avant sur cette voie. Soutenez-nous en aucune manière possible, même lorsque cette campagne se terminera ...

Est-ce que le projet éditorial SuccoAcido aide vous à réfléchir sur les différences entre les peuples et les limites propres de chacun? Ne sonne-t-il pas comme un petit manifeste de la complexité humaine à exporter dans d’autres galaxies et mondes? Nous l’espérons ... Rappelez-vous: soutenir SuccoAcido signifie soutenir tous les circuits culturels que SuccoAcido veut soutenir.

En particulier votre argent de la campagne de crowdfunding sera utilisé:

  • pour IMPRIMER & DISTRIBUER les nouveaux numéros de SuccoAcido 2015 en papier
  • pour DÉVELOPPER et MAINTENIR le site Web et de la communauté de SuccoAcido
  • pour DÉVELOPPER une application SuccoAcido très utile pour iPhone, iPad et Android
  • pour ÉTENDRE notre équipe pour les articles et les traductions
  • pour RÉALISER sacs et tasses de SuccoAcido, t-shirts et imprimer plus de cd comme avantages pour vous
  • pour EFFECTUER ET TOURNER « SuccoAcido Collective Readings » non-shows

À la fin de cette campagne de crowdfunding (le 23/12/2014) si nous ne serons pas en mesure d’atteindre notre objectif premier, nous allons reformuler le projet de la revue avec une circulation moindre et avec seulement une ou deux numéros en 2015 au lieu de 4. Plus tard, au début de 2015, nous allons peut-être lancer des campagnes de crowdfunding suivantes pour objectifs pas pleinement atteints et / ou pour développer une distribution plus étendue de la revue dans des nouveaux États et continents. Si nous ne atteindrons pas notre objectif: employer notre équipe de collaborateurs est notre plus grand cible depuis toujours.

Cosa è SuccoAcido?

SuccoAcido è un giornale gratuito, internazionale e multilingue; un magazine con edizione cartacea e on line; una community. Fondato nel sud Italia 14 anni fa, SuccoAcido vive in Europa e nel bacino del Mediterraneo, ma strizza l'occhio ad altri continenti, perché l'obiettivo è di pubblicare in tutte le lingue del mondo entro i prossimi 10 anni. SuccoAcido rappresenta un modello di giornalismo indipendente e raccoglie articoli e interviste, ma anche notizie dal mondo dell'arte, del cinema, del comics, della musica e della scrittura, pubblicate ogni giorno in tutte le lingue. La nostra ragion d'essere è far sì che le persone possano incontrarsi, incrociando virtualmente lingue e circuiti culturali del maggior numero di paesi possibile.

A proposito di questa campagna di crowdfunding

Nessuna publiredazionale. Le nostre risorse basate sulla pubblicità tabellare o sugli abbonamenti di chi vuole distribuire una rivista gratuita che sono la garanzia della nostra indipendenza e la nostra neutralità editoriale.

Ovunque nel mondo, infatti, la cultura dovrebbe essere al primo posto negli investimenti pubblici e privati, per il bene comune, ma purtroppo non è così. Da quando abbiamo cominciato questo progetto, noi abbiamo investito di anno in anno più del doppio della cifra che oggi chiediamo e siamo convinti che non ci fosse modo migliore per spendere il nostro denaro. Tutto il nostro guadagno è stato infatti sempre reinvestito nel giornale. Abbiamo fatto del nostro meglio e con ottimi risultati, ma non possiamo continuare più a sostenere da soli un progetto culturale così complesso. Se credete che SuccoAcido sia una risorsa importante, adesso è il momento di aiutarci a proseguire in questa direzione. Supportateci in ogni modo possibile, fino al termine della campagna...

Con questa campagna noi intendiamo lanciare un progetto culturale che si fonda su una proposta articolata: 

1. da un lato vogliamo continuare a fare ricerca, presentare il punto di vista degli artisti, attraverso interviste e articoli su carta e on line, proseguendo e incrementando l'edizione cartacea del giornale e l'attività del portale web. L'edizione on line del giornale potrà ancora essere aggiornata quotidianamente e quella cartacea potrà avere una cadenza di 3 o quattro mesi.

2. D'altra parte desideriamo anche estendere il nostro archivio e l'aggiornamento quotidiano delle news dal mondo della cultura internazionale sviluppando una app che tutti i nostri lettori, da qualsiasi parte del mondo potranno seguire scaricandola sui propri mobiles, smartphone e tablet.

3. Inoltre vogliamo estendere la distribuzione a nuovi Paesi incrementando la lista dei nostri distributori e partners!!!! Pubblicato in tante lingue SuccoAcido è un raro esempio di incrocio di culture in un modo semplice, ma innovativo. Credete come noi che SuccoAcido aiuti a riflettere sulle differenze tra le culture, ponendo ciascuno  di fronte ai propri limiti? Vi suona come un piccolo manifesto della complessità culturale da esportare in altre galassie e mondi? Noi speriamo di sì...  Ricordate: sostenere SuccoAcido significa sostenere anche tutti quei circuiti culturali che la rivista sostiene da anni.

In particolare i soldi che raccoglieremo dalla campagna di crowdfunding saranno utilizzati: 

Per STAMPARE e DISTRIBUIRE le uscite cartacee di SuccoAcido nel 2015

Per SVILUPPARE e MANTENERE il sito SuccoAcido e la community  

Per SVILUPPARE un app di SuccoAcido per iPhone, iPad e Android 

Per ALLARGARE il nostro team per articoli e traduzioni 

Per REALIZZARE le borse, le tazze e le magliette di SuccoAcido e altri cd per voi

Per LEGGERE E FILMARE insieme le SuccoAcido Collective Readings... 

Il 23/12/2014, alla fine di questa campagna di crowd funding, se non avremo raggiunto il nostro obiettivo riformuleremo il progetto dell'edizione cartacea con tirature e periodicità minime e nei primi mesi del 2015, lanceremo altre campagne di crowdfunding per sviluppare una più diffusa distribuzione della rivista in altri stati e continenti. Se invece raggiungeremo il nostro obiettivo potremo impiegare i nostri collaboratori, è il più grande sogno di sempre.

SuccoAcido Collective Readings Spring 2015 Tour & Film (date disponibili)

Un "SuccoAcido Collective Reading" è un gioco sui media. Uno spettacolo dedicato a diverse scene culturali, un momento di confronto sulle tematiche politiche inerenti alla situazione dell'informazione e dell'editoria oggi. Lo spettacolo è incentrato sulla performance e sulla condivisione di pensiero, musica, parole. L'accordatura della carta e la lettura comune delle copie di SuccoAcido distribuite al pubblico sono l'avvio di un'esperienza corale e sempre diversa. In ogni città saranno invitati artisti diversi a intervenire sul palco.
Il tour sarà filmato per realizzare il secondo road movie di Marc De Dieux (Pulp Critic). Puoi ricevere a casa 10 copie arretrate di SuccoAcido per filmare 1 minuto della tua SuccoAcido Collective Reading con gli amici, poi inviaci il tuo video per far parte del film. Scriveteci prima di prenotare questo premio per controllare la disponibilità delle date. L'indirizzo è sacr[at]succoacido[dot]net

story_txt:
SuccoAcido magazine crowdfunding updates @ http://igg.me/at/SuccoAcidoNeverending2THANKS, MERCI, GRAZIEScroll down your mouse for French and Italian languages...




14 years, 3948 press-releases in agenda, près de 1000 articles and interviews, 24 printed issues, more than 100.000 Euro invested, 130.000 copies distributed in the international circuit of art, film, comics, theater, music, literature. They are just numbers, not so great indeed, that they can not give you back the idea of ​​work, effort and joy experienced in recent years. That's why a Crowdfunding: to tell a story of free and independent press, and perhaps continue it...What is SuccoAcido?SuccoAcido is a multilingual international free magazine onpaper, a web magazine and a online community. Based in southern Italy SuccoAcido lives in Europe and in the Mediterranean area but winks to other continents, because the goal is to publish in all languages of the world within the next 10 years. For 14 years the magazine represented a model of independent journalism. SuccoAcido features articles, interviews, reviews and events about art, cinema, comics, music, theatre and writing published in different languages. Our purpose is to let people cross several cultural circuits and languages in as many ways as possible.
About this crowdfunding campaign



No advertorial. Our resources based on advertising or on subscriptions of those who want to distribute a free magazine that are the guarantee of our independence and our neutrality editorial.
SuccoAcido magazine needs funding for the next printed edition of 2015,
 as well as for the maintenance of SuccoAcido website and community, in 
addition to the developing of an app dedicated to our 
readers and distributors. SuccoAcido online digital edition is daily 
updated, the printed edition will be updated every 3/4 months.Besides all this, we want to extend distribution to many other countries now! Everywhere in the world, Culture should be the first investment for the benefit of all, but unfortunately it is not. Since we started, we have invested more than twice the amount we are asking today, but we continue to believe that there was no better way to spend our money in spite of the fact that it has never returned in our hands. We have reinvested in the magazine all that we have gained. We made our best but we cannot continue to support by ourselves such a complex cultural project that today requires more investments. If you believe that SuccoAcido is a useful resource for our brains, it's time to help us to go ahead! Join us untill the end of this campaign...
SuccoAcido editorial project helps you to think about the differences among peoples and own limits, doesn't it? It sounds like as a little manifesto of human complexity to be exported to other galaxies and worlds, doesn't it? We hope so... Remember: if you'll support SuccoAcido you'll support all those cultural networks that SuccoAcido have supported over the past years.

a first page from SuccoAcido latest onpaper edition (2012/2013 years)


In particular your money from crowdfunding campaign will be used:

TO PRINT & DISTRIBUTE SuccoAcido magazine 2015 onpaper new issues
TO DEVELOP & MAINTAIN SuccoAcido website and community
TO DEVELOP a very useful SuccoAcido app for iPhone, iPad & Android
TO EXTEND our team for articles and translations
TO REALIZE SuccoAcido bags, cups and t-shirts and TO PRINT more cd as perks for you
TO PERFORM AND FILM SuccoAcido Collective Reading non-shows...

At the end of this crowdfunding campaign (on 23/12/2014) if we will not reach our goal first we will re-formulate magazine with a lower circulation and with only one or two issues out for the year 2015. Then, in early 2015, we will launch new crowdfunding campaigns to achieve our goals and/or to develop a more widespread distribution of the magazine in new states and continents. Instead. if we reach our aim, we'll be able to employ our contributors, which is our biggest dream ever.
About SuccoAcido perks
Support us with any perks or amount and let us know your real name, we'll publish it on the next special SuccoAcido issue onpaper which will be published on February 2015. Some first pages from SuccoAcido vintage onpaper edition (2001/2004 years)

   

   
   
Supports us and receive: 
- a very rare SuccoAcido magazine old issues onpaper dated years
- onpaper subscription for 2015 SuccoAcido editions
- "SuccoAcido Collective Readings"
- music cd and Quaderni d'Arte from DeDieux/\SuccoAcido 
- some copies of SuccoAcido onpaper to be distributed for free in your city (with your name and link inside)
- holidays in Casa SuccoAcido 
- SuccoAcido bags, cups and t-shirts perks
- Other perks are dedicated to art galleries, museums, music labels, theaters and theatrical companies, who'd like to distribute the onpaper magazine 2015 edition in theirs own venues and networks. 



   

SuccoAcido Collective Readings Spring 2015 Tour & Film (available dates)



A "SuccoAcido Collective Reading" is a game focusing on the media world. A show dedicated to different cultural scenes, an opportunity for talking about the Information System and today's Publishing issues, connected to political situation. It's a performance based show which aims to stimulate the exchange of ideas, music, words. The tuning of the paper and the public reading of the copies of the newspaper are the beginning of an experience that is always different. In each city, several artists will be invited to play or act on stage. The tour will be filmed for a second road movie from Marc De Dieux (Pulp Critic). You can get at home 10 back SuccoAcido's copies to film 1 minutes of your SuccoAcido Collective Reading with friends, then send us your video to be part of the film.Please contact us before choosing this perk, to check availability of dates. Write to: sacr[at]succoacido[dot]net
Thank you


Since we started, 14 years ago, lots of friends contributed for free and supported us to make this magazine a rare example of mixing networks. We like to send a special thank to all those friends who supported us and contribute to SuccoAcido's editorial history, first of all thanks to our editors staff who have helped us in recent years and many friends who are indicated at the bottom of this page.
Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family, take this page on Mars…




--------------Française


Aidez-nous à imprimer notre magazine indépendant, multilingue et international, augmenter la distribution, réaliser l’application.


14 années, 3948 communiqués de presse dans l'agenda, about 1000 articles et interviews, 24 numéros imprimés, plus de 100.000 Euro investi, 130.000 exemplaires distribués dans le circuit international de l'art, le cinéma, la bande dessinée, le théâtre, la musique, la littérature. Ils ne sont que des chiffres et pas si grande en effet, qu'ils ne peuvent pas vous redonner l'idée de travail, l'effort et la joie connu au cours des dernières années. Voilà pourquoi un crowdfunding: raconter une histoire de la presse libre et indépendante, et peut-être continuer...


Qu’est-ce que c’est SuccoAcido?


SuccoAcido est un magazine gratuit indépendant, multilingue et international en papier, une revue en ligne et une communauté d’art. Le magazine est basé dans le sud de l’Italie SuccoAcido vivent en Europe et dans le bassin méditerranéen, mais un clin d'œil à d'autres continents, car le but est de publier dans toutes les langues du monde dans les 10 prochaines années. 14 ans de journalisme indépendant en Italie. SuccoAcido propose des articles, des interviews, des critiques et des événements sur les mondes de l’art, du cinéma, des BD, de la musique, du théâtre et de l’écriture dans des nombreuses langues. Notre raison de vivre est de laisser les gens traverser langues et circuits dans autant de pays que possible.

Une première page de SuccoAcido dernière édition de onpaper (2012/2013 ans)


À propos de cette campagne de crowdfunding


Ni publireportage. Nos seules ressources reposent sur la publicité ou sur les abonnements pour ceux qui veulent distribuer un magazine gratuit qui sont la garantie de notre indépendance et de notre neutralité éditoriale.


Le magazine SuccoAcido a besoin d’argent pour continuer et augmenter le tirage et la distribution des prochains numéros de SuccoAcido 2015 en papier, ainsi que pour la maintenance du site Web et de la communauté de SuccoAcido et de plus pour le développement d’une application dédiée aux lecteurs et distributeurs de SuccoAcido. SuccoAcido édition numérique est mise à jour quotidiennement en ligne, l’édition papier sera mise à jour tous les 3/4 mois.
Nous voulons étendre la distribution dans de nombreux pays maintenant! Publié dans autant de langues que possible, SuccoAcido est un rare exemple de mélange des cultures et des circuits d’une manière très simple et inhabituel. 
Partout dans le monde, la culture doit être le premier élément de 
l'investissement pour le bénéfice de tous, mais malheureusement il n'est
 pas. Depuis que nous avons commencé, il ya 14 ans, nous avons investi 
lentement plus du double de la somme que nous demandons aujourd'hui et 
nous croyons toujours qu'il n'y a pas de meilleure façon de dépenser 
notre argent en dépit du fait qu'il n'a jamais retourné dans nos mains 
pour être réinvestis sur le magazine. Nous avons fait de notre mieux, 
mais nous ne pouvons plus continuer à soutenir par nous-mêmes un projet 
culturel si complexe qui nécessite en effet d'énormes investissements. 
Si vous croyez que SuccoAcido est une ressource utile pour beaucoup de 
nos cerveaux maintenant il est temps pour nous aider à aller de l'avant 
sur cette voie. Soutenez-nous en aucune manière possible, même lorsque 
cette campagne se terminera ...

Est-ce que le projet éditorial SuccoAcido aide vous à réfléchir sur les différences entre les peuples et les limites propres de chacun? Ne sonne-t-il pas comme un petit manifeste de la complexité humaine à exporter dans d’autres galaxies et mondes? Nous l’espérons ... Rappelez-vous: soutenir SuccoAcido signifie soutenir tous les circuits culturels que SuccoAcido veut soutenir.



En particulier votre argent de la campagne de crowdfunding sera utilisé:

pour IMPRIMER & DISTRIBUER les nouveaux numéros de SuccoAcido 2015 en papier
pour DÉVELOPPER et MAINTENIR le site Web et de la communauté de SuccoAcido
pour DÉVELOPPER une application SuccoAcido très utile pour iPhone, iPad et Android
pour ÉTENDRE notre équipe pour les articles et les traductions
pour RÉALISER sacs et tasses de SuccoAcido, t-shirts et imprimer plus de cd comme avantages pour vous
pour EFFECTUER ET TOURNER « SuccoAcido Collective Readings » non-shows

À la fin de cette campagne de crowdfunding (le 23/12/2014) si nous ne serons pas en mesure d’atteindre notre objectif premier, nous allons reformuler le projet de la revue avec une circulation moindre et avec seulement une ou deux numéros en 2015 au lieu de 4. Plus tard, au début de 2015, nous allons peut-être lancer des campagnes de crowdfunding suivantes pour objectifs pas pleinement atteints et / ou pour développer une distribution plus étendue de la revue dans des nouveaux États et continents. Si nous ne atteindrons pas notre objectif: employer notre équipe de collaborateurs est notre plus grand cible depuis toujours.
À propos des avantages de SuccoAcido


Soutenez-nous avec des avantages ou montant et dites-nous votre nom réel, nous le publierons sur le prochain numéro spécial de SuccoAcido en papier qui sera édité en Février 2015. 
Quelques premières pages de l’édition vintage de SuccoAcido en papier (années 2001/2004)

  
  
  
Soutenez-nous pour:
- un vieux numéro très rare de SuccoAcido en papier
- abonement au papier pour l’éditions 2015 de SuccoAcido
- il ya les avantages des « SuccoAcido Collective Readings »
- les Quaderni d’arte, les cd de musique de DeDieux/\SuccoAcido
- des copies de SuccoAcido onpaper à être distribués gratuitement dans votre ville (avec votre nom et votre lien à l'intérieur)
- vacances à Casa SuccoAcido
- des sacs, tasses et t-shirts de SuccoAcido

- Autres avantages sont dédiés à galeries d’art, musées, maisons de disques, théâtres et compagnies théâtrales, qui voudraient distribuer l’édition papier 2015 dans leurs propres sites et circuits.
  

SuccoAcido Collective Readings printemps 2015 Tour et Film (dates disponibles)
"SuccoAcido lecture collective" est un jeu de médias. Un salon dédié aux différentes scènes culturelles, une occasion de dialogue sur les questions de politique pertinentes pour l'information de l’état de l’art aujourd'hui. Le spectacle se concentre sur la performance et le partage des pensées, de la musique, des mots. Le réglage du papier et la copie de "SuccoAcido lecture collective" distribuée au public sont le début d'un ensemble toujours différent. Dans chaque ville divers artistes seront invités à travailler sur la scène.La tournée sera filmé pour un deuxième film de route de Marc De Dieux (Pulp Critic). Vous pouvez obtenir 10 copies de SuccoAcido à la maison pour filmer 1 minute de votre SuccoAcido Collective Reading avec des amis, puis envoyer la vidéo à faire partie du film. Rappelez-vous de nous écrire, pour vérifier la disponibilité de dates. L'adresse est: sacr[at]succoacido[dot]net




Merci beaucoup!


Nous aimons à envoyer un grand merci à tous les amis qui nous ont soutenus et qui ont contribué à l’histoire de la rédaction de SuccoAcido au cours de nos 14 premières années; d’abord grâce à nos rédacteurs qui nous ont aidés au cours des derrières années et de nombreux amis qui sont en bas de cette page. 
Autres façons de nous aider


Dites-le à vos amis, à votre famille, partagez cette page sur Mars….


-----------





Italiano
Aiutateci a stampare la nostra rivista multilingue internazionale, a distribuirla e a realizzare una app.


14 anni, 3948 comunicati stampa in agenda, circa 1000 articoli e interviste, 24 uscite cartacee, più di 100.000 Euro investiti, 130.000 copie distribuite nei circuiti internazionali dell'arte, del cinema, del fumetto, del teatro, della musica, della letteratura. Sono solo numeri, nemmeno così tanto grandi, che non possono rendere l'idea del lavoro, della fatica e della gioia vissuti in questi anni.  Ecco perché un crowdfunding: per raccontarvi una storia di stampa libera e indipendente. E forse per continuarla...


Cosa è SuccoAcido?

SuccoAcido è un giornale gratuito, internazionale e multilingue; un magazine con edizione cartacea e on line; una community. Fondato nel sud Italia 14 anni fa, SuccoAcido vive in Europa e nel bacino del Mediterraneo, ma strizza l'occhio ad altri continenti, perché l'obiettivo è di pubblicare in tutte le lingue del mondo entro i prossimi 10 anni. SuccoAcido rappresenta un modello di giornalismo indipendente e raccoglie articoli e interviste, ma anche notizie dal mondo dell'arte, del cinema, del comics, della musica e della scrittura, pubblicate ogni giorno in tutte le lingue. La nostra ragion d'essere è far sì che le persone possano incontrarsi, incrociando virtualmente lingue e circuiti culturali del maggior numero di paesi possibile.

Prime pagine dell'ultima edizione cartacea di SuccoAcido (anni 2012/2013)        
A proposito di questa campagna di crowdfunding





Nessuna publiredazionale. Le nostre risorse basate sulla pubblicità tabellare o sugli abbonamenti di chi vuole distribuire una rivista gratuita che sono la garanzia della nostra indipendenza e la nostra neutralità editoriale.Ovunque nel mondo, infatti, la cultura dovrebbe essere al primo posto negli investimenti pubblici e privati, per il bene comune, ma purtroppo non è così. Da quando abbiamo cominciato questo progetto, noi abbiamo investito di anno in anno più del doppio della cifra che oggi chiediamo e siamo convinti che non ci fosse modo migliore per spendere il nostro denaro. Tutto il nostro guadagno è stato infatti sempre reinvestito nel giornale. Abbiamo fatto del nostro meglio e con ottimi risultati, ma non possiamo continuare più a sostenere da soli un progetto culturale così complesso. Se credete che SuccoAcido sia una risorsa importante, adesso è il momento di aiutarci a proseguire in questa direzione. Supportateci in ogni modo possibile, fino al termine della campagna...



Con questa campagna noi intendiamo lanciare un progetto culturale che si fonda su una proposta articolata: 
1. da un lato vogliamo continuare a fare ricerca, presentare il punto di vista degli artisti, attraverso interviste e articoli su carta e on line, proseguendo e incrementando l'edizione cartacea del giornale e l'attività del portale web. L'edizione on line del giornale potrà ancora essere aggiornata quotidianamente e quella cartacea potrà avere una cadenza di 3 o quattro mesi.


2. D'altra parte desideriamo anche estendere il nostro archivio e l'aggiornamento quotidiano delle news dal mondo della cultura internazionale sviluppando una app che tutti i nostri lettori, da qualsiasi parte del mondo potranno seguire scaricandola sui propri mobiles, smartphone e tablet.


3. Inoltre vogliamo estendere la distribuzione a nuovi Paesi incrementando la lista dei nostri distributori e partners!!!! Pubblicato in tante lingue SuccoAcido è un raro esempio di incrocio di culture in un modo semplice, ma innovativo. Credete come noi che SuccoAcido aiuti a riflettere sulle differenze tra le culture, ponendo ciascuno  di fronte ai propri limiti? Vi suona come un piccolo manifesto della complessità culturale da esportare in altre galassie e mondi? Noi speriamo di sì...  Ricordate: sostenere SuccoAcido significa sostenere anche tutti quei circuiti culturali che la rivista sostiene da anni.




In particolare i soldi che raccoglieremo dalla campagna di crowdfunding saranno utilizzati: 
Per STAMPARE e DISTRIBUIRE le uscite cartacee di SuccoAcido nel 2015
Per SVILUPPARE e MANTENERE il sito SuccoAcido e la community  
Per SVILUPPARE un app di SuccoAcido per iPhone, iPad e Android 
Per ALLARGARE il nostro team per articoli e traduzioni 
Per REALIZZARE le borse, le tazze e le magliette di SuccoAcido e altri cd per voi
Per LEGGERE E FILMARE insieme le SuccoAcido Collective Readings... 
Il 23/12/2014, alla fine di questa campagna di crowd funding, se non avremo raggiunto il nostro obiettivo riformuleremo il progetto dell'edizione cartacea con tirature e periodicità minime e nei primi mesi del 2015, lanceremo altre campagne di crowdfunding per sviluppare una più diffusa distribuzione della rivista in altri stati e continenti. Se invece raggiungeremo il nostro obiettivo potremo impiegare i nostri collaboratori, è il più grande sogno di sempre.

Riguardo ai premi

Sostienici con qualsiasi premio o cifra tu scelga (anche non compresa nelle quote segnalate) e facci sapere il tuo vero nome che pubblicheremo sulla prossima edizione speciale di SuccoAcido on paper di Febbraio 2015.

Prime pagine vintage dell'edizione cartacea di SuccoAcido (anni 2001/2004)
  
  
  


Supportaci per avere anche:
- la speciale collezione di numeri antichi e vintage di SuccoAcido

- le "SuccoAcido Collective Readings" (prenotazione con email o contatto telefonico)
- i libri della collana Quaderni d'Arte e i cd musicali DeDieux/\SuccoAcido
- le magliette, le tazze e le borse realizzate per l'occasione, 
- Alcune copie di SuccoAcido onpaper da distribuire gratuitamente nella tua città (con il vostro nome e link al suo interno)
- vacanze presso la sede di Casa SuccoAcido in collina sopra Palermo…
- altri premi ancora sono dedicati alle gallerie d'arte, ai musei, alle etichette discografiche, ai teatri, e alle compagnie teatrali che desiderino entrare nella lista dei distributori del giornale per l'edizione 2015.

   
SuccoAcido Collective Readings Spring 2015 Tour & Film (date disponibili)
Un "SuccoAcido Collective Reading" è un gioco sui media. Uno spettacolo dedicato a diverse scene culturali, un momento di confronto sulle tematiche politiche inerenti alla situazione dell'informazione e dell'editoria oggi. Lo spettacolo è incentrato sulla performance e sulla condivisione di pensiero, musica, parole. L'accordatura della carta e la lettura comune delle copie di SuccoAcido distribuite al pubblico sono l'avvio di un'esperienza corale e sempre diversa. In ogni città saranno invitati artisti diversi a intervenire sul palco. Il tour sarà filmato per realizzare il secondo road movie di Marc De Dieux (Pulp Critic). Puoi ricevere a casa 10 copie arretrate di SuccoAcido per filmare 1 minuto della tua SuccoAcido Collective Reading con gli amici, poi inviaci il tuo video per far parte del film. Scriveteci prima di prenotare questo premio per controllare la disponibilità delle date. L'indirizzo è  sacr[at]succoacido[dot]net

Ringraziamenti
Teniamo a ringraziare tutti gli amici che ci hanno sostenuto contribuendo alla storia della redazione di SuccoAcido durante questi primi 14 anni, i nostri redattori che ci hanno aiutato nel corso degli ultimi anni e tanti amici che trovate in fondo a questa pagina. 
Altri modi per sostenerci
Linkate la nostra campagna ai vostri amici, alle vostre famiglie, portatela su Marte…

story:
A Labor of Love

Incite Isla Vista! is a collection of firebrand students, professors, and residents dedicated to the arts and focused on reviving The Catalyst Literary and Visual Arts Magazine as a vital and important force in Isla Vista and the greater Santa Barbara community. 

Amid the largely negative and sensational events publicized nationally, a highly creative, thriving and lively culture has been overshadowed at UCSB and in the adjacent community of Isla Vista. This culture has been a constant feature throughout our town's history but since 2007 has lacked an outlet to exhibit and uplift it. This is where The Catalyst comes in.

The first issue of the revived Catalyst (defunct since 2007) came out in the Winter Quarter of the 2013-2014 school year. In seventy-five colored pages, the inaugural issue collected poetry, short stories, critical essays, and creative non-fiction, accompanied by painting, photography, and illustrations, all of which were produced, edited, and arranged by students. It was an eclectic mix of different viewpoints and opinions. After a successful launch party that showcased the writers and artists featured in the magazine (as well as local bands and musicians), the magazine established a presence on campus and in the community.

Despite this success, an attempt to obtain funding from the UC fell short by a narrow margin leaving the 'zine in a sticky financial situation.  It is important that the students and residents of Isla Vista have an avenue for expressing themselves creatively in a physical format as well as digital. Unfortunately, printing costs are high and the magazine's creators are students and residents without enough cash to foot the expenses.

Now this is where you come in.

We're asking for donations of any size so that we will be able to print the second issue of the magazine and keep it free of charge.

The submissions process has already been completed and the selections for the Spring issue have already been made. Editing and Layout are being finished at this very moment. For all intents and purposes the issue will be completed with nothing but a copious amount of time spent. We require funding only to put out a physical copy worthy of the amount of time and energy that has gone into it.

The first issue was a smashing success and we want to keep building on the momentum we've established.  If we do not reach our goal, we will still use the money to release a more financially feasible, scaled-down version of the Spring edition.  We appreciate your time and any donations.  Please spread the word and help support student art and culture.

-I'm cycling from Metula to Eilat about 560 km starting the 20th of April, to raise awareness and support the Maguen David Adom (equivalent Red Cross in Israel)  Work and effort. Please help with something.

-Desde hace mucho tiempo tengo muchas ganas de andar en bicla desde Metula hasta Eilat que son aproximadamente 560km dividido en 5 diferentes días y he estado entrenando mucho tiempo para hacer esto, se me hizo buena idea hacerlo por una causa, entonces pensé que Maguen David Adom que es el equivalente en Mex de la Cruz Roja ,era la mejor organización para hacerlo.

Dependiendo del clima y de condiciones tengo pensado salir maso menos el 20 de abril. 

Ahora si cáiganse con VARO y CON LO QUE GUSTE COOPERAR

Enrique Sissa (sissaenrique@gmail.com)

story:
My name is Kuba, I am 32. Unfortunately in 2010 I had a very serious accident which resulted in me becoming completely paralysed. From December 2013 I am totally bed bound which has further complicated my general health and well-being as I have developed extensive bed sores. It is pertinent to note that I require total assistance to perform even the most basic of tasks and functions therefore becoming reliant on medical personnel and other carers. I have been told that my dire situation could be changed for the better should I purchase a specially adapted wheelchair. I am currently in the process of raising the necessary funds in order to purchase this much needed item - unfortunately the cost is rather prohibitive, 17k, therefore I am appealing for financial assistance. Any donation, however small will be gratefully received.

Thank you

What is Arsenic?

Arsenic Magazine is a for-the-people, by-the-people online culture and lifestyle magazine based in the Arts District of downtown Los Angeles. We believe that the best source of awesomeness and beauty comes from you, not from the establishment. 

We update daily, bringing you content that you submit and our own original material - all curated with that sexy, edgy Arsenic aesthetic that we (and our loyal band of Arsenists) love so much.

Here's a behind-the-scenes video from one of our shoots:


Arsenic is all about giving YOU a voice.  We're independent, we're an army of passionate people, and we're not going to stop claiming victory in changing the game from the system telling you what's hot, to you telling the system! 

What's the money for?

We're going to use it to make Arsenic a better magazine for you! Here are the things we plan to do:

  • Better upload functionality - an easier way for you to submit your photos, video, and articles to Arsenic
  • Adding a suggestion box, the ability to like or comment on all pages, and sorting for popularity (instead of doing it by hand!)
  • An easier way for all of you to share stories and pics of events you go to - like one-off blogging where anyone can post relevant content on the fly. 
  • A search bar on the home page, so it's easy to access and find past content.
  • A faster website.  
  • A cleaner, faster, easier to read and navigate version of Arsenic for your phone or tablet.

And if we get more money than we're expecting, we have some sweet ambitions for Arsenic to reach even better heights! If we reach or go beyond our goal, these are some things we'd use the spare cash for:

  • An Arsenic Magazine App with upload functionality
  • A bigger, better Arsenic Headquarters & Studio complete with some dope top-of-the-line camera and editing equipment.  And budgets to produce shoots!
  • We have an amazing team at Arsenic, but right now they all work for free, more money means we could pay for the transportation, lunches, laptops, cell phones and even a stipend for all their hard work. 
  • Mini-satellite offices globally. 

Here is a screenshot of our current homepage:

Other Ways You Can Help

Broke? It's cool, we are too. You can help Arsenic out by:

  • Tweeting, reblogging, reposting, and regramming our #ArsenicGoGo Campaign! If you use the share button on the indiegogo site, we'll be able to track your love and thank you personally! Tag #ArsenicGoGo to share our campaign, and use igg.me/at/arsenicmagazine to link to our page!
  • Keep reading and submitting to Arsenic!
  • Share the love and share our magazine!

We are so, so pumped to help you create a bigger, better Arsenic! It is, after all, YOUR magazine - we just help you run it.

http://www.arsenicthemagazine.com

story:
¿Qué?

Demiurgus es la obra que crea el concepto literario de «praeterhistoria ucrónica» y que sirve de base a una revisión profunda de la Historia que conocemos.

Toledo, año 2217. BJ es un científico cuya anodina vida da un giro el día que su mujer muere en un accidente. Desde entonces, se encerrará cada vez más en su trabajo, desesperado y aislado de la sociedad, hasta que hace un descubrimiento que cambiará su existencia y también la historia.

Pronto averiguará, sin embargo, que no se puede jugar a ser dios inocuamente, y que aquello en lo que había puesto su esperanza se ha transformado, de improviso, en el mayor reto al que ser humano se haya enfrentado jamás.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Jaime Arias.

Abogado y escritor extremeño afincado en Toledo, Jaime Arias es Licenciado en Derecho por la Universidad de Castilla-La Mancha y se ha dedicado a la labor jurídica durante muchos años, ha ganado varios premios de relato corto y ha publicado otras dos novelas hasta la fecha: Charlot quiere morir y Ave de Fortuna.

Estudioso de Filosofía del Derecho, enamorado del arte y la historia, aficionado al cine y las nuevas tecnologías, y colaborador habitual de varios medios online.

Escritor versátil y elegante, apasionado de las historias que describen las pulsiones interiores del ser humano y el drama de vivir.

Siempre en busca de la historia definitiva.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«―Señor Caherarsal, ¿me ha oído? ―le insistió el Presidente del Tribunal.
          ―¿Qué? ―preguntó BJ, volviendo en sí.
          ―Preste usted más atención, por favor ―le reconvino el Presidente―. Póngase en pie. Se le informa de su derecho a no declarar contra sí mismo y a no confesarse culpable. Si va usted a declarar, responda a las preguntas del Ministerio Fiscal. ¿Puede hacerlo?
          ―Sí, señoría ―replicó BJ, cada vez más acalorado.
          El Fiscal intervino.
          ―Con la venia, señoría. Señor Caherarsal, ¿puede decirme cuál es su profesión y a qué se dedica?
          BJ lo miró como estuviera viendo un fantasma. Las formas se difuminaban ante sus ojos y los sonidos adquirían extrañas modulaciones, el suelo se movía y las paredes parecían estar hechas de humo que danzara sobre una gran hoguera. Todo estaba girando. Se frotó los ojos y aclaró la garganta.
          ―No hace falta que gaste usted la energía en preguntarme, señor Fiscal ―respondió BJ―. Déjeme contarle todo como sucedió, aunque sé que usted quiere hacer su trabajo. Pero le ahorraré esfuerzos. Sí, confieso: engañé a mi ayudante, la convencí para lograr una autorización para entrar en el DAR5 (no crea usted que no sé cómo se llama ese lugar, en realidad lo sé todo de él). Nos disfrazamos, nos colamos y con toda la cara del mundo pusimos en marcha el reactor. ¿Y sabe usted por qué? Porque soy científico, porque estaba convencido de que podía viajar en el tiempo y porque estaba desesperado. Si hubiera usted tenido una mujer como la mía, si hubiera usted perdido a alguien tan increíble, también habría hecho lo mismo, aunque para ello hubiera tenido que enfrentarse a un ejército entero, aunque hubiera tenido que romper a mordiscos una montaña… Y sí, lo digo aquí y ahora, yo que soy científico, yo que soy uno de los mejores investigadores del mundo: ¡se puede viajar en el tiempo! ¡Yo lo hice! Fue una experiencia traumática, dolorosa, peligrosa y contradictoria. Pero lo hice. Y ustedes no tienen ni idea de lo que eso significa…
          Se desplomó. Se cayó, simplemente. Perdió el conocimiento y dio un tremendo golpe contra el suelo de tarima. Los oficiales acudieron rápidamente a auxiliarlo, el Presidente suspendió la vista y el secretario llamó a la ambulancia. La escena fue grabada íntegramente por las cámaras del Juzgado. Todos y cada uno de los asistentes creyeron que estaba loco, salvo uno, que calló y meditó en su interior, abrumado por lo que había presenciado en las horas y días anteriores»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Demiurgus que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jaime Arias vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
¿Qué?

Sangre de cristal narra las aventuras de Danae a su llegada a una prestigiosa universidad nórdica; con elementos de fantasía en un alarde de genialidad creativa.

Agua. Aire. Fuego. Tierra.

El sueño de Danae Winters es obtener una plaza en Somnus, una facultad al norte de Europa donde se reúnen los mayores talentos del continente. Estrellas del deporte, artistas, genios… El futuro del mundo concentrado en un único espacio.

Pero cuando le confirman su admisión, Danae descubre que la universidad esconde un antiguo secreto, un misterio ancestral que mantiene el mundo a salvo desde hace milenios. No podrá escapar del destino que le ha sido reservado: convertirse en una Elemental y luchar contra los djinns, sus némesis, unas criaturas malévolas que encarnan el desequilibrio del universo.

Entre luchas, amistades y traiciones, la joven y sus amigos necesitarán de la ayuda de los cuatro elementos para enfrentarse a la misión de sus vidas.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a L.P. Larraya.

La vida de esta autora de Pamplona ha estado marcada desde siempre por lo académico. De padre abogado y madre profesora, ellos le enseñaron el placer de la lectura, convirtiéndose este en pasión a lo largo de los años. Tras completar sus estudios en la Universidad de Navarra y la UPNA, ejerce como maestra en un colegio de Primaria. Reparte el tiempo libre entre su familia, sus amigos y las historias que integran su vida.

L.P. Larraya debutó en 2012 con Las correas de Julia, una historia de suspense a la que siguió en 2014 la novela negra Cuando los ángeles caen. Ahora su estilo da un giro de 180º al publicar Sangre de cristal, la primera parte de la trilogía fantástica de La Hija del Viento.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí, una muestra de lo que encontrarás en sus páginas:

«―Mi nombre es Andrew Halloway y, aunque durante vuestras primeras horas en Somnus me presenté como el director de la Oficina de Nuevos Estudiantes, os mentí. Todos os mentimos aquel día.
     Danae se acordaba de sus caras: el rector, la señorita Bessoin, Halloway. ¿Qué quería decir con que les habían mentido?
     ―En realidad, Somnus es una mentira ―tras oír un par de gritos ahogados, Halloway se corrigió a sí mismo―. O, más bien, una tapadera. Esta universidad se fundó con la única intención de congregar y proteger a personas como vosotros. Como nosotros, a decir verdad.
     ¿El resto se sentirían como ella? ¿Serían conscientes de que les estaba llamando raros? El truco de incluirse en la manada para que confiaran en él como uno más no daría resultado con Danae. Al menos, su monólogo había servido para que incluso Cecily enmudeciera.
     ―Quiero que entendáis una premisa fundamental: sois especiales. El mundo os ha bombardeado durante años con la idea de lo genial que es ser normal y pertenecer a la media. Es decir, con la idea de ser mediocres. En la sociedad, el clavo que sobresale es el que recibe el martillazo. Y vosotros, amigos míos, vosotros brilláis desde que nacisteis.
     Incluso el ruido de su corazón, que latía con inusitada fuerza, le parecía a Danae escandaloso en medio del silencio que abnegaba sus oídos.
     ―En la antigüedad, cuando éramos más numerosos, recorríamos los pueblos y ciudades buscando a los nuestros. Les explicaban quiénes eran en realidad y los entrenaban para su misión, que también es la vuestra. Pero las cosas fueron cambiando: la imprenta, los periódicos, el motor a vapor… Los nuevos avances facilitaron el acceso a la información y nos impidió movernos con tanta libertad ―Halloway bajó el tono―. Tuvimos que escondernos mejor.
     ―Esto es lo que puedo contaros por el momento, y creedme, es suficiente ―hubo murmullos de descontento que acalló con un gesto―. Es vuestro momento de decidir. Podéis salir de aquí y convenceros de que ha sido una broma. Pero también podéis aceptar vuestro destino: no será fácil; la preparación será dura, física y moralmente; tendréis que dejar las clases y cualquier anhelo de vida común que pudierais desear. Es decir, podéis convertiros en aquello para lo que habéis nacido»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 980€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Sangre de cristal que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y L.P. Larraya vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Al menos, su monólogo había servido para que incluso Cecily enmudeciera.     ―Quiero que entendáis una premisa fundamental: sois especiales. El mundo os ha bombardeado durante años con la idea de lo genial que es ser normal y pertenecer a la media. Es decir, con la idea de ser mediocres. En la sociedad, el clavo que sobresale es el que recibe el martillazo. Y vosotros, amigos míos, vosotros brilláis desde que nacisteis.     Incluso el ruido de su corazón, que latía con inusitada fuerza, le parecía a Danae escandaloso en medio del silencio que abnegaba sus oídos.     ―En la antigüedad, cuando éramos más numerosos, recorríamos los pueblos y ciudades buscando a los nuestros. Les explicaban quiénes eran en realidad y los entrenaban para su misión, que también es la vuestra. Pero las cosas fueron cambiando: la imprenta, los periódicos, el motor a vapor… Los nuevos avances facilitaron el acceso a la información y nos impidió movernos con tanta libertad ―Halloway bajó el tono―. Tuvimos que escondernos mejor.     ―Esto es lo que puedo contaros por el momento, y creedme, es suficiente ―hubo murmullos de descontento que acalló con un gesto―. Es vuestro momento de decidir. Podéis salir de aquí y convenceros de que ha sido una broma. Pero también podéis aceptar vuestro destino: no será fácil; la preparación será dura, física y moralmente; tendréis que dejar las clases y cualquier anhelo de vida común que pudierais desear. Es decir, podéis convertiros en aquello para lo que habéis nacido»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 980€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Sangre de cristal que saldría después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y L.P. Larraya vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
This is the one of a kind life story of our dear elder, teacher and friend Mala Spotted Eagle.

Mala grew up in Nevada, with his famous father Rolling Thunder, his Shoshone mother Spotted Fawn, as well as other relatives, Elders and friends, yet amidst the predominant white supremacist culture, in the face of much hardship and oppression.
Learning from a variety of elders from different native traditions, he became a strong advocate for tolerance, diversity and kindness, and he dedicated much of his life to building intercultural communities as well as sharing his understanding of how to tend a relationship with Mother Earth, in workshops, talks and ceremonies with Westerners in the US and Europe. 

After being on the road for many decades and sharing the knowledge of his indigenous ancestors and Elders, plus his own life experiences, with those willing to listen, Mala decided to go ahead with bringing this information into a written form. 

This book is for us…

This book will be a fascinating read for anyone with an open heart, who is interested in implementing wisdom in their every day life, that is rooted in a deep connection to nature. Mala's writings are a treasure chest for people who love storytelling, for people who would like to learn about a spiritual Way of Life and for those who are reconnecting to Mother Earth.  In it you will find stories and knowledge that can help you to become a better caretaker of Mother Earth. 




Through Mala’s personal experiences and the ancestral traditional knowledge that was passed on to him by native Elders, the reader gets insight and and ideas of how people connect and relate to Nature and Spirit. Mala lived in and helped to oversee the Inter Tribal Camp Meta Tantay for ten years, which his parents had founded out in the Nevada desert, he worked as a drug-and alcohol counselor for many years and committed himself to build an ecological community project guided by native principles in Oregon. 

With this book Mala hopes to reach people on a heart level; for them to walk gently on Mother Earth and to live a life with purpose. He hopes to raise awareness for being equally connected to every life form on the planet.

His message is simple and clear: Embrace whatever comes your way and embrace it with loving energy, unconditionally. If we open ourselves to the beauty that is in everything and are willing to learn from what we encounter throughout our lives, we truly live our lives in the way that it is meant to be, and we will find the beauty within ourselves.

The state of Mala's health at this point is critical, and therefore this book will very likely be one of his last gifts for the world, and a heritage of his life path. 
 
Please Support Us

The book has been written and edited, and everything is ready for the self-publishing-process. 
The costs needed for that are too high to cover for Mala himself or his family, so our heartfelt wish is for anyone that his teachings, songs or stories have touched in these past decades, to step up together and make a joint effort to bring these stories into print. 

Please take a moment to donate! We need 3,000 € for the initial publishing process itself, plus as many pre-orders for the books as possible. 

So please safe a copy for yourself, or several copies for you and your beloved ones, AND send whatever little Extra that is a sweet spot for you right now: Any amount that is doable and feels like a profound and meaningful contribution to you! 

We are also very happy if you forward this campaign to your friends and family, so they can join in to support, too. 

Got Questions?

If you have any questions about the book, the publishing progress or Mala's health and wellbeing, you are very welcome to get in touch with Hermine Schuring, Mala's good friend and the author of the book in Vienna, Austria, through the Indiegogo-Contact Form. 

Thank you so much for reading this and for all your good thoughts, prayers, blessings and active help and support to make this book project happen! 

Greetings and Blessings, 

Elke Loepthien – Campaign Organizer

Hermine Schuring – Author 

Mala Spotted Eagle

story:
I Believe That Great Sex Can Change The World!

Non-Monogamy . . . say what? You mean swinging, polyamory, and stuff like that?

Yep, you got it! There is too much stigma and shame around sexuality in our society, too much fear.  I’m Dr. Liz Powell - a psychologist, speaker, coach, and author of my new book Building Open Relationships: Your hands-on guide to swinging, polyamory, and beyond.

Curious about non-monogamy but you just don’t know how to actually make it work? Have you been non-monogamous for a while and now you’re ready to fine tune your skills?  Have you read “that book” on non-monogamy and thought to yourself, “well that sounds great, but how do I actually DO this?”

I hear you. There are LOTS of questions when it comes to ethical non-monogamy. That’s why I’m writing my new book Building Open Relationships: Your hands-on guide to swinging, polyamory, and beyond.  And I need your help to bring this book to the world!

Sex-positive books like this one can open up a healthy dialogue and give people the tools and resources they need to confidently speak their truth, ask for what they want, and be comfortable in their own skin. These aren’t just important skills in the bedroom - when you’re able to own what’s true for you in the bedroom, it’s a lot easier to own what’s true for you everywhere in your life. This book can help.

What’s this book really about?

Building Open Relationships is a practical, applied resource to help you navigate the world of ethical non-monogamy. Inside you’ll find worksheets, checklists, conversation starters, and tips. As a sex educator and psychologist, I believe that Great Sex Can Change The World, and I’m on a mission to help as many people as I can to understand and embrace the sexual revolution that’s happening in the world right now. I’m a non-monogamous person myself and I’ve been working with non-monogamous folks for almost a decade. I’ve included my biggest mistakes in the book, so you’ll get to learn from what I’ve already done wrong!

How You Can Help

The book is nearly complete! I’ve been writing since 2017, and living it for decades. Now’s the time when I need your help to turn the written words into actual books that people can start using to improve their relationships - or explore new ones!

When you support this book, you’ll get first access to the book and exclusive access to new merchandise that’s only available through this campaign.  Your funds will help me cover the expenses involved in creating and publishing a book – graphic design, editing, promotion, and the time it takes for me to complete and deliver this book to you.

Budget

  •  $6000 to allow me to take time away from my main business to focus on (finishing) writing, reviewing, editing, and finalizing the book.
  • $3500 for graphic design work. This includes the cover design, graphics, worksheets (including fillable PDFs), and the interior design of the book for print and ebook formats.
  • $700 for copy editing
  • $1500 for Indiegogo and credit card processing fees
  • $5000 for printing and shipping books and other rewards
  • $ 1200 for contingency/overflow

     Risks & Challenges

    No matter what, I'm putting this book out into the world - that's why I selected the "keep what you raise" option. The biggest difference here is that reaching this goal lets me dedicate more time to get the book out sooner. If I raise the full goal, I can dive deep into the process and have the book out quickly. If not, I may need to spend more time on my main work, and may need to cut back on some production costs (less nice books, fewer worksheets).

    Other ways you can help

    SPREAD THE WORD!

    Even if you can’t make a financial contribution at this time, tell your friends and colleagues about this book. Let the media know. Shout from the rooftops that Great Sex Can Change The World through Building Open Relationships. Here are some ways you can help:

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to share, tweet, like, G+, or email this campaign to your friends. That raises the “Gogo Factor” and could lang a spot on the front page!
    • Talk about the Building Open Relationships book and campaign on your podcast or on your blog
    • Invite me to do a Facebook Live with you! 

    GET A FREE SAMPLE!

    Go to http://buildingopenrelationships.com/ and sign up for free updates!

story:
Maim Your Characters

How Injuries Work in Fiction 

Coming September 4th, 2017, from Even Keel Press

Click here to download a 100+ page sample! 

Maim Your Characters is the definitive guide to using wounds and injuries to their greatest effect in your story. Learn not only the six critical parts of an injury plot, but more importantly, how to make sure that the injury you’re inflicting matters.

With in-depth analysis of nine different injury plots in popular fiction and a walkthrough of how to build your own, this book is the guide to using injuries in your story. Written by a paramedic with a decade of experience, Maim Your Characters will teach you what to do — and what not to.

This book also includes a sneak preview of the upcoming Blood on the Page, a book of injuries to incorporate into your tales. If Maim Your Characters is the how and why of injuring characters, then Blood on the Page is the what. 

 

What You Get

Maim Your Characters is a 400-page book that talks not only about existing injury plots, but walks you through plot creation step-by-step. In addition, two original injury plots were written for the book as part of demonstration and walk-through of plot creation. 

There are several versions available for readers: 

  • Signed Print Copies.
    Inscriptions are available, and I'm more than happy to sign a copy just for you! I'll reach out with an email asking how you'd like the book to be inscribed, and who to make it out to. See below for shipping information. 
     
  • Signed Digital Copies. 
    Digital copies of Maim Your Characters will be custom-generated, including a special signed page at the front of the book. The process takes effort, since each copy has to be re-exported by hand after the image is included, but it's worth it to make you happy. 
     
  • Executive Producer Status for the upcoming Blood on the Page. 
    Executive Producers are those who've chosen to contribute $100 or more to the campaign. Blood on the Page requires not just a copyeditor and proofreader, but a medical editor for checking the facts presented in the book; because it contains over 40 injuries and pieces of general information, having another set of eyes on the medicine is necessary -- and expensive. 

A Word on Shipping 

First, while I aim to get all orders out the door on or before launch date, that will depend on matters not entirely within my control; Amazon must first ship me the books, I need to sign them, get envelopes, pay postage, and ship them out. This is part of the reason each print copy will include a bonus digital copy for free, which will be released on launch day. That way you don't miss out on the book!

  • Standard Shipping: In the US, this will be via Media Mail, to save expense for all of us. 
  • Express Shipping: In the US, this will be via USPS Priority Mail 3-Day service in a flat-rate box or envelope. 
  • International Shipping: All international orders will ship via USPS First Class International mail; delivery time will vary based on travel time, customs, etc. I claim no responsibility for your book getting held up in customs. 

Pricing: The way IndieGoGo sets this up, the express tiers have to be different perks, not an option within each perk. Thus the different perks with the same pricing. The pricing difference is in the shipping, which will be revealed when you click Get This Perk.  In the US, standard shipping is $5; Express shipping is $8. 

The ScriptMedic Mission 

On the surface, it may seem that the ScriptMedic ethos is simply a dedication to accuracy. But when it comes to medicine, popular misconceptions can be lethal. 

The blog started as a way to get more accurate information into the world about how injuries and illnesses and medicine works, but it's snowballed into so much more. An entire family of content experts have sprung up to help writers with topics from psychology to firefighting and from autism to the everyday lives of German people. 

The goal is to help writers write more accurate stories, ones that their audiences can believe. 

 

Risks & Challenges

A few months ago, I made a terrifying leap. 

My personal income was predicated on having  two day jobs: full-time and per-diem. However, I moved to the per-diem job full-time, which has left me with a significant income gap. Part of that has been filled by regular support on Patreon, but sales of this book and the upcoming Blood on the Page will hopefully replace that lost income, or more. These books will form the basis of a writing career, or be the reason I go back to having two day jobs. 

A lot more is riding on this in terms of my personal future than meets the eye. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's okay! There are lots of other ways to help: 

  • Share the campaign on Twitter, Facebook, and other places. 
  • Tell your writer friends and critique groups about the book. 
  • Let authors you love know about the book! 
  • Take a selfie with your copy (when it comes in) and share it on your social media.

And that's all there is to it! 

Thanks so much for your gracious preorders and I hope together we can make this book a success! 

xoxo, Samantha Keel
